title: 2003 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
listing_details: sound system, and automatic climate control.
excerpt: This 2003 BMW M3 coupe was registered in Arizona for 20 years prior to the current owner’s purchase in 2025, and subsequent work included replacing the rod bearings, motor mounts, drive belt and pulleys, and radiator hoses. Finished in Imola Red over black Nappa leather upholstery, the car is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six linked with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. It was optioned with the Premium and Cold Weather Packages and is further equipped with 18″ M double-spoke Style 67 wheels, a power sunroof, xenon headlights, Park Distance Control parking sensors, heated power-adjustable front sport seats, a Harman Kardon sound system, and automatic climate control. This E46 M3 is offered by the seller on behalf of the current owner with a clean Carfax report and a clean Maryland title in the owner’s name.

The car is finished in Imola Red (405) and features Shadowline trim as well as xenon headlights, fog lights, a glass sunroof, rain-sensing windshield wipers, Park Distance Control parking sensors, a trunk lid spoiler, and quad exhaust outlets. The rear quarter window seals were replaced in 2025. Close-up photographs of the exterior finish and trim are shown in the gallery below.

The 18″ M double-spoke Style 67 wheels are mounted with Nitto Motivo tires. The car was factory equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and braking is provided by four-wheel ventilated discs. The rear fender liners, tie rods, right front control arm bushings, and front sway bar links were replaced in 2025.

The heated power-adjustable front sport seats are upholstered in black Nappa leather, and Titan Shadow trim adorns the dash and door panels. Carpeted floor mats line the footwells, and interior amenities include cruise control, a Harman Kardon sound system, a CD stereo, and automatic climate control.

The leather-wrapped multifunction steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline, along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 124k miles, approximately 250 miles of which were added under current ownership.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque. The spark plugs and ignition coil were replaced in 2023, and work completed in December 2025 included replacing the rod bearings, coolant expansion tank, motor mounts, drive belt and pulley, and radiator hoses.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. The differential fluid was changed in 2023.
See the full CARFAX Report for additional information
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

title: 2005 BMW M3 Coupe Competition Package 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2005 BMW M3 coupe was specified new with the Competition Package, and it is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six linked with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. The car was acquired by the seller in 2013, and it has been retrofitted with a 4.10:1 limited-slip differential, an aftermarket cat-back exhaust system, an aluminum radiator, and a short shifter. Finished in Alpine White over black Nappa leather upholstery, the car is equipped with 19″ M cross-spoke Style 163M wheels, a power sunroof, power-adjustable front sport seats, a Harman Kardon sound system, and automatic climate control. This E46 M3 has 143k miles and is now offered at no reserve with manufacturer’s literature, an accident-free Carfax report, and a clean Virginia title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Alpine White (300) and is equipped with Shadowline trim as well as fog lights, a glass sunroof, rain-sensing windshield wipers, LED taillights, a trunk lid spoiler, and quad exhaust outlets. The front bumper has been repainted to address stone chips, according to the seller. Aging trim is noted at the base of the windshield and rear side windows, and additional photos of the exterior condition are viewable in the gallery below.

The 19″ M cross-spoke Style 163M wheels are mounted with 245/35 front 275/30 rear Hankook Ventus V12 Evo2 tires. The car was factory equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and braking is provided by four-wheel ventilated discs. Curb marks are visible on the left-rear wheel.

The cabin features power-adjustable front sport seats upholstered in black Nappa leather, and replacement gloss-black trim accents the dash and door panels. A short shifter has been installed, and appointments include cruise control, a BMW Business CD stereo, a Harman Kardon sound system, and automatic climate control. Wear is present on the shift knob.

The Alcantara-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 143k miles, over 60k of which were added under current ownership.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque. An aftermarket aluminum radiator and cooling fans have been added, along with silicone coolant hoses. The decorative valve cover has been removed and is included in the sale.

Power is routed to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. The car is equipped with an aftermarket cat-back exhaust system. The seller tells us the differential has been retrofitted with 4.10:1 gears and that the driveshaft center support bearing was replaced under current ownership. A replacement clutch is said to have been installed in 2025.
See the full CARFAX Report for additional information
The Carfax report indicates the vehicle was stolen in January 2011, and it lists open manufacturer safety recalls in 2014 and 2015.

title: Supercharged 2002 BMW M3 Coupe
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 coupe is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six fitted with a Vortech supercharger and linked with a six-speed SMG sequential transmission. It is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic over Imola Red Nappa leather and has a limited-slip differential, a sunroof, xenon headlights, rear parking sensors, and 19″ Style 67 wheels as well as heated power-adjustable front sport seats, a CD stereo, a Harman Kardon sound system, cruise control, and automatic climate control. The car was acquired by the current owner in 2005 and has 93k miles. This E46 M3 is now offered on dealer consignment at no reserve with an owner’s manual, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Arizona title.

The car is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic (354) with Shadowline trim and has a sunroof, xenon headlights, fog lights, rear parking sensors, and quadruple exhaust outlets. There are scuffs on the front valance, and close-up photos of the exterior are provided in the gallery below.

The 19″ M double-spoke Style 67 wheels are mounted with Michelin Pilot Super Sport tires. The car was factory equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and braking is provided by four-wheel ventilated discs. The brake fluid was flushed in January 2025.

The heated power-adjustable front sport seats are upholstered in Imola Red Nappa leather, and interior amenities include a CD stereo, a Harman Kardon sound system, cruise control, and automatic climate control.

The leather-wrapped multifunction steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 93k miles.
The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six has been fitted with a Vortech supercharger and an ESS Tuning intake manifold assembly. An oil change and coolant flush was performed in January 2025.
Power is sent to the rear wheels via a six-speed SMG sequential transmission and a limited-slip differential. The differential fluids were flushed in January 2025.
See the full CARFAX Report for additional information
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

title: 2006 BMW M3 Competition Package Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 coupe was optioned with the Competition Package and has 77k miles following the seller’s purchase in 2024. Finished in Jet Black over black Nappa leather upholstery, the car is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six linked with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. Features include 19″ M cross-spoke Style 163M wheels, aftermarket coilover suspension, a power sunroof, xenon headlights, a Harman Kardon sound system, heated power-adjustable front sport seats, navigation, and automatic climate control. This E46 M3 is offered with a Carfax report and a clean Virginia title.

The car is finished in Jet Black (668) and is fitted with Shadowline trim as well as xenon headlights, fog lights, a glass sunroof, rain-sensing windshield wipers, LED taillights, a trunk lid spoiler, and quad exhaust outlets. There is a scratch on the left side mirror cover and the rear bumper cover. An August 2014 entry on the Carfax report lists “minor damage” to the front and left front of the car, while subsequent entries in August 2023, February 2024, and September 2024 list “minor damage” with no additional information. Close-up photographs of the exterior blemishes are shown in the gallery below.

Silver 19″ M cross-spoke Style 163M wheels have curb marks and are mounted with Michelin Pilot Sport tires. The car was factory equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and braking is provided by four-wheel ventilated discs. MCS coilover suspension, Vorschlag camber plates, and Rogue Engineering rear camber arms have been installed. The front lower control arms, front struts, brake pads, and rotors are said to have been replaced under previous ownership.

The heated power-adjustable front sport seats are upholstered in black Nappa leather, and interior amenities include cruise control, navigation, a Harman Kardon sound system, and automatic climate control.

The Alcantara-wrapped multifunction steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline, along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 77k miles, approximately 2k of which were added under current ownership.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque. The seller tells us that the double-VANOS system has been upgraded and the rod bearings have been replaced. The water pump, thermostat, and drive belt were replaced in ~13k miles ago, while the spark plugs, ignition coils, power steering hoses, and fuel filter were replaced in 2023.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. A subframe reinforcement kit was reportedly installed in 2017, and an AutoSolutions short shifter is fitted.
See the full CARFAX Report for additional information
The Carfax report lists the aforementioned August 2014, August 2023, February 2024, and September 2024 damages.

title: 2005 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed

title: 2005 BMW M3 Competition Package Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This Alpine White 2005 BMW M3 coupe is equipped with the Competition Package and its 3.2-liter S54 inline-six is backed by a six-speed manual transmission. The car was first registered in Florida and was acquired in 2021 by the owner, with whom it has subsequently traveled 1k of its 91k miles. The car was factory equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and the selling dealer states that the DSC sensors were replaced in preparation for the sale. title: 3,100-Mile 2004 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2004 BMW M3 convertible was purchased new by the original owner at King Cars in Freehold, New Jersey, and used sparingly as a summer weekend car in New York until 2025. Recently acquired by the selling dealer, this E46 M3 is now offered with a window sticker, manufacturer’s literature, an accident-free Carfax report, and a clean New Jersey title.

The car is finished in Silver Gray Metallic (A08) and features a black convertible soft top as well as xenon headlights, fog lights, rain-sensing windshield wipers, LED taillights, Park Distance Control parking sensors, and quad exhaust outlets.
The 19″ M double-spoke Style 67 wheels are mounted with Continental tires. The car was factory equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and braking is provided by four-wheel ventilated discs.

Black Nappa leather covers the heated power-adjustable front Sport seats, and Brushed Aluminum Shadow trim accents the dash and door panels. The interior also offers a Harman Kardon sound system, cruise control, navigation, and automatic climate control. The seller notes delamination on the rearview mirror.

The leather-wrapped multifunction steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 3,100 miles.
The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque. The battery, fuel pumps, and front rotors were reportedly replaced in preparation for the sale.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential.

The window sticker notes initial delivery to King Cars in Freehold, New Jersey, and lists factory equipment, colors, options, and a total suggested retail price of $64,095. Manufacturer’s literature and accessories are also included with the car.

title: 2002 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed

title: 2006 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 convertible is finished in Silver Gray Metallic over Imola Red Nappa leather and is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six linked with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. It was specified with the Cold Weather Package and is further equipped with a black convertible soft top, a body-color hardtop, revised exhaust components, 18″ Rim Alloy Canada wheels, xenon headlights, and a carbon-fiber rear diffuser in addition to heated front sport seats, navigation, a Harman Kardon sound system, and automatic climate control. Acquired by the seller on BaT in October 2024, this E46 M3 has 87k miles and is now offered with a window sticker, manufacturer’s literature, service records, a removable windscreen, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Washington State title in the seller’s name.

Bubbles in the paint are noted on the left mirror trim. Some of the photos used in the listing and in the gallery below were taken in January and August 2025.

The 18″ Rim Alloy Canada wheels are wrapped in 235/40 front and 265/35 rear Michelin Pilot Super Sport tires. The car was factory equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and the suspension features Hotchkis sway bars and Koni shock absorbers. Braking is provided by four-wheel ventilated discs. The heated power-adjustable front sport seats are upholstered in Imola Red Nappa leather, while Brushed Aluminum Shadow trim accents the interior. Replacement floor mats have been fitted, and appointments include a CD stereo, navigation, a Harman Kardon sound system, cruise control, a short-throw shifter, and automatic climate control.

The leather-wrapped multifunction steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 87k miles, approximately 2k of which have been added under current ownership.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six is noted to have been modified with European-specification exhaust headers and catalytic converters. The valve cover gasket and spark plugs were changed in July 2024, and the battery was replaced in August 2025.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. A Dinan muffler has been installed, and the transmission and differential fluids were changed in July 2024.

title: 2003 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2003 BMW M3 coupe has remained registered in California from new through the seller’s purchase in 2018, and it is finished in Laguna Seca Blue over black Nappa leather upholstery. Powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six linked with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential, the car has been fitted with KW coilover suspension, AC Schnitzer strut tower braces, and an Eventuri air intake. Additional features include 19″ M cross-spoke Style 163M wheels, a power sunroof, xenon headlights, power-adjustable front sport seats, a Harman Kardon sound system, a BMW Business CD stereo, and automatic climate control. This E46 M3 has 114k miles and is now offered with a clean Carfax report and a clean California title.

The car is finished in Laguna Seca Blue (448) and features Shadowline trim and has been fitted with black grilles and a carbon-fiber rear diffuser. Additional exterior details include xenon headlights, fog lights, a glass sunroof, rain-sensing windshield wipers, a trunk lid spoiler, and quad exhaust outlets. The front bumper cover was refinished under current ownership, while the seller believes the rear bumper cover was refinished under previous ownership. Close-up photographs of the exterior finish and trim are shown in the gallery below.

The 19″ M cross-spoke Style 163M wheels were refinished and mounted with Michelin Pilot Sport 4S tires in May 2025. The car was factory equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and a KW coilover suspension has been fitted. Braking is provided by four-wheel ventilated discs.

The cabin features power-adjustable front sport seats upholstered in black Nappa leather, and Brushed Aluminum Shadow trim accents the dash and door panels. Interior amenities include cruise control, a Harman Kardon sound system, a BMW Business CD stereo, and automatic climate control. The seller notes wear on the front seats.

The Alcantara-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching. Instrumentation consists of a 185-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a variable redline, and gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 114k miles, approximately 18k of which were added under current ownership.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque. An Eventuri air intake and AC Schnitzer front strut tower brace are fitted, and the double-VANOS system has been serviced under prior ownership, per the seller. Under current ownership, at 109k miles, the valves were adjusted and rear oxygen sensors were replaced. The thermostat, oil temp sensor, fuel tank vent valve, spark plugs, and ignition coils are said to have been replaced within the last 12 months.

Power is routed to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. A welded subframe reinforcement kit was installed under prior ownership, and the subframe bushings were replaced and differential was serviced at that time.

title: 2001 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed NASA GTS4 Race Car
excerpt: This 2001 BMW M3 coupe has been modified to race in NASA’s GTS4 class. The interior has been stripped and fitted with safety equipment, and front and rear wings have been added along with carbon-fiber panels, vents, and intakes. The car rides on 18×10.5″ BimmerWorld TA16 forged wheels and has adjustable coilover suspension as well as AP Racing brakes. Power comes from built 3.3-liter S54 inline-six with a CSL-style airbox and a custom tune, and it is linked to a six-speed manual transmission and a variable-ramp limited-slip differential. Acquired by the seller in 2024 and most recently raced in 2025, this E46 M3 is now offered at no reserve in Colorado on a bill of sale with service records, a NASA logbook, extra wheels and tires, and spare parts.

The car is finished in Carbon Black Metallic (416), and the exterior has been modified with a CSL-style fiberglass trunk lid and a BimmerWorld carbon-fiber rear wing, diffuser, and doors. Widened and vented front fenders and carbon-fiber doors were also installed, and the rear fenders were modified by Hi-Speed Motorsports. HARD Motorsports polycarbonate ducted windows have been fitted along with an LED rain light and a Lexan rear window.

Up front, a Zebulon Motorsports splitter has been installed along with an Artisan Research air dam, and N15 Design fender ducts. The carbon-fiber roof and hood are from AJ Hartman, and the hood has Trackspec Motorsports vents and AeroCatch latches. The carbon-fiber headlight blanks and folding tow hook are from BimmerWorld.
The suspension features the following components:

The front strut tower mounts were repaired and reinforced in preparation for the sale, photos of which are provided in the gallery below. Note that some of the images show the mounts prior to the work.

BimmerWorld TA16 forged wheels measure 18×10.5″ all around, and they are mounted over Bimmerworld studs with spacers 295/30 Hoosier slicks. AP Racing Pro 5000 calipers and J-hook discs were used along with an EPIC Motorsport MK60 anti-lock system and Ferodo pads. Both the brake pads and rotor rings were recently replaced, per the seller, along with the power steering rack and high-pressure hose.

The interior has been stripped and was fitted with a Racetech RT4200HR seat in 2025, and the cage was made by JPC Fabrication. The driver is also provided a BimmerWorld net and Schroth six-point harness, which carry 2023 and 2026 expiration dates. The seller notes replacement units for both are included. A BimmerWorld-sourced convex mirror, an AJ Hartmann carbon-fiber dashboard plate, and an Artisan Research carbon-fiber floor plate have been fitted along with a Chillout Quantum Pro system, an AiM Smartycam HD 2.1, and an RTD Motorsports aluminum short shifter with an AKG double-shear selector rod.
The OMP wheel is mounted on a quick-release hub, and the driver is provided an AiM MXS dashboard. The seller has driven 2k of the 157k miles indicated, racing the car throughout the 2025 season.

The 3.3-liter S54 inline-six was built by JVR Performance in 2023. It features JE forged pistons, Arrow connecting rods, Schrick camshafts, ARP hardware, BimmerWorld rod bearings, Supertech valves and springs, and a VAC Motorsports “Stage 3” cylinder head. A BimmerWorld CSL-style intake was fitted, and the tune is from EPIC Motorsports. BimmerWorld cooling components are paired with a SPAL fan, and the stepped headers are from SuperSprint. BimmerWorld solid mounts were also used, and the seller estimates the engine has 3k miles on the current build. Dynamometer results in the gallery indicate peak output of 337.84 horsepower and 265.23 lb-ft of torque.

The rear subframe has been reinforced and tied into the rear cage, and a HiSpeed Motorsports side-exit exhaust system was installed. The six-speed manual is linked to a BimmerWorld/Diffsonline 4.10 variable-ramp, triple-clutch differential.
The car has been raced in NASA’s GTS4 class, most recently in 2025.
Records of modifications and spare components are included in the sale as shown in the gallery.

Now with 30k miles, this modified E46 M3 is offered in California at no reserve with records, spare parts, and a clean Montana title.
The car is finished in Schwarz 2 (668) and features Shadowline trim as well as front splitters, xenon headlights, fog lights, a glass sunroof, a trunk lid spoiler, and quad exhaust outlets.

The car rides on Bilstein coilover suspension with aftermarket sway bars. The brakes were sourced from an F80 M3, and 19″ ZCP-style wheels wear staggered Michelin tires that are said to have been recently installed.

The heated and power-adjustable front sport seats are gray Nappa leather, and the cabin features a black dashboard with Titan Shadow trim accents. Interior amenities include cruise control, navigation, and automatic climate control. Bavsound speakers and a short-shift kit have been fitted.

The multifunction leather-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. Auxiliary gauges are mounted on the column. The digital odometer indicates 30k miles, approximately 1,500 of which were added under current ownership.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was rebuilt by Pure Performance with forged pistons, connecting rods, a performance crankshaft, and a high-performance oil pump and bearings. The Stage 2 supercharger is from Active Autowerke and is intercooled, and ID1040 injectors, a methanol-injection system, a TiAL blow-off valve, an oil cooler, a 120mm crankshaft pulley and hub, and a 535 LPH fuel pump were installed. The car is currently tuned for E85 fuel, and the seller states that it can run on 91-octane and more.

The engine was previously tuned by HTE Performance Tuning, at which time peak output was measured at 612.84 horsepower. The seller notes that estimated wheel horsepower is currently 540, stating that a factory crank pulley has since been reinstalled in place of an aftermarket larger crank pulley.

The six-speed manual transmission is linked to a limited-slip differential and has a twin-disc clutch. A subframe reinforcement kit was installed in 2022, and aftermarket catalytic converters were also fitted.
Records documenting the modifications are presented in the gallery.
The Carfax report shows no reported accidents or damage. An odometer reading of 29,800 miles was recorded in March 2025, and the title also lists this reading.

The car has not been inspected by the California Air Resources Board or Bureau of Automotive Repair. The seller states the car will not pass a California emissions inspection in its current configuration; therefore, it cannot be sold to an in-state private-party buyer.

The car is finished in Mystic Blue Metallic (A07) with tri-color accents on the hood and rear bumper cover, and details include Shadowline trim, xenon headlights, recovery hooks, LED taillights, a carbon-fiber trunk lid spoiler, and quad exhaust outlets. Fitment gaps around the front bumper cover are noted in the gallery.

Apex ARC 18″wheels are mounted over extended wheel studs and wear 225/45 front and 255/40 rear Bridgestone RE-71R tires. The car rides on AST 5200-series coilovers with remote reservoirs, and further modifications include adjustable sway bar mounts, extended sway bar end links, brake cooling ducts, adjustable rear lower control arms, a front strut tower brace, and a Mason Engineering rear subframe and strut tower support. Braking components consist of cryo-treated Stoptech rotors, Cobalt brake pads, and Goodridge stainless-steel hoses, per the seller.

The cabin has been modified for track day activities with a pair of OMP WRC-R fixed-back racing seats with Schroth six-point harnesses that are attached to the Kirk Racing four-point bolt-in roll bar. The side curtain airbags have been removed, and the sunroof and associated mechanism have been replaced with a carbon-fiber panel. Larger shift paddles have been installed on the steering wheel, and an AiM MXS 1.2 digital dash display with a Smarty Cam sits on the column.

The multifunction leather-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 79k miles, approximately 4k miles of which were added under current ownership.
The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six has been fitted with a Sprint Booster throttle module and an electric cooling fan. Service reported by the seller includes the following:

Power is routed to the rear wheels via a six-speed SMG sequential transmission, and the SMG pump was relocated to the “smuggler’s bin” at the rear of the engine compartment. The seller tells us the limited-slip differential has been replaced, and a subframe reinforcement kit was reportedly installed in 2019.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other damage and lists at least one manufacturer recall.

title: 2003 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2003 BMW M3 convertible is finished in Laguna Seca Blue over Gray leather and has 164k miles following history in Arkansas and Florida. It is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six linked with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential, and other equipment includes 19″ M cross-spoke wheels, xenon headlights, power-adjustable front Sport seats, a Harman Kardon sound system, and a Black soft top. The seller purchased the car in December 2024 and has since added approximately 1k of the 164k indicated miles. Work under current ownership has included replacing the A/C belt, fuel filter, and VANOS filter. This E46 M3 is now offered at no reserve with a window sticker, the owner’s manual, service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Florida title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Laguna Seca Blue (448) and features a Black convertible soft top as well as xenon headlights, fog lights, rain-sensing windshield wipers, and quad exhaust outlets. The headlight level sensor was replaced in September 2024.

The 19″ M cross-spoke Style 163M wheels are mounted with Michelin Pilot Super Sport tires. The car was factory-equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and braking is provided by four-wheel ventilated discs. A brake fluid flush was performed in February 2025, and the rear shocks were reportedly replaced under current ownership.

The power-adjustable front Sport seats and door-panel inserts are upholstered in Gray leather, and the cabin is outfitted with a black dashboard with Titan Shadow trim accents. Interior amenities include a Harman Kardon sound system, cruise control, a BMW Business CD stereo, automatic climate control, and driver’s seat memory settings. The left-rear window regulator was replaced in June 2023, the blower motor resistor and ambient temperature sensor were replaced in September 2024, wiring for the instrument cluster and temperature sensor was repaired, and the front airbags were replaced in February 2025, and the air-conditioning system belt was replaced in June 2025. The trim on the left door and right side of the dash is peeling.

The multifunction leather-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 164k miles, approximately 1k of which were added under current ownership.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque. A warranty vehicle inquiry report notes that the rod bearing recall service was performed in October 2004, and the seller tells us that the double-VANOS system has been upgraded. Records indicate that the fuel pump and sender assembly were replaced in April 2024, the ignition coils were replaced in June 2024, the body control module was replaced in December 2024, the fuel filter was replaced in June 2025, and the oil has been changed and the VANOS filter replaced under current ownership.
Power is routed to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. The differential mount, lock plate, and seals were replaced in June 2023.

The window sticker notes initial delivery to BMW of Little Rock in Arkansas and lists factory equipment, colors, options, and a total suggested retail price of $57,570. Manufacturer’s literature and recent service records are also included in the sale.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

title: Supercharged 2005 BMW M3 Coupe Competition Package 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2005 BMW M3 coupe is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six that was fitted with an ESS Tuning supercharger and a titanium exhaust system under current ownership in March 2022. The car was optioned with the Competition Package, and it was specified in Titanium Silver Metallic over black Nappa leather. Carbon-fiber bodywork has been added, and additional equipment includes a six-speed manual transmission, a limited-slip differential, 19″ M cross-spoke wheels, coilover suspension, an H&R anti-sway bar, a power sunroof, xenon headlights, power-adjustable front sport seats, navigation, a Harman Kardon sound system, and automatic climate control. The cooling system was overhauled circa 2022. This E46 M3 has 91k miles and is now offered by the seller on behalf of the owner with the owner’s manual, a spare trunk lid, additional removed parts, and a clean California title in the owner’s name.

The car is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic (354) and has been fitted with a carbon-fiber front lip, rocker-panel extensions, mirror caps, rear spoiler, and diffuser. Additional features include xenon headlights, tinted windows, and a sunroof. The Carfax report lists an accident in August 2007 as well as damage in July 2019.

The 19″ Style 163M wheels are mounted with Michelin tires. Aftermarket coilovers have been added along with an H&R anti-sway bar. The car was factory equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and braking is provided by four-wheel ventilated discs.

The power-adjustable front sport seats and door-panel inserts are upholstered in black Nappa leather, and the cabin features a black dashboard with aluminum trim accents. Interior amenities include cruise control, navigation, a Harman Kardon sound system, and automatic climate control. The shifter is a replacement.

The M-branded speedometer has a flat bottom, a tricolor centering stripe, and leather and Alcantara accents. Instrumentation includes a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 91k miles, approximately 12k of which were added under current ownership.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six has was fitted with an ESS Tuning supercharger in March 2022, reportedly at a cost of nearly $10k. The spark plugs were replaced in January 2022, and the cooling system was overhauled in February of the same year. A titanium exhaust system has also been installed.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. The gearbox oil was replaced in May 2023.
The Carfax report shows the aforementioned accident and damage.
The car most recently passed a California emissions check in November 2023, but various aftermarket changes are not CARB-compliant. The sale includes components that were removed during the build.

title: 2004 BMW M3 Convertible
excerpt: This 2004 BMW M3 convertible was purchased in 2016 by the seller following registration history in Texas and California. Finished in Imola Red over black Nappa leather upholstery, the car is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six linked with a six-speed SMG sequential transmission and a limited-slip differential. Features include a black soft top, a removable hardtop, 19″ M double-spoke wheels, xenon headlights, heated power-adjustable front sport seats, navigation, a Harman Kardon sound system, and automatic climate control. Work performed since 2023 has included replacing the steering rack, tie rods, front lower control arm bushings, tires, power steering pump, battery, and valve cover gasket.  This E46 M3 has 102k miles and is offered with manufacturer’s literature, service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean California title.

The car is finished in Imola Red (405) and features a black convertible soft top as well as a removable hardtop, xenon headlights, parking sensors, fog lights, rain-sensing windshield wipers, LED taillights, and quad exhaust outlets. The hardtop headliner has been replaced, and there are scrapes on the underside of the front bumper cover. Close-up photographs of the exterior finish and trim are shown in the gallery below.

The 19″ M double-spoke Style 67 wheels are fitted with Michelin Pilot Sport tires that were mounted in 2024. The car was factory equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and braking is provided by four-wheel ventilated discs. The power steering hose was replaced in 2021, the power steering pump, tie rods, steering rack, and front lower control arm bushings were replaced in 2023, and the brake fluid was changed in 2025.

The cabin features heated power-adjustable front sport seats upholstered in black Nappa leather, and Brushed Aluminum Shadow trim accents the dash and door panels. Interior amenities include cruise control, navigation, a CD stereo, Harman Kardon audio, and automatic climate control. According to the seller, the glove box is difficult to open without the key.

The multifunction leather-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline, along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 102k miles, approximately 50k of which were added under current ownership.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque. The engine mounts and spark plugs were replaced in 2021, the battery was replaced in 2024, and the valve cover gasket was replaced in 2025. The hood struts were replaced in preparation for the sale.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed SMG sequential transmission and a limited-slip differential. The differential output shaft seal was replaced in 2021, and the transmission fluid was changed in 2023.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

title: 2004 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2004 BMW M3 convertible was initially registered in California and was imported to Canada in 2010. It was later returned to the US and spent time in Arizona and Texas before the current owner’s May 2022 purchase. The car is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six linked with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential and is finished in Alpine White over Cinnamon Nappa leather. Features include the Cold Weather Package, an aftermarket exhaust system, a black soft top, 19″ M double-spoke wheels, xenon headlights, heated power-adjustable front sport seats, a Harman Kardon sound system, and automatic climate control. The car is finished in Alpine White (300) and features a black convertible soft top as well as xenon headlights, fog lights, rain-sensing windshield wipers, LED taillights, and quad exhaust outlets. The seller tells us that the windshield cowl has been replaced. The Carfax report lists accident damage in a June 2008 entry. There are blemishes on the front valance.

The 19″ M double-spoke Style 67 wheels show signs of curb rash and are mounted with Falken Azenis tires. The car was factory-equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and braking is provided by four-wheel ventilated discs. A brake fluid flush was performed in November 2023.

The heated power-adjustable front sport seats are trimmed in Cinnamon Nappa leather. Interior amenities include cruise control, a BMW Business CD stereo, a Harman Kardon sound system, and automatic climate control. The glove box latch was replaced in preparation for the sale. There is a loose seam on the driver’s left bolster, and the rear plastic headliner brackets are broken.

The multifunction leather-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 78k miles, approximately 6k of which were added under current ownership.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory-rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque, and it has been fitted with an aftermarket exhaust system. The fuel tank sender assembly, the fuel sender seal, and the fuel tank cap were replaced in November 2023.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. The left axle shaft assembly was replaced, along with the driveshaft center support and flex disc, in August 2022, and a jack pad was replaced in November 2023.
The window sticker lists initial delivery to Midwestern BMW in Dublin, Ohio, along with factory colors, options, standard features, and a total suggested retail price of $61,170.
The Carfax report shows the aforementioned damage, and a June 2022 entry states that the “vehicle was retired from use” in Quebec, Canada.

title: 2005 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed

Powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six linked with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential, it is finished in Silver Gray Metallic over Imola Red Nappa leather upholstery. A December 2015 entry on the Carfax report lists “minor damage” to the front of the car, and the seller states that the front bumper cover was refinished and the front fenders were blended. The right-rear fender panel shows evidence of paintwork, and exterior blemishes include paint touch-ups on the rear bumper cover, blemished window trim, faded roundels, and paint chips on forward-facing surfaces.

Gray-finished 19″ M cross-spoke Style 163M wheels are mounted with Continental ExtremeContact tires. The car was factory equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and braking is provided by four-wheel ventilated discs. The brake pads and rotors were replaced and the brake fluid was changed in April 2025.

The heated power-adjustable front sport seats and door-panel inserts are upholstered in Imola Red Nappa leather, and the cabin features a black dashboard with Brushed Aluminum Shadow trim accents. Interior amenities include cruise control, navigation, a Harman Kardon sound system, and automatic climate control. The right airbag assembly was replaced in 2022, the right dashboard trim is loose, and there is wear on the driver’s seat and around the interior touch points.

The multifunction leather-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline, along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 121k miles, approximately 12k of which were added under current ownership.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque. The seller notes that the double-VANOS system was upgraded in August 2017, and the connecting rod bearings and rod bolts were replaced in April 2025.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. A subframe reinforcement kit was added in April 2025, at which time a short shifter and polyurethane bushings were added and the driveshaft guibo was replaced.
The Carfax report lists the aforementioned December 2015 damage.

title: 2002 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 coupe was purchased new by a friend of the seller’s and was gifted to them in February 2025 upon the owner’s passing. The seller received the car in a non-running state, and subsequent work included replacing various belts and pulleys, the starter, spark plugs, fuel filter, battery, and the oil filter housing and oil pan gaskets. It is finished in Topaz Blue Metallic over gray Nappa leather and is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six linked with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. Equipment includes 18″ M double-spoke wheels, heated front sport seats, a Harman Kardon sound system, automatic climate control, a rear-view camera, and a touchscreen Alpine head unit with smartphone integration. This E46 M3 has 101k miles, and it is now offered with the owner’s manual, service records, a clean Carfax report, and a Texas title.

The car is finished in Topaz Blue Metallic (364) and is equipped with Shadowline trim as well as xenon headlights, fog lights, a trunk lid spoiler, and quad exhaust outlets. The power function of the side mirrors does not work, and detailed photos of imperfections are provided in the gallery.

The 18″ M double-spoke Style 67 wheels are mounted with Michelin Pilot Super Sport tires. The car was factory equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and braking is provided by four-wheel ventilated discs. The parking brake shoes were replaced, and a brake fluid flush was performed in February 2025. The front left strut is in need of replacement.

The heated front sport seats and door-panel inserts are upholstered in gray Nappa leather, and the cabin features a black dashboard with Titan Shadow trim accents. Interior amenities include cruise control, a Harman Kardon sound system, automatic climate control, and a touchscreen Alpine head unit with an integrated rear-view camera, as well as Apple CarPlay and Android Auto capability.

The multifunction leather-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline, along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 101k miles.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque. The drive belts and pulleys, spark plugs, fuel filter, battery, hood insulation pad, engine oil, and the coolant were replaced in February 2025, the oil filter housing gasket and the oil pan gasket were replaced in April 2025, and the starter was replaced in June 2025.
Power is routed to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. The differential fluid was replaced in February 2025.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other damage.
The Texas title lists the model as “M3I.”

title: 2004 BMW M3 Coupe
excerpt: This 2004 BMW M3 coupe is finished in Silver Gray Metallic over Imola Red Nappa leather and powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six linked with a six-speed SMG sequential transmission. The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque. Work performed in 2025 is said to have included an oil change along with replacement of the following components:
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed SMG sequential transmission and a limited-slip differential.

title: 25k-Mile 2006 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 coupe was first registered in Texas and spent time in Florida before it was sold on BaT in January 2020 and August 2020, and it now has 25k miles. Specified in Imola Red II over Grey Nappa leather upholstery, the car is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six linked with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. It has been retrofitted with 19″ M cross-spoke wheels, a satellite radio receiver, and Bavsound speakers, and additional equipment includes a power sunroof, power-adjustable front sport seats, a Euro-style center console, and automatic climate control. Service under previous ownership included a valve adjustment, service of the VANOS system utilizing Beisan parts, and replacement of the timing chain guide. Work in 2025 included an oil change and replacing the air conditioning condenser fan. Acquired by the seller in 2020, this E46 M3 is now offered with owner’s manuals, service records, two keys, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Virginia title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Imola Red II (405) and is equipped with Shadowline trim as well as fog lights, a glass sunroof, rain-sensing windshield wipers, LED taillights, a trunk lid spoiler, and quad exhaust outlets.

The 19″ M cross-spoke Style 163M wheels were installed in 2020, and they are mounted with 225/40 front 255/35 rear Michelin Pilot Sport 4S tires. The car was factory equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and braking is provided by four-wheel ventilated discs.

The power-adjustable front sport seats and door-panel inserts are upholstered in Grey Nappa leather, and the cabin features a black dashboard with Brushed Aluminum Shadow trim accents. Interior amenities include driver’s seat memory settings, cruise control, a BMW Business CD stereo, and automatic climate control. A European-style center console was fitted under previous ownership, along with replacement A-pillar trim pieces. The car was retrofitted with a satellite radio receiver and antenna along with Bavsound speakers under current ownership, per the seller.

The multifunction leather-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 25k miles, approximately 3k of which were added under current ownership.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque when new. Service under previous ownership in 2020 included replacing the timing chain guide, tensioner, and valve cover gasket, performing a valve adjustment, and installing a Beisan VANOS pump disc as well as Beisan solenoid seals and VANOS piston seals. The seller tells us the power steering line and reservoir were replaced in 2022, the oil was most recently changed in February 2025, and the AC condenser fan was reportedly replaced in July 2025.

Power is routed to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. Service in 2019 included a differential service and replacement of the transmission fluid and differential seals, according to the seller.
Manufacturer’s literature, two keys, and service records are included in the sale.
The Carfax report shows no accidents or other reported damage.

title: 2001 BMW M3 6-Speed Track Car
excerpt: This 2001 BMW M3 was modified for track use under previous ownership and was acquired by the seller on BaT in July 2022. Finished in Steel Grey Metallic, the car is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six linked with a six-speed manual transmission and limited-slip differential with 4.10:1 gearing. Equipment includes a CSL carbon-fiber intake, a Dr. Vanos system, a custom exhaust system, a BimmerWorld oil cooler, an Epic Motorsports ECU tune, an OS Giken flywheel and clutch, Eibach springs, JRZ dampers, Ground Control camber plates, a StopTech front big brake kit, 18″ Apex alloy wheels, bi-xenon headlights, and a sunroof delete. The interior features a roll cage, Recaro seats, Schroth harnesses, a MOMO steering wheel, auxiliary gauges, and an AiM Solo DL data logger. This E46 M3 track car is offered with a dyno graph, a Blackstone Laboratories oil report, an accident-free Carfax report, and a clean California title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Steel Grey Metallic with Shadowline trim. The factory sunroof was deleted with the installation of a replacement roof panel, and exterior details include carbon-fiber brake ducts, body-color front corner markers, bi-xenon headlights, a rear lip spoiler, and a single exhaust outlet. Damage is visible below the left taillight.

Black-finished 18” Apex ARC-8 wheels are mounted with BFGoodrich g-Force R1 tires and are secured to the hubs via an extended wheel stud conversion. Braking is handled by a StopTech big brake kit featuring red calipers over slotted and ventilated two-piece rotors joined by factory rear calipers over slotted and ventilated rotors. Suspension modifications include the following components:

The stripped cockpit houses Recaro ProRacer and Pole Position bucket seats for the driver and passenger, respectively. Appointments include a body-color roll cage with door bars as well as a BimmerWorld shifter, Schroth multi-point harnesses, and diamond-plate floor liners. The infotainment and climate control systems have been removed, along with the door window glass and associated mechanisms.

The suede-wrapped MOMO steering wheel is mounted on a quick-release hub and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. An AiM Solo DL digital lap timer/data logger is mounted in the center stack along with auxiliary gauges for oil pressure, coolant temperature, oil temperature, and air/fuel ratio. The digital odometer indicates 104k miles, less than 200 of which were added under current ownership.
The solid-mounted 3.2-liter S54 inline-six is modified with the following components:
A rod bearing recall is said to have been performed in 2004. A dyno graph and Blackstone Laboratories oil report are presented in the gallery.

Power is routed to the rear wheels through an OS Giken flywheel and twin-disc clutch, a solid-mounted rebuilt six-speed manual transmission, and a limited-slip differential with a RacingDiffs clutch pack and 4.10:1 gearing. A subframe reinforcement kit was reportedly installed in 2023.
The Carfax report is free of accidents and other reported damage and lists at least one open recall.
The car cannot pass a California emissions test in its current configuration. Therefore, it cannot be sold to an in-state private party.

title: 2006 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed

The multifunction leather-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 131k miles.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque. The selling dealer tells us that the double-VANOS system has been upgraded. Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential.

title: 2005 BMW M3 Competition Package 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2005 BMW M3 coupe is finished in Interlagos Blue Metallic over Grey Nappa leather and is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six linked with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. Now showing 30k miles, the car is equipped with the Competition and Premium packages, 19″ alloy wheels, xenon headlights, a power sunroof, heated power-adjustable front sport seats, automatic climate control, and a CD stereo linked to a Harman Kardon sound system. The seller purchased the car on BaT in October 2021 and an $11k service in 2024 included replacing the connecting rod bearings, overhauling the VANOS system, and reinforcing the rear subframe. title: LS7-Powered 2002 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 coupe was modified by its previous owner with the installation of a 7.0-liter LS7 V8 fitted with a wet-sump conversion along with a Tremec T56 Magnum six-speed manual transmission, a custom exhaust system, and an aluminum driveshaft and radiator. The suspension features H&R springs, Koni shocks, UUC sway bars, and Ground Control front adjustable-camber plates, while the braking system received Porsche 996 calipers, Euro CSL rotors, and stainless-steel lines. Finished in Steel Grey Metallic over Cinnamon Nappa leather, the car also has the Premium and Cold Weather packages as well as 19″ M cross-spoke wheels, a power sunroof, a Euro front bumper, and an Alpine touchscreen head unit. Purchased by its current owner on BaT in May 2024, this E46 M3 has 113k miles and is offered in Utah by the seller on behalf of its owner with a clean Carfax report and a clean Montana title in the name of the owner’s LLC.

The car is finished in Steel Grey Metallic (400) and is equipped with Shadowline trim and a European-style front bumper cover. Additional details include xenon headlights, a glass sunroof, a trunk-lid spoiler, and quad exhaust outlets. The bumper covers, side skirts, and lower headlight trim pieces were repainted under prior ownership, and reported work since then consisted of replacing the windshield and applying Xpel paint-protection film to the exterior painted surfaces. The rear Park Distance Control sensors are unreliable.

The 19″ M cross-spoke Style 163M wheels are mounted with Falken Azenis RT660 tires that measure 245/35 up front and 275/30 out back. The car was factory equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and the braking system was modified with Porsche 996 calipers, Euro CSL rotors, and stainless-steel lines. H&R sport springs and Koni shocks have been added, along with the following components:

The power-adjustable front sport seats are upholstered in Cinnamon Nappa leather and were refurbished under current ownership. The pillar covers were also replaced, and the center armrest was reupholstered in black with M tri-color stitching, which extends to the leather shift boot and parking-brake boot. WeatherTech liners are fitted in the footwells, and additional sound deadening has reportedly been added below the carpets. The Alpine touchscreen head unit is wired to an Alpine four-channel amplifier, a JBL 8″ powered subwoofer under the driver’s seat, and Bavarian Sound Works speakers. The air conditioning works, although the seat heaters, cruise control, and traction control are inoperative.

The multifunction steering wheel frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. Speedhut oil-pressure and oil-temperature gauges have been added ahead of the shifter. The digital odometer indicates 113k miles, approximately 100 of which were added under current ownership.

The 7.0L LS7 V8 crate engine was installed in June 2021 and features a wet-sump conversion that utilizes a Holley oil pan, a Melling high-pressure oil pump, and a PowerBond Race Performance harmonic damper. Cooling is through a Koyorad aluminum radiator with a SPAL electric fan and a Mishimoto adjustable fan controller. The exhaust system incorporates Vorshlag long-tube headers and 3″ stainless-steel pipes with Borla ProXS mufflers and a MagnaFlow X-pipe, catalytic converters, and resonators. Additional engine components include the following:
The engine oil was most recently changed in March 2024.

Power is routed to the rear wheels via a Tremec T56 Magnum six-speed manual transmission, a Vorshlag aluminum driveshaft, and a limited-slip differential, which was rebuilt with Racing Diffs components. A Tilton twin-disc clutch, flywheel, and throw-out bearing were also added. A Turner Motorsports front subframe reinforcement kit and a Practical Performance rear subframe kit were installed in 2020.
The Carfax report is free of accident or damage entries.

title: 2002 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
listing_details: E46 M3 "Big 3" 2022 Service by Rogue Engineering
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 coupe was serviced under prior ownership in 2022 with a VANOS rebuild, replacement of the rod bearings, and reinforcement of the rear subframe, while the four-wheel disc brakes were overhauled following the seller’s acquisition in 2024. Modifications include BC Racing BR Series coilovers and a Rogue Engineering front strut brace, short shift kit, anti-rasp pipe, and Diablo axle-back exhaust. This E46 M3 has 105k miles and is offered with manufacturer’s literature, service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean New Jersey title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Carbon Black Metallic (416) with Shadowline trim and features a glass sunroof, a trunk lid spoiler, fog lights, painted front reflectors, and clear LED side markers. The seller says that the rear window has been replaced. A paint correction was performed, a ceramic coating was applied, and the kidney grilles, taillights, and emblems were replaced in October 2024. The hood and front bumper cover were repainted in preparation for the sale.

The 18″ M double-spoke Style 67 wheels were refinished and mounted with 225/45 front and 255/40 rear Michelin Pilot Sport A/S tires in October 2024, at which time an alignment was performed. Zimmermann brake rotors and Akebono pads were installed and the front calipers were changed along with the fluid at that time. The car was factory equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC) and has been fitted with a Rogue Engineering RACEBRACE front strut brace and BC Racing BR Series coilovers.

The power-adjustable front sport seats and door panel inserts are upholstered in Grey Nappa leather, and the cabin features a black dashboard with Titan Shadow trim accents. Interior amenities include driver’s seat position memory, automatic climate control, cruise control, Harman Kardon audio, a center console armrest delete, and a Rogue Engineering OCTANE short shift kit with an illuminated F10 M5 knob as well as an AVIN AVANT infotainment display with Apple CarPlay and Android Auto.

The multifunction steering wheel has been re-wrapped in leather and features M-color stitching. Instrumentation includes a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 105k miles, approximately 3k of which were added under current ownership.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque. Service at Rogue Engineering in Upper Saddle River, New Jersey in March 2022 involved rebuilding the VANOS system and a valve adjustment in addition to replacing the valve cover gasket, rod bearings, and engine mounts. Work in September 2024 included installing NGK spark plugs, changing the oil, and replacing the fuel filter, fan clutch, and crankcase vent valve. The VANOS oil supply line, lower radiator hose, and coolant temperature sensor were replaced in January 2025.

Power is routed to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential, and fluid changes for each were performed in December 2021. The rear subframe was reinforced by Rogue Engineering in March 2022 at which time the driveshaft center support bearing, differential bushings, and the rear muffler hanger were replaced. The car is also fitted with a Rogue Engineering anti-rasp pipe and Diablo axle-back exhaust.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other damage.

The battery was replaced in August 2023, and maintenance performed in November 2024 involved cleaning the engine bay, undercarriage, and drivetrain with dry ice in addition to performing an inspection, changing the oil, and replacing a jack pad.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage. The rear subframe was inspected in 2025.

Powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six paired with a six-speed SMG sequential transmission, additional features include a limited-slip differential, a power-operated black soft top, xenon headlights, Park Distance Control parking sensors, 19″ M double-spoke Style 67 wheels, a Harman Kardon sound system, a wind deflector, navigation, and automatic climate control. This E46 M3 has 102k miles and is now offered with a window sticker, manufacturer’s literature, service records, a car cover, and a clean New Hampshire title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Jet Black (668) and is equipped with a power-operated black convertible soft top as well as xenon headlights with retractable washers, fog lights, rain-sensing windshield wipers, LED taillights, Park Distance Control parking sensors, and quad exhaust outlets. Photographs of blemishes including signs of corrosion on the left rocker panel and left door jamb are shown in the gallery along with scratches. The Carfax report shows damage in February 2008.

The 19″ M double-spoke Style 67 wheels are mounted with Michelin tires, and the car was factory equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC). The brake rotors and brake pads were replaced in April 2024 along with one brake caliper.

The cabin features heated power-adjustable front sport seats upholstered in Black leather, and Aluminum trim accents the dash and door panels. Interior amenities include driver-seat position memory settings, cruise control, navigation, a Harman Kardon sound system, a wind deflector, remote keyless entry, and automatic climate control.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 102k miles, approximately 17k of which were added under current ownership.
The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed SMG sequential transmission and a limited-slip differential.
The window sticker lists initial delivery to Herb Chambers BMW of Boston, Massachusetts, as well as factory colors, equipment, and a total suggested retail price of $67,070.
The Carfax report shows the aforementioned accident.

title: 2004 BMW M3 Convertible

There is an indentation on the lower portion of the right door and paint chips and blemishes on the front bumper cover. Close-up photographs of the exterior finish, trim, and paint meter readings are shown in the gallery below.

The 19″ M double-spoke Style 67 wheels have curb marks and are mounted with older Nitto Motivo tires measuring 225/40 up front and 255/35 out back. The car was factory equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and braking is provided by four-wheel ventilated discs.

The heated power-adjustable front sport seats and door-panel inserts are upholstered in Imola Red Nappa leather, and interior amenities include cruise control, a BMW Business CD stereo, Harman Kardon audio, and automatic climate control. There are scratches near the handbrake lever.

The multifunction leather-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline, along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 68k miles.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque. The head gasket was replaced in 2015, and work since 2020 has included replacement of the battery, valve gasket, and airbag control module.

The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

The heated power-adjustable front sport seats are upholstered in grey Nappa leather, and Titan Shadow trim adorns the dash and door panels. Interior amenities include cruise control, a BMW Business CD stereo, a remote six-disc CD changer, and automatic climate control.
