title: 2001 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2001 BMW M3 convertible has 65k miles following history on the East Coast and Midwest. The car is finished in Imola Red over gray Nappa leather and is powered by a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six linked with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. Additional equipment includes the Cold Weather Package, a black soft top, 18″ M double-spoke wheels, heated power-adjustable front sport seats, an aftermarket shift knob, and xenon headlights. The seller purchased the car in 2020, and the clutch, oil pan gasket, and alternator belt were replaced in 2023. This E46 M3 is now offered with a clean Illinois title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Imola Red (405) and is fitted with a black convertible soft top with a glass rear window. Other exterior details comprise xenon headlights, rain-sensing windshield wipers, fog lights, and quad exhaust outlets. The Carfax report notes that the car sustained “minor damage” in February 2023, which the seller attributes to another car scraping the front bumper cover. The front bumper cover was replaced to address the damage, and it is misaligned on the right side. The antenna is missing, and the convertible top has a tear.

This is a relist after the vehicle was previously sold on BaT in March 2025 and the winning bidder failed to follow through with their commitment to purchase. This was not due to any fault with the vehicle. The winner’s participation on BaT has been restricted and their buyer’s fee was not refunded.

The 18″ M double-spoke Style 67 wheels are mounted with Sumitomo HTR A/S P03 tires. The seller notes curb marks on the wheels. The car was factory-equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and braking is provided by four-wheel slotted and cross-drilled discs.

Heated power-adjustable front sport seats are upholstered in gray Nappa leather, and high-gloss black trim adorns the dash and door panels. Interior amenities include an aftermarket shift knob, cruise control, a BMW Business CD stereo, automatic climate control, and driver-seat memory settings. The seller notes blemishes on the center stack and console, missing wiring near the cigarette lighter, worn leather upholstery, and missing items from the toolkit.

The multi-function leather-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with auxiliary gauges. The digital odometer indicates 65k miles, approximately 5k of which were added under current ownership.
The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque. The alternator belt and oil pan gasket were replaced in September 2023.
Power is routed to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. The clutch was replaced in 2023.
The Carfax report notes the aforementioned damage entry.

title: 47k-Mile 2004 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2004 BMW M3 coupe was specified new in Jet Black over Cinnamon Nappa leather upholstery, and it is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six paired with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. Optioned with the Premium and Cold Weather packages, the car was retrofitted with Bilstein PSS10 coilovers and a Rogue Engineering exhaust system under previous ownership, and it is equipped with 19″ M double-spoke wheels, a power sunroof, xenon headlights, heated power-adjustable front sport seats, navigation, a Harman Kardon sound system, and automatic climate control. The car was registered in Connecticut and Texas before it was listed on BaT in September 2020, and it was subsequently acquired by the seller. Now indicating 47k miles, this E46 M3 is now offered at no reserve in Louisiana with owner’s manuals, a car cover, two keys, service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Colorado title.

The car is finished in Jet Black (668) and features front fog lights, xenon headlights, heated headlight washers, a sunroof, fender vents, and quad exhaust outlets. Paint protection film was applied to the hood, fenders, mirrors, and front valance under previous ownership, and the rear model designation badging was removed following the seller’s acquisition. Flaws include stone chips on the front bumper along with paint cracks on the rear bumper, and close-up photos of the finish and trim can be viewed in the gallery below.

Forged 19″ Style 67 wheels are wrapped in staggered-width Michelin Pilot Sport 4S tires that were installed in October 2020. The suspension is modified with Bilstein PSS10 adjustable coilovers, the anti-lock hydraulic pump was replaced and a brake fluid flush was performed in July 2020. The front and rear brake pads and rotors were replaced in March 2023.

The cabin features seats and door panel inserts upholstered in Cinnamon Nappa leather, and Premium Package equipment includes power-adjustable front seats with lumbar support, rain-sensing windshield wipers, an auto-dimming rear-view mirror, and a moonroof. Appointments include Titan Shadow trim, navigation, Harman Kardon audio, automatic climate control, cruise control, and a trunk-mounted battery tender. Aftermarket aluminum pedals were fitted under previous ownership, and the auto-dimming mirror was repaired in 2016. The passenger’s side curtain airbag and the headliner were replaced after the car struck a pothole in 2023. Dead pixels are shown on the navigation screen, the rearview mirror alarm button is inoperative, and wear is noted on the right side of the center console.

The multifunction leather-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 47k miles, approximately 8k of which were added under current ownership.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque. The oil pan gasket was replaced in 2021. The VANOS system and subframe were inspected when the oil was changed by Greff Motors of Metairie, Louisiana, in April 2025, the results of which are viewable in the gallery.

Power is routed to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. A Rogue Engineering exhaust system was installed under previous ownership, and the differential pinion seal was replaced in June 2021.
Manufacturer’s literature, two keys, a car cover, removed M3 badging, and service records are included in the sale.
The Carfax report shows no accidents or other reported damage.

title: 2005 BMW M3 Coupe Competition Package 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2005 BMW M3 is a blue-over-black coupe that was specified from the factory with the Competition Package and was acquired by the seller on BaT in April 2022. Subsequent work included overhauling the VANOS system, installing a MagnaFlow exhaust, retrimming the steering wheel, and replacing the rear shock absorbers. Power comes from a 3.2-liter inline-six linked with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential, and the car rides on 19″ M cross-spoke wheels. Additional equipment includes a power sunroof, xenon headlights, heated and power-adjustable front sport seats, a Harman Kardon sound system, and automatic climate control. This E46 M3 has 181k miles and is now offered at no reserve with partial service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Ohio title in the seller’s name.

Finished from the factory in Interlagos Blue Metallic (A30) with Shadowline trim, the car was repainted under previous ownership in 2019. Details include a glass sunroof, xenon headlights, fog lights, rain-sensing windshield wipers, LED taillights, a trunk lid spoiler, and quad exhaust outlets.

The 19″ M cross-spoke Style 163M wheels are mounted with a mixture of Michelin tires showing 2019 and 2021 date codes. The car was factory equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and the ZCP Competition Package added an upgraded steering rack and larger cross-drilled brake rotors. The left rear strut tower brace bracket was replaced in April 2022, and the rear shocks were changed in June 2023.

The heated power-adjustable front sport seats are upholstered in black Nappa leather, and Milled-Effect Aluminum trim adorns the dash and door panels. A ZHP-style shifter knob has been installed, and amenities include cruise control, a BMW Business CD stereo, Harman Kardon audio, and automatic climate control. Wear is noted on the outer bolster of the driver’s seat, and the center console armrest does not latch.

The steering wheel was re-wrapped in Alcantara with M-color stitching in March 2023, while color-matching material extends to the parking brake handle and boot. Instrumentation includes a 185-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a variable redline, and auxiliary gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 181k miles, approximately 4,800 of which have been added under current ownership.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six has been fitted with a Macht Schnell air intake boot and was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque. Work in 2021 included replacing the alternator, fuel filter, spark plugs, oxygen sensors, rod bearings, and drive belts and pulleys, while work in June 2023 involved replacing the VANOS unit, exhaust hub, oil line, upper timing chain guide, and camshaft bolts.

Power is routed to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. A MagnaFlow exhaust system has been fitted. The transmission fluid and mounts were changed in January 2021, and the flex disc was replaced in June 2023.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

title: 2006 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 convertible has 55k miles and has been registered in California since 2010. The car is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six linked with a six-speed manual transmission and is finished in Carbon Black Metallic over Black Nappa leather. Features include a limited-slip differential, an AutoSolutions shift kit, a clutch stop, a black soft top, xenon headlights, 18″ M double-spoke wheels, heated power-adjustable front sport seats, a Harman Kardon sound system, and automatic climate control. Work in April 2024 involved resealing the VANOS system. Purchased by the seller in 2019, this E46 M3 is now offered at no reserve with a window sticker, manufacturer’s literature, service records, and a clean California title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Carbon Black Metallic (416) and is equipped with a black convertible soft top as well as xenon headlights with washers, a wind deflector, fog lights, rain-sensing windshield wipers, LED tail lights, and quad exhaust outlets. Photographs of blemishes shown in the gallery include a chip on the left side mirror and the right-front window occasionally does not retract. There’s a leak where the convertible top meets the A-pillar, which was diagnosed as a drain unable to evacuate water at a high-enough rate to prevent water spilling over the drain hole. The Carfax report lists damage in April 2021, which the seller attributes to a parking lot incident that resulted in replacing the front bumper cover.

The 18″ M double-spoke Style 67 wheels are mounted with Michelin tires. The car was factory equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and braking is provided by four-wheel ventilated discs. The front struts and rear shocks were replaced in April 2022, and the brake fluid was flushed in April 2024. A front-lower thrust arm bushing has a split.

The cabin features heated power-adjustable front sport seats upholstered in Black Nappa leather, and interior amenities include cruise control, a BMW Business CD stereo, a Harman Kardon sound system, and automatic climate control. The center console is scuffed, the right-side dashboard trim is delaminating, and the glovebox latch is jammed.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 55k miles, approximately 9k of which were added under current ownership.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque. The VANOS system was resealed and an “Inspection 2” service was performed in April 2024 by Bavarium Autoworks of Mountain View, California. An oil change was carried out in March 2025. Associated service records are shown in the gallery.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. An AutoSolutions shift kit has been installed along with a clutch stop, and the clutch delay valve has been removed. The right-rear output shaft seal is seeping.
The window sticker lists initial delivery to BMW of Nashville, Tennessee, along with factory equipment, options, and a Total Suggested Retail Price of $63,045.
The Carfax report shows the aforementioned damage.

title: 2002 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 coupe is finished in Phoenix Yellow Metallic over black Nappa leather upholstery, and it is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six that was overhauled in 2020 with CP-Carillo forged pistons and replacement bearings, hardware, gaskets, and seals. The car was specified new with the Luxury Package and is equipped with a six-speed manual transmission, a limited-slip differential, 18″ M double-spoke wheels, a power sunroof, xenon headlights, power-adjustable front sport seats, a Harman Kardon sound system, and automatic climate control. Modifications include coilover suspension, a carbon-fiber rear diffuser, and a Kenwood CD stereo. Acquired by the current owner in 2021, this E46 M3 has 148k miles and is now offered at no reserve on dealer consignment with an engine invoice, a Carfax report, and a clean California title.

The car is finished in Phoenix Yellow Metallic (445) and is equipped with Shadowline trim as well as xenon headlights, fog lights, body-color front corner reflectors, a glass sunroof, a trunk lid spoiler, a carbon-fiber rear diffuser, and quad exhaust outlets. The Carfax report lists damage in a May 2004 entry, though no additional information is available. The selling dealer tells us that the bumper covers and the left side of the car were refinished to address faded paint. Additional photos of the paint and trim condition are viewable in the gallery below.

The 18″ M double-spoke Style 67 wheels are mounted with staggered-width Bridgestone Turanza front & Nexen N’Fera rear tires. The coilover suspension components have been installed, and the selling dealer notes that the anti-sway bar end links were recently replaced. The tire pressure monitoring sensors have been removed, the TPMS warning light is illuminated, and imperfections are visible on the wheels.

The power-adjustable front sport seats are upholstered in black Nappa leather, and Titan Shadow trim accents the dashboard and door panels. Interior amenities include position memory for the driver’s seat, adjustable lumbar support, cruise control, a Kenwood CD stereo, Harman Kardon audio, and automatic climate control. The selling dealer tells us a replacement right window motor and regulator have been installed. Wear is visible on portions of the interior trim, the left-inner door seal trim is loose, and the corresponding piece is missing from the right door opening.

A multifunction leather-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with supplementary gauges. The digital odometer indicates 148k miles, approximately 8k of which were added under current ownership. The oil temperature gauge is inoperative, and the oil warning light remains illuminated for a few seconds after the car is started, per the selling dealer.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was overhauled under previous ownership in 2020 following connecting rod bearing failure, and work included regrinding the crankshaft, machining the block, and installing CP-Carillo forged pistons, ACL rod bearings, King main bearings, ARP rod bolts, three of the connecting rods, and replacement gaskets and seals. Additional replacement components are listed on an invoice in the gallery. Oil seepage is noted from the valve cover gasket. The car most recently passed a California emissions test in December 2024.
Power is routed to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. The rear subframe mounts have been reinforced.
The Carfax report shows the aforementioned damage entry.
Head over to our friends at Car and Driver to check out their December 2001 First Drive for the E46 BMW M3 coupe.

title: 2005 BMW M3 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2005 BMW M3 coupe was initially delivered to BMW of Houston, Texas, and was purchased in 2021 from its original owner by the current owner, who subsequently serviced the VANOS and replaced the rod bearings. Finished in Titanium Silver Metallic over Grey Nappa leather upholstery, the car is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six linked with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. Features include the Premium Package, 19″ M double-spoke wheels, a power sunroof, xenon headlights, power-adjustable front sport seats, a Harman Kardon sound system, a BMW Business CD stereo, and automatic climate control. This E46 M3 has 195k miles and is offered at no reserve by the seller on behalf of his son, the current owner, with a window sticker, manufacturer’s literature, a Carfax report, and a clean California title in the owner’s name.

The car is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic (354) and is fitted with Shadowline trim as well as xenon headlights, fog lights, a glass sunroof, rain-sensing windshield wipers, LED tail lights, a trunk lid spoiler, and quad exhaust outlets. A February 2016 entry on the Carfax report lists “minor damage” to the right side, while a subsequent entry from October 2020 lists “minor damage” to the rear. There are paint chips on the forward-facing surfaces and scrapes on the right front bumper cover. Photographs of paint-meter readings are presented in the gallery.

The 19″ M double-spoke Style 67 wheels were refinished in 2024, at which time the Continental ExtremeContact Sport 02 tires were installed. The car was factory equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and braking is provided by four-wheel ventilated discs. The front control arm bushings were replaced in November 2024.
The power-adjustable front sport seats are upholstered in grey Nappa leather. Interior amenities include cruise control, a BMW Business CD stereo, Harman Kardon audio, and automatic climate control.

The multifunction leather-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline, along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 195k miles, approximately 4k of which were added under current ownership.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque. The VANOS was serviced in 2022, the battery and fuel pump were replaced in November 2024, and the connecting rod bearings were replaced in April 2025.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. The differential input shaft seal and all of the differential mounts were replaced in 2023.
The window sticker lists initial delivery to BMW of Houston, Texas, as well as factory colors, equipment, and a total suggested retail price of $56,395.
The Carfax report lists the aforementioned February 2016 and October 2020 damages.

title: 6k-Mile 2005 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2005 BMW M3 is a Silver Gray Metallic-finished coupe that has 6k miles and was previously listed on BaT in August 2023, and it has been fitted with KW coilovers and sway bar end links as well as a Rogue Engineering short shifter and shock mounts, a Vorsteiner CSL-style front bumper cover, 19″ BBS wheels, a European-specification BMW CSL-style rear decklid, a Vorsteiner carbon-fiber rear diffuser, and an Eisenmann exhaust system. Work performed in Decemeber 2024 by Enthusiast Auto Group of Cincinnati, Ohio, included fluid changes, rebuilding the VANOS system, repairing a window bump stop and rear sunshade trim, and replacing the timing chain tensioner seal, oil pan gasket, fuel filter, left kidney grille, rear trailing arm bushings, and hood struts. Powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six linked with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential, the car is further equipped with Black Nappa leather upholstery, a power sunroof, a power-operated rear sunshade, Harman Kardon audio, and heated power-adjustable front sport seats. This E46 M3 was purchased by the owner in 2025 and is now offered at no reserve with a window sticker, the owner’s manual, service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean California title in the current owner’s name.

The car is finished in Silver Gray Metallic and was modified in March 2025 by Enthusiast Auto Group, LLC of Cincinnati, Ohio, with a Vorsteiner CSL-style front bumper cover with carbon-fiber winglets as well as a European-specification BMW CSL-style rear decklid and a Vorsteiner carbon-fiber rear diffuser. The associated invoice is provided in the gallery below. Additional details include Shadowline trim, xenon headlights, a glass sunroof, rain-sensing windshield wipers, window tint, LED tail lights, and quad exhaust outlets. The hood struts and left kidney grille have been replaced and a window bump stop was repaired in 2024. XPEL Ultimate Plus paint protection film was applied to the front bumper and trunk, XPEL nano-ceramic tint was added to the glass all around, and XPEL protective film was affixed to the windshield in 2025.

The 19″ BBS multi-spoke wheels are mounted with Michelin tires. The car is equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), KW V3 coilovers, Rogue Engineering shock mounts, and KW sway bar end links. braking is provided by four-wheel ventilated discs. Work in 2024 included flushing the brake and power steering fluids in addition to replacing the rear trailing arm bushings.

The heated power-adjustable front sport seats are upholstered in black Nappa leather, and brushed aluminum shadow trim accents the dashboard, center console, and door panels. Interior appointments include automatic climate control, cruise control, front seat memory settings, a Rogue Engineering short shifter, a power-operated rear sunshade, and a Harman Kardon sound system. The rear sunshade trim was repaired in 2024, and imperfections on the center console and left door sill are highlighted in the gallery.

The multi-function leather-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 6k miles.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque. The battery, spark plugs, and air filters were replaced in December 2023. The double-VANOS system was rebuilt in December 2024, and additional service at this time involved replacing the timing belt tensioner seal, oil pan gasket, fuel filter, Constant Pressure Valve O-ring, and engine oil. The car passed an emissions inspection in March 2025.

Power is routed to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. The seller notes that the clutch-delay valve has been deleted. An Eisenmann exhaust system was fitted in April 2025.
The window sticker lists factory colors, equipment, options, and a total suggested retail price of $55,390.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

title: 40k-Mile 2006 BMW M3 Convertible
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 convertible was registered in California until 2022, and it was sold on BaT in June 2022 before it was acquired by the seller on BaT in September 2023. Finished in Imola Red II over black Nappa leather, the car is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six linked with a six-speed SMG sequential transmission and a limited-slip differential. A Bluetooth module and a USB interface were installed under current ownership, and additional equipment includes the Cold Weather Package, a black soft top, 19″ M double-spoke wheels, xenon headlights, power-adjustable sport front seats, Park Distance Control, Harman Kardon audio, navigation, and automatic climate control. This E46 M3 has 40k miles and is now offered by the seller with a window sticker, partial service records, three keys, a car cover, a clean Carfax report, and a clean New York title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Imola Red II (405) and features a black convertible soft top as well as xenon headlights, fog lights, rain-sensing windshield wipers, LED tail lights, Park Distance Control, and quad exhaust outlets. A paint correction was completed in 2022, and a ceramic coating is said to have been installed at that time. One of the headlight bulbs was replaced in October 2024. Scrapes are noted on the lower portion of the front bumper cover, and paint meter readings are viewable in the gallery below.

The 19″ M double-spoke Style 67 wheels are mounted with staggered-width Michelin Pilot Sport 4S tires that show date codes from 2021 and 2022. The car was factory equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and braking is provided by four-wheel ventilated discs. Amenities include automatic climate control, cruise control, Harman Kardon audio, navigation, an onboard computer, and replacement floor mats. The key entry transmitter was replaced in 2023, and a Bluetooth module and USB interface were installed under current ownership. The seller notes that the glove box strut was replaced and the cigarette lighter was repaired following their acquisition. An inspection report in the previous listing notes that the trunk struts are worn.

The multifunction leather-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 40k miles, approximately 1,500 of which were added under current ownership.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque. The oxygen sensor and engine temperature sensor were replaced in 2022, and the oil was most recently changed in October 2024.

title: 2003 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed

This E46 M3 has 115k miles and is now offered at no reserve with manufacturer’s literature, partial service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Florida title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Imola Red II (405) and features Shadowline trim as well as a glass sunroof, a front lip spoiler, xenon headlights, fog lights, rain-sensing windshield wipers, a trunk lid spoiler, and quad exhaust outlets. The driver’s side headlight housing was sealed and the bulb was replaced in August 2024. Scratches are present on the front lip spoiler.

This is a relist after the vehicle was previously sold on BaT in April 2025 and the winning bidder failed to follow through with their commitment to purchase. This was not due to any fault with the vehicle. The winner’s participation on BaT has been restricted and their buyer’s fee was not refunded.

Racing Dynamics 19″ RD2 alloy wheels are wrapped with 245/35 front and 275/30 rear Michelin Pilot Sport A/S 3+ tires. The car was factory equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and braking is provided by red-finished calipers mounted over cross-drilled and ventilated discs at all four corners. The front lower control arms and bushings were replaced in October 2024. There is a power steering fluid leak.

The heated and power-adjustable front sport seats and the rear bench are upholstered in black Nappa leather, while brushed aluminum trim accents the dashboard and door panels. Amenities include automatic climate control, cruise control, a BMW Business CD stereo, and a Harman Kardon sound system. Scratches are noted on various surfaces, and the left-side power door lock mechanism is not functional.

The multifunction leather-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 115k miles, approximately 6k of which have been added under current ownership.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque. The rod bearing recall service was performed in November 2004, and work since 2024 included changing the fluids and replacing the thermostat, fan clutch, radiator, spark plugs, ignition coils, and both coolant temperature sensors. The engine mounts need to be replaced, and an oil leak is evident.

Power is routed to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. A Remus USA muffler is noted to have been installed, and the center section of the exhaust system was replaced in January 2025. The rear subframe bushings are cracked, and the differential leaks.
Manufacturer’s literature and partial service records will accompany the vehicle.
The Carfax report is free of accidents and other reported damage.

title: Supercharged 2002 BMW M3 Coupe Track Car 6-Speed
excerpt: This Carbon Black Metallic 2002 BMW M3 coupe was modified for track duty with carbon-fiber bodywork, a gusseted cage, upgraded brakes, square 18″ APEX wheels, and an intercooled Active Autowerke supercharger fitted to the 3.2-liter S54 inline-six along with uprated fuel-system components. Polycarbonate windows, a Sparco racing seat, and aftermarket exhaust components have also been added, and the car retains its six-speed manual gearbox and limited-slip differential. Acquired by the current owner in 2021, this E46 M3 track car is offered at no reserve by the seller on behalf of their sister in Colorado with a Carfax report and a clean Montana title.

The car left the factory finished in Carbon Black Metallic (416), and it is fitted with a carbon-fiber vented hood, front fenders, roof panel, and CSL-style trunk lid. Hail damage is visible in the gallery, the E46 sedan-specification roof panel extends over the rear window, and the seller reports the windows have been replaced with polycarbonate units and the fog lights have been removed. The Carfax report lists damage report entries in September 2014 and May 2015, the latter of which lists “minor to moderate” damage to the front, front-left, and left parts of the vehicle.

Black APEX 18″ wheels are mounted with square 265/35 Falken Azenis tires. The front six-piston calipers are BMW Performance units, while the color-coordinated rears are Porsche specification. Drilled front discs and slotted/drilled rear rotors were utilized.

The race-prepped interior is equipped with a Sparco Circuit fixed-back racing seat, and portions of the factory dashboard and center console have been retained. The M-branded instrument cluster features a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 155k miles, approximately 5k of which were added under current ownership. The seller states the safety harness is not installed, but is included in the sale.
The gusseted roll cage is welded into the car and features A-pillar supports and fixed door bars.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six has been modified with an Active Autowerke “Level 3” supercharger and exhaust header as well as a front-mounted intercooler, and the seller tells us the rod bearings and VANOS system were upgraded in 2018. The fuel system has also been updated with high-flow injectors and an aftermarket pump, per the seller. An oil change was performed and the battery was replaced in preparation for the sale.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. The exhaust system has been modified with aftermarket mid-pipes, a bypass plate, and a stainless-steel muffler. The seller notes the rear subframe should be reinforced before the vehicle is raced on track.
The Carfax report lists the aforementioned damage reports and several manufacturer recalls.

The car was factory equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and braking is provided by yellow Brembo-branded multi-piston calipers over crossed-drilled and ventilated rotors at each corner. Close-up photos of the wheel condition are viewable in the gallery. The seller notes that the brake fluid was flushed approximately 800 miles ago.

The heated power-adjustable front sport seats are upholstered in black Nappa leather, and amenities include cruise control, navigation, Harman Kardon audio, automatic climate control, M3-branded floor mats, and alloy pedal covers.

Silver carbon-look trim extends from the steering wheel to the dashboard, center console, and door panels, and instrumentation includes a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates under 10k miles, nearly all of which were added under current ownership.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque, and it has been retrofitted with an aFe cold air intake. Work within the last 800 miles included oil and coolant changes along with replacing the battery, according to the seller.

Power is routed to the rear wheels via a six-speed SMG sequential transmission and a limited-slip differential. The seller tells us the transmission was serviced and the differential fluid was changed approximately 800 miles ago. A Rogue Engineering Diablo stainless-steel exhaust system and a Borla midpipe are said to have been installed. The car most recently passed a California emissions test in April 2025.
The Carfax report shows no accidents or other reported damage.

title: Original-Owner 2003 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2003 BMW M3 coupe was purchased new by the seller and has since been registered in Florida, and it now has 115k miles. Finished in Imola Red II over Black Nappa leather, the car is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six linked with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. It is fitted with 19″ M double-spoke wheels, Bilstein PSS10 coilover suspension, and a Macht Schnell intake charge pipe along with a power sunroof, xenon headlights, LED taillights, power-adjustable front seats, Harman Kardon audio, and automatic climate control. Work in the past year has included rebuilding the rear suspension and replacing the fuel pump seal, half shaft seals, belly pan, battery, and various interior and exterior components. Previously listed on BaT in September 2024, this E46 M3 is now offered at no reserve with a window sticker, the owner’s manuals, service records, spare parts, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Florida title.

The car is finished in Imola Red II (405) and is fitted with Shadowline trim as well as xenon headlights, fog lights, a glass sunroof, rain-sensing windshield wipers, LED taillights and turn signals, a trunk lid spoiler, tinted windows, and quad exhaust outlets. The windshield cowl and roof rack mounting covers were replaced in preparation for the sale along with the hood vent and windshield washer motor.

The 19″ M double-spoke Style 67 wheels are mounted with Nitto NT555 tires up front and Ironman Gen 3AS tires out back. The car was factory-equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC) that received two new pressure sensors in preparation for the sale. Bilstein PSS10 coilovers have been added, and in 2024 the rear suspension was overhauled with replacement subframe and trailing arm bushings as well as upper and lower ball joints. Trailing arm bushing limiters were installed at this time.

The front sport seats and door-panel inserts are upholstered in Black Nappa leather, and the cabin features a black dashboard with Titan Shadow trim accents. Interior amenities include cruise control, Harman Kardon audio, and automatic climate control. The passenger airbag was replaced under a manufacturer’s recall in July 2024, and the seatback covers were repaired the following month. An illuminated shift knob was installed, and additional work involved replacing the center console, rear ashtray, and the trim around the shifter. In preparation for the sale the ashtray insert was replaced along with the A-pillar covers, center console storage tray, and sunglass holder.

The multi-function leather-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 115k miles.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque. Modifications consist of a Macht Schnell intake charge pipe and a BMC air filter. The rod bearing recall service was performed in September 2004 and a valve adjustment was performed in 2017 at approximately 111k miles. The water pump, water pump pulley, thermostat, alternator, valve cover gasket, and various belts and hoses were replaced in 2019, approximately 1,200 miles ago. Maintenance in 2024 consisted of an oil change and installing a replacement battery and fuel pump seal.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. The differential bushings and seals and the half shaft seals were replaced in 2024, and work since the previous listing consisted of cleaning the undercarriage and fitting a replacement belly pan.

The window sticker shows initial delivery to Germain BMW of Naples, Florida, as well as factory colors, equipment, and a total suggested retail price of $54,220. Spare parts included in the sale are viewable in the image gallery below.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage and lists registration and service history with one owner in Florida.
The Florida title is listed as a duplicate.

title: 2002 BMW M3 Coupe
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 coupe was delivered new to Isringhausen Imports in Springfield, Illinois, and later spent time in multiple states before being acquired by the seller on BaT in October 2018. Work since then included installing 19″ Style 163M wheels, changing the fluids, rebuilding the VANOS system, retrofitting a rear subframe reinforcement kit, and replacing the battery, cooling fan clutch, various gaskets, and more as described below. Power comes from a 3.2-liter inline-six linked with a six-speed SMG sequential transmission and a limited-slip differential, and the car is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic over black Nappa leather. Additional equipment includes the Cold Weather and Premium Packages, Bilstein shocks, a sunroof, xenon headlights, rear Park Distance Control, heated front sport seats, a Harman Kardon sound system, and navigation. This E46 M3 has 101k miles and is now offered with a window sticker, manufacturer’s literature, service records, a Carfax report, and a clean California title in the name of the seller’s trust.

The car is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic (354) with Shadowline trim. Details include a glass sunroof, xenon headlights, fog lights, rear Park Distance Control, a trunk lid spoiler, and quad exhaust outlets. The power adjustability for the right side mirror does not work. A damage report is listed on a September 2021 entry on the Carfax report indicating “damage to left front” and “damage to front”, and the front bumper cover, air inlet grille, bumper cover reinforcement beam, turn signal assembly, left headlamp assembly, and inner fender liner was replaced as a result.

The 19″ Style 163M wheels are mounted with 245/35 Michelin Pilot Sport 4S tires up front and 275/30 Pirelli P Zero Nero tires out back. The car rides on adjustable Bilstein coilovers, and aftermarket rear control arms have been installed. Braking is provided by cross-drilled discs at all four corners. The front sway bar end links and control arms were replaced under current ownership, and the brake fluid was flushed in preparation for the sale.

The heated and power-adjustable front sport seats are upholstered in black Nappa leather that extends to the door panel inserts. Appointments include automatic climate control, cruise control, navigation, and a Harman Kardon sound system. The rearview mirror has been repaired, and the passenger airbag, parking brake lever, and center console and trim have been replaced. The seller states that while the AM/FM radio does not work, the CD changer portion of the head unit is functional.

The multifunction leather-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a variable redline, and gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The paddle shifters were replaced under current ownership. The digital odometer indicates 101k miles, approximately 51k of which have been added under current ownership.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque. The rod bearings were replaced in 2004, and work under current ownership involved rebuilding the VANOS system, installing a Beisen Systems exhaust camshaft sprocket hub, changing the fluids, and replacing the battery, cooling fan clutch, constant pressure valve, hood support struts, drive belts, and valve cover and oil pan gaskets.

Power is routed to the rear wheels via a six-speed SMG sequential transmission and a limited-slip differential. Work since 2022 involved installing a Turner Motorsports weld-in rear subframe reinforcement kit as well as replacing the guibo, gear position sensor, transmission mounts, pinion seals, and rear differential cover and bushings.

The window sticker shows initial delivery to Isringhausen Imports in Springfield, Illinois, and lists factory colors, equipment, and options. Manufacturer’s literature and service records will also be included in the sale.
The Carfax report shows the aforementioned damage report.

title: 2004 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2004 BMW M3 coupe was delivered new with a six-speed manual transmission, and it was refurbished, updated, and modified following the seller’s 2019 acquisition in California. Over $29k of work included overhauling the 3.2-liter inline-six and installing a VAC Motorsports oil pump upgrade kit, Beisan Systems VANOS components, a JB Racing lightweight flywheel, a Sachs performance clutch, a Wavetrac 4.10:1 limited-slip differential, a K&N intake, SuperSprint exhaust components, an electric cooling fan, Koni dampers, H&R front springs and anti-sway bars, STACK auxiliary gauges, and more. Finished in Jet Black over black Nappa leather, the car is equipped with a six-speed manual transmission, gold-finished 18″ M double-spoke wheels, power sunroof, xenon headlights, and automatic climate control. This E46 M3 has 124k miles and is now offered at no reserve with spare parts, build invoices, a Carfax report, and a clean California title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Jet Black (668) and is equipped with Shadowline trim as well as xenon headlights, fog lights, a sunroof, LED tail lights, Park Distance Control, a trunk lid spoiler, tinted windows, and quad exhaust outlets. A June 2020 entry in the report lists damage to the front, and the seller states that the hood and front bumper cover were replaced and primed before they were painted to match the body. The rear bumper cover was also repainted. The headlight washers have been deleted, and a dent is visible on the left quarter panel.

The car rides on a revised suspension with H&R anti-sway bars and front springs as well as Koni dampers, Turner Motorsport suspension bushings, and rear springs that were reportedly sourced from a 2005 E46 ZHP. The 18″ M double-spoke Style 67 wheels have been finished in gold and are mounted with 225/40 front and 255/35 rear Michelin Pilot Sport 4S tires. The seller notes that the left parking brake mechanism has been deleted to reduce weight, and imperfections are visible on the wheels. A seller-provided list of modifications is viewable in the gallery below.

The cabin features manually adjustable front sport seats upholstered in black Nappa leather, and brushed Aluminum Shadow trim accents the dashboard and door panels. Interior amenities include cruise control, a heated passenger’s seat, a CD stereo, and automatic climate control. The driver’s seat heater is inoperative. The seller tells us  that an oscillating air circulation function of the factory climate control system (IKHA) does not work, although the air conditioning and ventilation fan and the cabin circulation settings operate correctly without issue. The clutch switch has been bypassed, the shifter linkage was replaced under current ownership, and the removed cabin filter and housing are included in the sale.

The multifunction leather-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 124k miles, approximately 6k of which were added under current ownership. White-dial STACK readouts for oil pressure and coolant temperature have been added to the left A-pillar.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was overhauled in 2019 with work including surfacing and honing the block, a valve job, and replacing the piston rings, rod and main bearings, and valve springs. The camshafts are said to have been replaced in 2022, and an oil change was performed in June 2024. The car most recently passed a California emissions test in February 2025. The seller tells us that additional modifications and replacement parts installed under current ownership include the following:

Power is routed to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual transmission. A 4.10:1 Wavetrac limited-slip differential built by Diffsonline was installed in 2021, and the seller notes that a rear subframe reinforcement kit has been added along with a Sachs clutch with sprung hub as well as a JB Racing aluminum flywheel and a replacement shift linkage. A SuperSprint exhaust system has been fitted.
The Carfax report lists the aforementioned accident and damage entries.
