The Carfax report lists the aforementioned damage entries along with history in Florida, New Jersey, New York, and Pennsylvania.

title: 7k-Mile 2003 BMW M3 Convertible
excerpt: This 2003 BMW M3 convertible is a black-over-black example powered by a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six linked to a six-speed SMG sequential transmission and a limited-slip differential. It has 7k miles and features a black soft top, xenon headlights, Park Distance Control, 18″ M double-spoke Style 67 wheels, heated power-adjustable front sport seats, automatic climate control, cruise control, a BMW Business CD stereo, and a Harman Kardon sound system. This E46 M3 is offered on dealer consignment in Florida with a window sticker, an owner’s manual, a Carfax report, and a clean Michigan title.

The car is finished in Jet Black (668) and features a black convertible soft top and xenon headlights with washers as well as fog lights, rain-sensing windshield wipers, Park Distance Control, and quad exhaust outlets. A November 2005 entry on the Carfax report shows that the car was involved in an accident with another vehicle and notes damage to the front.

The 18″ M double-spoke Style 67 wheels are mounted with 225/45 front and 255/40 rear Michelin Pilot Sport tires that were manufactured in 2002. The car was factory equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and braking is provided by four-wheel ventilated discs.

The heated power-adjustable front sport seats are upholstered in black leather while aluminum trim accents the dashboard and door panels. Amenities include automatic climate control, cruise control, a BMW Business CD stereo, and a Harman Kardon sound system.

The leather-wrapped multifunction steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 7k miles.
The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque. The oil was changed in preparation for the sale.
Power is routed to the rear wheels via a six-speed SMG sequential transmission and a limited-slip differential.
The window sticker lists factory colors, equipment, and a total suggested retail price of $61,270.
The Carfax report shows the aforementioned accident.

title: 2001 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2001 BMW M3 coupe was delivered new to CVM Autopark of Mechanicsburg, Pennsylvania, and spent years in that state and in Georgia before the seller purchased the car and relocated it to Colorado in August 2024. Finished in Laguna Seca Blue over Grey Nappa leather, the car is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six linked with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. Equipment includes the Luxury Package, the Cold Weather Package, M Double Spoke 19″ wheels, a power sunroof, xenon headlights, heated power-adjustable front sport seats, a Harman Kardon sound system, and automatic climate control. Modifications include a Scorpion Redpower exhaust system, a K&N cone air filter, an M5 shift knob, and Turner Motorsport wheel spacers. Work performed under current ownership involved repainting the front bumper and the driver-side fender, installing a rear-subframe reinforcement plate, and replacing the fog lights, the headliner, and the rear-window seals. Now showing 87k miles, this E46 M3 is offered with a window sticker, partial service records, spare parts, a Carfax report, and a clean Colorado title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Laguna Seca Blue (448) and is fitted with Shadowline trim as well as xenon headlights, headlamp washers, fog lights, a glass sunroof, a trunk-lid spoiler, and quad exhaust outlets. The Carfax report notes damage to the left front of the vehicle in November 2003 “after an accident or other incident”. In August 2024, the front bumper and the driver-side fender were repainted and the fog lights were replaced to address damage caused when a tire retread struck the BMW on the highway. Paint-protection film is said to have been subsequently installed on the hood, front bumper, fenders, side skirts, mirror housings, and lower rear bumper. Chipped paint around the kidney grilles is visible in the photo gallery below.

M Double Spoke 19″ Style 67 wheels are mounted with 235/35 front and 255/35 rear Kumho Ecsta tires. The car was factory equipped with Dynamic Stability Control, and braking is provided by four-wheel ventilated discs. Turner Motorsport wheel spacers measure 15.0 millimeters in front and 12.5 millimeters at the rear.

The heated power-adjustable front sport seats and the rear bench are upholstered in Grey Nappa leather, and High-Gloss Black trim adorns the dash and door panels. Interior amenities include adjustable front lumbar support, width-adjustable front side bolsters, cruise control, Harman Kardon audio, automatic climate control, and rain-sensing windshield wipers. An illuminated M5 shift knob and Alcantara boot have been installed, and M Hurricane cloth trims the area around the sunroof controls. The seller notes that the sunroof shade does not slide easily, the ashtray behind the center armrest is broken, and the center-console sunglass holder is scratched. The seller replaced the headliner, the rearview-mirror glass, and the rear-window rubber seals.

The multi-function leather-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 87k miles, approximately 1k of which were added under current ownership.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque. The rod-bearing recall was performed in December 2004 at 29k miles. A K&N cone air filter and a Scorpion Redpower exhaust system have been installed.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. A subframe-reinforcement kit was installed in August 2024.
The window sticker documents delivery to CVM Autopark and a total suggested retail price of $52,720.
The Carfax report shows the aforementioned 2003 damage report as well as a January 2020 recall for the passenger-side front airbag.

title: Turbocharged 2006 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 coupe was modified under previous ownership, with reported work having involved fitting the 3.2-liter S54 inline-six with a Precision Turbo & Engine PT6766 turbocharger and corresponding air intake, exhaust, fuel system, driveline, and engine management components as well as fitting a carbon-fiber decklid and rear diffuser, TC Kline Racing coilovers and camber plates, Rogue Engineering rear control arms, aftermarket 19″ wheels, Cinnamon leather upholstery, Beisan Systems double-Vanos components, Horsepower Freaks (HPF) subframe reinforcement plates, and more as detailed below. Finished in Silver Gray Metallic, the car also features a six-speed manual transmission, a limited-slip differential, a South Bend “Stage 5” clutch, the Premium Package, xenon headlights, carbon-fiber interior trim, a short-throw shifter, power-adjustable front sport seats, a ProEFI EMS display and boost controller switch, a Harman Kardon sound system, and a CD stereo. This M3 indicates 72k miles and is offered on dealer consignment in Tennessee with a build list, a Carfax report, and a clean Florida title.

The car is finished in Silver Gray Metallic (A08) and is fitted with Shadowline trim. Additional exterior details include a sunroof, xenon headlights, fog lights, rain-sensing windshield wipers, and LED taillights. The selling dealer states that the body has been modified with a custom front undertray, a Vorsteiner CSL-style carbon-fiber trunk lid, a Tekarbon carbon-fiber diffuser, and European-specification blue-tinted mirror glass. A damage report is noted in a July 2014 entry on the Carfax report, and the selling dealer reports that the front bumper cover and the front fenders were subsequently repainted.

Apex ARC-8 19″ wheels are mounted with 245/35 front and 285/30 rear Michelin Pilot Sport All-Season 4 tires. The car has reportedly been fitted with replacement front control arm bushings along with the following aftermarket components:
The selling dealer states that the rear wheels contact the inner fenders over large bumps.

The car left the factory with black Nappa leather upholstery, and Cinnamon leather was fitted to the power-adjustable front sport seats, rear bench seat, center console lid, and door panels under previous ownership. Carbon-fiber trim accents the dash and door panels, and appointments include automatic climate control, cruise control, Harman Kardon audio, and a BMW Business CD stereo as well as a short-throw shifter. A ProEFI engine management system (EMS) color display is affixed to the left side of the dashboard, while a boost controller switch is housed in the center console. Close-up photos of cabin blemishes are presented in the gallery below.

The multifunction steering wheel frames a 185-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a variable redline, and gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 72k miles.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six is said to have been rebuilt and modified under previous ownership. The build included fitting a Precision Turbo & Engine PT6766 turbocharger, a Lang Racing “Stage 4” turbocharger-ready cylinder head, an HPF intake manifold, a VAC Motorsports oil pump, an HPF oil cooler, a Zionsville Autosport radiator, an M5-specification fan clutch, Wiseco Teflon-coated pistons, CP-Carrillo connecting rods, a TiAL 44mm wastegate, dual HKS blow-off valves, a black-anodized intercooler, an oil catch can, and a Saad Racing “Stage 2” fuel system along with 1,750cc fuel injectors, three fuel pumps, and E85 compatibility. The car reportedly received a double-VANOS system overhaul with Beisan Systems components circa 2020, and additional work under previous ownership is said to have included rebuilding the turbocharger and replacing the following components:
A document containing additional build and maintenance details can be viewed in the gallery below.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. An HPF subframe reinforcement kit was reportedly installed circa 2015, while the differential has been resealed and fitted with a Saad Racing brace and Driveshaft Shop axles. Work in 2023 is said to have involved installing a South Bend Clutch “Stage 5” single-plate ceramic clutch as well as replacing the pilot bearing, throw-out bearing, clutch lines, and clutch master and slave cylinders. The selling dealer states that an HPF titanium exhaust system has been fitted along with a Steed Speed manifold, a Supersprint resonated X-pipe, replacement hangers, and HPF blued-titanium tips.
The Carfax report displays at least one open recall and lists the aforementioned July 2014 damage report.

title: 2003 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2003 BMW M3 coupe is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six linked with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential, and is finished in Carbon Black Metallic over Cinnamon Nappa leather. Equipment includes the Premium and Cold Weather packages as well as 18″ M double-spoke wheels, xenon headlights, a Harman Kardon sound system, and automatic climate control. The car was first registered in Oklahoma and spent time in Colorado, Washington, and Texas before it was acquired in 2024 by the seller who relocated it to Missouri. Work performed during the seller’s ownership consisted of installing a Dinan Stage 1 suspension kit and replacing the flex disc, trailing arm bushings, and front brake hoses. This E46 M3 has 109k miles and is offered with manufacturer’s literature, service records, a Blackstone Laboratories oil report, a Carfax report, and a clean Missouri title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Carbon Black Metallic (416) and is equipped with Shadowline trim as well as xenon headlights, fog lights, a glass sunroof, rain-sensing windshield wipers, a trunk lid spoiler, and quad exhaust outlets. The quarter window seals were replaced in 2023. The Carfax report indicates that the vehicle was involved in an accident in November 2014, causing damage to the right and rear, followed by additional front damage in October 2020, and a third incident in March 2023 where the car struck a bridge, resulting in “very minor damage” to both the left and right front. The seller further clarifies that the second incident in October 2020 involved damage to the front bumper cover while the car was parked, and that the vehicle was sideswiped in March 2023, which resulted in damage to the left fender. A scratch and dent are visible on the driver’s door, the windshield is chipped, the front cowl trim is cracked, the rear window trim is deteriorating, and the aftermarket tint film in the rear window is bubbling.

The 18″ M double-spoke Style 67 wheels wear 225/45 and 255/40 Continental ControlContact Sport SRS+ tires that were mounted in October 2023. A Dinan Stage 1 suspension kit was installed in 2024 along with replacement of the trailing arm bushings, front brake hoses, and brake fluid.

The heated power-adjustable front sport seats and door-panel inserts are upholstered in Cinnamon Nappa leather, and the dashboard and center console are accented with Brushed Aluminum Shadow trim. Additional amenities include automatic climate control, a BMW Business CD stereo, Harman Kardon audio, and cruise control. Wear is present on the driver’s seat and door panel, and the seller notes that the trunk release button is in need of replacement, and A, B, and C pillar trim has been removed. The sunroof shade was replaced in 2024.

The multifunction leather-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The odometer indicates 109k miles, approximately 7k of which were added by the seller.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque. The connecting rod bearing recall was completed in 2004. The Vanos bolts were replaced in 2016, while a replacement water pump, thermostat, accessory belt tensioners and pulleys were fitted in 2022. Additional work performed in 2023 included a valve adjustment and replacement of the valve cover gasket, oil cooler gasket, and spark plugs. An oil change was carried out in July 2024, and the results of an August 2o24 Blackstone Laboratories oil analysis are provided in the gallery below.

Power is routed to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. A subframe reinforcement kit was installed in 2016. The rear differential cover and a subframe bushing were replaced in 2023, while a replacement driveshaft flex disc installed in 2024.
Manufacturer’s literature, removed parts, two main keys, and one valet key are included in the sale.
The Carfax report shows the aforementioned accidents and damage and lists history in Oklahoma, Colorado, Washington, Texas, and Missouri.

title: Turbocharged 2001 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2001 BMW M3 coupe is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six that has been fitted with a Maximum PSI turbocharger kit and a Dinan exhaust system, and the drivetrain is completed by a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. Finished in Laguna Seca Blue over gray Nappa leather upholstery, the car is further equipped with 19″ M cross-spoke wheels, lowering springs, Dynamic Stability Control, xenon headlights, a sunroof, automatic climate control, auxiliary gauges, Harman Kardon audio, a CD stereo, and heated power-adjustable front seats. Acquired by the selling dealer in 2021, this E46 M3 has 107k miles and is now offered at no reserve with a Carfax report and a California title.

The car is finished in Laguna Seca Blue (448) with Shadowline trim and features xenon headlights with washers as well as fog lights, a powered glass sunroof, a trunk lid spoiler, and quad exhaust outlets. A carbon-fiber exhaust surround as well as black kidney grilles and side vents have been fitted. An October 2004 entry on the Carfax report notes an accident in which the car hit a utility pole, resulting in airbag deployment and damage to the front of the vehicle. The majority of the gallery photos were taken in August 2024, and the selling dealer states that the front bumper cover has since been repainted to address scrapes on the front lip.

Style 163M 19″ M cross-spoke wheels are mounted with 265/30 Hankook Ventus V12 Evo2 tires produced in 2017. Riding on lowering springs, the car was factory-equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and braking is provided by four-wheel ventilated discs.

The heated and power-adjustable front sport seats are upholstered in gray Nappa leather, and the door panels and rear bench are trimmed to match. The front-center armrest has been removed, and additional appointments include cruise control, a BMW Business CD stereo, a Harman Kardon sound system, driver-seat position memory, and automatic climate control.

The Alcantara-wrapped multifunction steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. An e-Boost 2 Turbosmart electronic boost controller and air/fuel-ratio gauge have been added to the top of the steering column. The digital odometer indicates 107k miles. The taillight-warning indicator remains illuminated after startup.
The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was fitted with a Maximum PSI Stage 1 turbocharger kit in 2016.
Power is routed to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. A Dinan short-shifter kit and cat-back exhaust system have been fitted.
The Carfax report notes the aforementioned 2004 accident as well as manufacturer safety recalls in January 2017 and 2020 entries.
The vehicle is currently registered as Planned Non-Operation in the state of California.
The car has not passed a California emissions inspection.

title: Supercharged 2003 BMW M3 Coupe
excerpt: This 2003 BMW M3 coupe was ordered new by the current owner and is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six fitted with a Dinan Vortech supercharger. Finished in Laguna Seca Blue over Grey Nappa leather, it is further equipped with a six-speed SMG sequential transmission and a limited-slip differential along with 19″ Dinan wheels, Dinan-branded Brembo calipers, slotted brake rotors, and a Dinan rear strut brace. The car also has Harman Kardon audio, a factory CD stereo, heated front seats, and metal pedal covers. This E46 M3 has 149k miles and is offered by the seller on behalf of the current owner with 2002 sale documents, manufacturer’s literature, service records, a Carfax report, and a clean New Jersey title.

The car is finished in Laguna Seca Blue (448) and features body-color kidney grille surrounds, carbon-fiber side vents, and aftermarket badges. Other exterior details include a glass sunroof, xenon headlights, fog lights, rain-sensing windshield wipers, LED tail lights, Park Distance Control, a trunk lid spoiler, and quad exhaust outlets. The Carfax report notes damage to the car in entries from 2015, 2018, and 2020. The lower front valance is cracked in several places.

The 19″ Dinan wheels are mounted with 275/30 front and 285/30 rear Continental ExtremeContact DWS 06 Plus tires. Braking is from Dinan-branded Brembo calipers over slotted rotors at all four corners. A Dinan rear strut brace is installed.

The heated and power-adjustable front sport seats are upholstered in Grey Nappa leather that extends to the door panel inserts, and the cabin features a black dashboard with Brushed Aluminum Shadow trim accents. Interior amenities include a BMW Business CD stereo, Harman Kardon audio, and automatic climate control. Metal pedal covers have been added. Portions of the upholstery was repaired and redyed in October 2019 and the driver’s door lock assembly was replaced in February 2022.

The multi-function leather-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 149k miles.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six has been fitted with a Dinan Vortech supercharger. The engine is equipped with Dinan engine management software, an intercooler, an aluminum radiator, enlarged throttle bodies, and upgraded fuel injectors. The rod bearing recall service was performed in January 2005 and replacement rod bearings and rod bolts were later installed in December 2015. The double-VANOS system was upgraded in January 2020.

Power is routed to the rear wheels via a six-speed SMG sequential transmission that was replaced in 2009. The limited-slip differential has been fitted with 3.91:1 gearing and the clutch assembly was replaced in June 2019. A subframe reinforcement kit is said to have been installed in the mid-2000s.
The Carfax report notes the aforementioned damage and at least one open recall.

title: 2006 BMW M3 Coupe Competition Package
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 coupe has remained registered in California from new and now has 53k miles. The car is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six linked with a six-speed SMG sequential transmission and a limited-slip differential, and it is finished in Silver Gray Metallic over black Nappa leather. Features include the Competition Package, 19″ M cross-spoke wheels, a power sunroof, xenon headlights, Park Distance Control, power-adjustable front sport seats, navigation, aftermarket shifter components, and automatic climate control. This E46 M3 was purchased by the seller in 2024 and is now offered with service records, two keys, and a clean California title.

The car is finished in Silver Gray Metallic (A08) and is fitted with Shadowline trim as well as xenon headlights, fog lights, a glass sunroof, rain-sensing windshield wipers, LED tail lights, Park Distance Control, a trunk lid spoiler, and quad exhaust outlets. The windshield cowl cover was replaced under current ownership. The rear bumper cover is scratched. Paint meter readings are visible in the gallery below.

The black-finished 19″ M cross-spoke Style 163M wheels are mounted with 225/40 front and 255/35 rear Advanta tires that were installed in 2024, at which time the wheels were also refinished. The car was factory equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and four-wheel cross-drilled and ventilated rotors are installed.

The power-adjustable front sport seats are upholstered in black Nappa leather, and Milled-Effect Aluminum trim adorns the dash and door panels. Interior amenities include cruise control, navigation, and automatic climate control. An aftermarket shifter knob and housing are installed.

The Alcantara-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 53k miles, approximately 1k of which were added under current ownership.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque. In 2024 the spark plugs, ignition coils, fuel pump, fuel pressure regulator, fuel filter, battery, and air filter were replaced, and an oil change was performed.
Power is routed to the rear wheels via a six-speed SMG sequential transmission and a limited-slip differential. The differential fluid was changed in 2024.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage and lists at least one open recall.

title: 24k-Mile 2004 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2004 BMW M3 convertible spent time in California and Washington before relocating to Canada where it remained until 2024, and it now has 24k miles. Powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six linked with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential, the car is finished in Jet Black over black Nappa leather upholstery. Modifications include carbon-fiber interior trim, a rear spoiler, and a Dinan exhaust system, high-flow air meter, and ECU tune. Features include a black soft top, 19″ M cross-spoke wheels, heated power-adjustable front seats, a BMW Business CD Stereo, a Harman Kardon sound system, and automatic climate control. Acquired by the selling dealer in 2024, this E46 M3 is offered at no reserve with a clean Carfax report and a clean Illinois title.

The car is finished in Jet Black (668) and features a black convertible soft top and a rear spoiler. Additional exterior details fog lights, rain-sensing windshield wipers, LED tail lights, and quad exhaust outlets. Close-up photographs of the exterior finish and trim are shown in the gallery below.

Silver 19″ M cross-spoke Style 163M wheels are mounted with225/45R18 front and 255/40R18 rear Pirelli tires. The car was factory equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and braking is provided by four-wheel ventilated discs. The car is also equipped with a front strut tower brace, a rear shock tower brace, and Dinan Stage 1 suspension as part of the Dinan S1 package.

The cabin features heated power-adjustable front sport seats upholstered in black Nappa leather, and carbon-fiber trim accents the dash and door panels. Interior amenities include cruise control, a BMW Business CD stereo, a Harman Kardon sound system, and automatic climate control.

The multi-function leather-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 24k miles.
The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six has been fitted with Dinan components consisting of an exhaust system, ECU tune, and high-flow air-flow meter.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential.
The Carfax report is free of accidents and other reported damage.

title: 13k-Mile Slicktop 2002 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 coupe was first delivered to Dreyer & Reinbold BMW in Indianapolis, Indiana, and it is said to have remained with its original owner until 2022. Finished in Laguna Seca Blue over gray Nappa leather, it is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six linked with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. Equipment includes the Premium and Cold Weather Packages along with 18″ M double-spoke wheels, xenon headlights, heated power-adjustable front seats, and a Harman Kardon sound system. The car was acquired by the seller on BaT in December 2022 and has 13k miles. This E46 M3 is offered in California with a window sticker, an owner’s manual, service records, sales documents, two keys, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Montana title in the name of the seller’s LLC.

The car is finished in Laguna Seca Blue (448) and was ordered without a sunroof. It has Shadowline trim, xenon headlights, fog lights, a trunk lid spoiler, and quad exhaust outlets. There are scuffs on the underside of the front bumper cover, and close-up photos of the exterior are provided in the gallery below. A scratch on the body was reportedly repaired in preparation for the sale.

The 18″ M double-spoke Style 67 wheels are mounted with 225/45 front and 255/40 rear Michelin Pilot Sport A/S 3 tires. The car was factory equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and braking is provided by four-wheel ventilated discs. The brake fluid was flushed in April 2024.

The heated and power-adjustable front sport seats are upholstered in Grey Nappa leather, and Titan Shadow trim adorns the dash and door panels. Interior amenities include a CD stereo, a Harman Kardon sound system, cruise control, automatic climate control, front-seat lumbar support, driver-position memory settings, and rear side airbags. The left door panel was repaired under current ownership, and related photos and invoices are provided in the gallery. The seller notes that the rearview mirror has been replaced.

The multi-function leather-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 13k miles, approximately 350 of which were added under current ownership.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque. The seller notes that the rod bearing recall service was performed in February 2006. An oil change was performed in April 2024.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. The rear differential fluid was flushed in January 2023.
The window sticker notes initial delivery to Dreyer & Reinbold BMW in Indianapolis, Indiana, and lists factory equipment, colors, and a total suggested retail price of $52,305.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

title: 2001 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2001 BMW M3 coupe was registered with a single family in California until it was acquired by the seller on BaT in August 2024. Subsequent work included upgrading the VANOS system and reinforcing the rear subframe along with resealing the rear differential, refinishing the bumper covers and wheels, and replacing the upper chain guide, tensioner pulley, window seals, power steering cooler hoses, and tires. The car is finished in Carbon Black Metallic over black Nappa leather, and power is provided by a 3.2-liter inline-six linked with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. Features include the Cold Weather and Luxury packages as well as 18″ M double-spoke wheels, a power sunroof, xenon headlights, heated power-adjustable front sport seats, a Harman Kardon sound system, and automatic climate control. This E46 M3 has 105k miles and is offered with a window sticker, an owner’s manual, service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean California title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Carbon Black Metallic (416) with Shadowline trim and has xenon headlights, fog lights, a glass sunroof, a trunk lid spoiler, and quad exhaust outlets. The driver’s door is said to have been refinished under previous ownership, and the seller states notes paintwork on the right quarter panel. The front and rear bumper covers were repainted and the window seals were replaced under current ownership according to the seller. A dent on the rear left wheel arch is shown in the gallery below, and blemishes are noted on the hood and roof.

The 18″ M double-spoke Style 67 wheels were refinished and mounted with 225/45 front and 255/40 rear Michelin Pilot Sport 4S tires under current ownership, after which a four-wheel laser alignment was performed. The car was factory-equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and braking is provided by four-wheel ventilated discs. The brake fluid was recently flushed, and the seller states that the rear-left wheel bearing and power steering cooler hoses were replaced under current ownership.

The cabin features heated power-adjustable front sport seats upholstered in black Nappa leather, and High-Gloss Black trim accents the dash and door panels. Interior amenities include cruise control, Harman Kardon audio, automatic climate control, a BMW Business CD stereo, and a trunk-mounted CD changer. The seller states that work under current ownership included replacing the shift knob and floor mats as well as retrimming the A, B, and C-pillars.

The multi-function leather-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 105k miles, approximately 6k of which were added under current ownership.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six is said to have been fitted with Dinan engine management software under previous ownership. The rod bearing recall service was reportedly performed in February 2005. According to the seller, work under current ownership included upgrading the VANOS system, adjusting the valves, flushing the coolant, performing an oil change, and replacing the upper chain guide, tensioner pulley, AC pulley, fuel filter, cabin air filter, engine air filter, and spark plugs.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. A subframe reinforcement kit was installed in October 2024 according to the seller, who notes that additional work included replacing the rear differential input seal, fuel tank clamps, and muffler hangers along with flushing the transmission and differential fluids.
The window sticker lists initial delivery to Santa Monica BMW in California, as well as factory colors, equipment, and a total suggested retail price of $52,995.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

title: 43k-Mile 2003 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2003 BMW M3 convertible is finished in Alpine White over Grey Nappa leather upholstery and is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six linked with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. Equipment includes a dark blue soft top, 19″ M double-spoke wheels, xenon headlights, Park Distance Control, power-adjustable front sport seats, a Harman Kardon sound system, a BMW Business CD stereo, and automatic climate control. The car was recently acquired by the selling dealer, following registration history in Florida, New Jersey, and New York. excerpt: This 2000 BMW 323i Sport Wagon was acquired by the seller in 2020 and subsequently converted into an M3-style wagon. The complete drivetrain, subframes, brakes, and exhaust system from a 2004 M3 were swapped in, and the body was altered with M3-style vents, fender flares, rocker trim, and bumper covers. The car rides on Bilstein PSS9 coilovers and custom three-piece 18″ Style 42 BBS wheels, and inside the interior was redone with red Nappa leather upholstery and M3 trim items. It also has a sunroof, fog lights, xenon headlights, power-adjustable front sport seats, and automatic climate control. This M3-converted E46 Sport Wagon is now offered with a clean California title in the seller’s name.

The Carfax report lists “minor” front-end damage in 2019. The car was ordered in Titanium Silver Metallic, and it was altered to look like an M3 before it was repainted and ceramic coated. The following were installed:

The subframes, steering rack, major suspension components, and brakes from the donor M3 were also installed, and the rotors, pads, and lines were replaced. The seller installed Bilstein PSS9 coilovers and polyurethane rear trailing airm bushings.
The custom-made three-piece Style 42 BBS wheels measure 18″ in diameter and have polished lips and gold BBS-logo caps. Toyo Proxes tires were mounted as well.

AP Upholstery in San Diego redid the interior with red Nappa leather upholstery on the power-adjustable M3 sport seats, rear seats, door cards, arm rest, and steering wheel rim. Sueded material was applied to the pillars and headliner, and tri-color stitching accents the shift boot and emergency brake boot. An M3 dead pedal, shift knob, door sill trim, and mats were fitted, and the auto-dimming M3 mirror was repaired by Radar Mirror.

An M3 cluster was installed, and the ~183k miles indicated represent the mileage that was on the donor chassis. The seller has added approximately 3k miles and estimates there were ~168k miles on the chassis when the swap was performed, and total mileage is unknown.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was installed along with supporting equipment. The seller states that the rod bearings, headgasket, head studs, and seals were replaced and the camshaft bolts and VANOS system were upgraded. The alternator, thermostat, water pump, and other components were also replaced.

The six-speed manual transmission, driveshaft, M differential, and exhaust system were also installed. The seller states the rear subframe mounts were reinforced, and a UUC Motorwerks Stage 2 lightweight flywheel and clutch kit were utilized.
Photos showing stages of the work performed are provided in the gallery.
The Carfax report lists the aforementioned damage .

The car has not been inspected by the California Bureau of Automotive Repair following the swap, and as a result it cannot be sold to a private in-state party. The listing photos were taken in June 2024.

excerpt: This 2004 BMW M3 coupe is powered by a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six that has been modified with an Active Autowerke supercharger kit, a methanol injection system, a MoTeC ECU, and upgraded camshafts, rocker arms, and cooling-system components. The factory six-speed SMG transmission has been converted to manual operation and fitted with a twin-disc clutch assembly, while the chassis has been modified with front and rear shock tower braces, JRZ RS1 adjustable coilovers, 18″ Apex wheels, StopTech brake calipers, and H&R sway bars. The interior is outfitted with a single black cloth Recaro driver’s seat, a roll cage, and a rear bulkhead filler panel, while the body is finished in Silver Gray Metallic and features a carbon-fiber sunroof block-off panel as well as a Vorsteiner vented hood and CSL-style trunk lid. The car is also equipped with a limited-slip differential, a MoTeC lap-timer system, and a Harmon Kardon sound system. The current owner acquired the car in 2021, and subsequent work has involved replacing the starter motor and clutch release cylinder as well as installing a PWR radiator with a SPAL electric cooling fan. This supercharged E46 M3 track car indicates 75k miles and is now offered at no reserve in California by the seller on behalf of the current owner with service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Montana title in the name of the owner’s LLC.

The car is finished in Silver Gray Metallic (A08) and features a Vorsteiner vented hood and CSL-style trunk lid that have been painted to match. A carbon-fiber sunroof block-off panel and rear diffuser have also been fitted, and the factory headlights have been replaced with a carbon-look blank plate on the right and a version with a mesh insert on the left. Additional exterior details include fender vents, front and rear tow hooks, black kidney grille inserts, rear parking sensors, and a single exhaust outlet. Chipped paint is visible on the lower front bumper cover and side skirts.

Silver-finished Apex EC-7 18″ wheels are secured to the hubs via aftermarket wheel studs, and they are mounted with 250/65 Yokohama Advan tires. The seller notes the car can accommodate a tire size up to 260/65. A Dinan strut tower brace spans the engine bay, and the chassis has been further modified with an Active Autowerke rear strut tower brace, H&R sway bars, Ground Control rear camber arms, and JRZ RS1 adjustable coilovers. Braking is handled by two-piece slotted rotors paired with StopTech six-piston calipers up front and four-piston versions out back.

The factory seats have been removed and a single black cloth Recaro driver’s seat with a Schroth harness has been installed on Macht Schnell seat floor adapters. An Autopower roll cage, an Element fire extinguisher, a Hard Motorsport rear bulkhead filler panel, and a headliner without a sunroof cutout have also been added. The car retains its BMW Business CD head unit, Harman Kardon sound system, carpeting, door cards, and black cube trim pieces. It does not have air conditioning.

The OMP Racing three-spoke steering wheel is wrapped in Alcantara and features a yellow centering stripe. A CAE solid-mounted shifter with lockout functionality is situated behind control buttons for various ECU and chassis settings. Factory instrumentation consists of a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level, and a MoTeC C127 display is mounted above the center stack. The digital odometer indicates 75k miles, approximately 1k of which were added by the current owner.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six has been modified with an Active Autowerke Prima Plus supercharger kit, which features an HKS GT Supercharger and methanol injection. Additional upgrades include Lang Racing camshafts, Schrick rocker arms, a high-flow oil pump, a carbon-fiber intake manifold cover, and a MoTeC ECU. The double-VANOS variable valve-timing system was overhauled with a Beisan kit in 2020. The starter motor was replaced in 2022 while a PWR radiator and SPAL electric cooling fan were installed in 2023.

The factory six-speed SMG transmission was converted to manual operation during time with a previous owner, and an aluminum flywheel and Clutch Masters twin-disc clutch assembly were installed in May 2023. A limited-slip differential with a finned cover distributes power to the rear wheels. The front and rear subframes are said to have been reinforced before the current owner acquired the car and the clutch release cylinder was replaced in January 2022.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other damage.
The car has not passed a California emissions test.

title: 2006 BMW M3 Coupe Competition Package 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 coupe was acquired by the seller in 2013, and subsequent work included updating the double-VANOS system, replacing the rod bearings, and installing aftermarket intake and exhaust components, H&R lowering springs, Ground Control camber plates, wheel spacers, a SPAL cooling fan, and more as detailed below. Finished in Interlagos Blue Metallic over black Nappa leather, the car is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six linked with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. Features include the Competition Package, 19″ M cross-spoke wheels, a power sunroof, xenon headlights, power-adjustable front sport seats, driver’s seat position memory settings, and automatic climate control. This E46 M3 has 106k miles and is now offered with a window sticker, owner’s manuals, service records, a car cover, spare parts, a Carfax report, and a clean Oregon title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Interlagos Blue Metallic (A30) and features Shadowline trim as well as xenon headlights, fog lights, a glass sunroof, rain-sensing windshield wipers, LED tail lights, a trunk lid spoiler, and quad exhaust outlets. The Carfax report lists an accident in April 2011 that resulted in damage to the front, and a November 2019 entry in the report lists damage to the left-front portion of the vehicle. Paintwork is said to have been performed on the front end. The rear window seals were recently replaced. Close-up photos of paint imperfections are viewable in the gallery below.

The car rides on a revised and lowered suspension with a Hotchkis front anti-sway bar, Koni dampers, H&R springs, adjustable Ground Control front camber plates, adjustable Turner Motorsport front sway bar end links, Powerflex front lower control arm bushings, and Rogue Engineering rear shock mounts. The braking system was been retrofitted with Carbotech AX6 pads, ECS Tuning floating rotors, StopTech stainless-steel lines, and Bimmerworld solid brake guides. Metallic gray-finished 19″ M cross-spoke Style 163M wheels are mounted over 15mm front and 5mm rear spacers, and they are fitted with 245/35 front and 265/35 rear Bridgestone Potenza S007A tires. The seller states that the power steering system was overhauled, the brake fluid was flushed, and the steering flex joint and lower front control arms were replaced at 105k miles. There are paint chips on the right-front wheel.

The cabin features power-adjustable front sport seats upholstered in black Nappa leather, and Milled-Effect Aluminum trim accents the dash and door panels. Interior amenities include automatic climate control, driver’s seat position memory settings, and M3-branded floor mats. The A-pillar trim was replaced and a center cup holder was installed in the place of the center armrest under current ownership. There are cracks in the lower driver’s seat bolster and there is a ding in the trim under the right dashboard vent.

A replacement Alcantara-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 106k miles, approximately 30k of which were added under current ownership.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six has been modified with a Macht Schnell Stage 1 intake, revised engine management software, a fan clutch delete, and a SPAL electric cooling fan. The double-VANOS system was upgraded in 2013, the water pump and thermostat were replaced in 2015, and the rod bearings and constant pressure valve were replaced in 2021. The engine mounts were replaced at approximately 105k miles, and a remanufactured Bosch alternator was installed at approximately 106k miles. An oil change was performed in preparation for the sale.

Power is routed to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual transmission and 3.91:1 limited-slip differential that is said to have been installed under previous ownership. A subframe reinforcement kit was reportedly installed in 2012, and the gear oil in the transmission and differential are said to have been changed at 105k miles. Exhaust flows through catless Status Gruppe headers, a performance center exhaust section with 200-cell catalytic converters, and aftermarket resonators.

The window sticker lists initial delivery to Lauderdale Imports, Ltd. of Fort Lauderdale, Florida,  as well as factory colors, options, equipment, and a total suggested retail price of $58,715. Manufacturer’s literature, a car cover, two keys, spare parts, and service invoices are included in the sale.
The Carfax report lists the aforementioned damage entries.
The lien listed on the current Oregon title was released in December 2019.

title: 2006 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 convertible was initially delivered to Bell BMW in Newton, New Jersey, and it remained under the care of its original owner in that state until 2024. The car is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six linked with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential and is finished in Silver Gray Metallic over Imola Red Nappa leather upholstery. Equipment includes the Cold Weather Package, a removable hardtop, a black soft top, European-specification headers and catalytic converters, a Dinan exhaust system, 18″ Rim Alloy Canada wheels, xenon headlights, heated power-adjustable front sport seats, navigation, a Harman Kardon sound system, and automatic climate control. Acquired by the selling dealer in 2024, this E46 M3 has 85k miles and is offered at no reserve with manufacturer’s literature, a window sticker, a clean Carfax report, and a clean New Jersey title.

The car is finished in Silver Gray Metallic and features a black convertible soft top and a removable body-color hardtop. Additional exterior details include xenon headlights, fog lights, rain-sensing windshield wipers, LED tail lights, and quad exhaust outlets. The hardtop is shown fitted on the car in the gallery below along with close-up photographs of the exterior finish and trim.

Silver 18″ Rim Alloy Canada wheels are mounted with Michelin Pilot Super Sport tires. The car was factory equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and braking is provided by four-wheel ventilated discs. The selling dealer notes that the rear springs were replaced in preparation for the sale.

The heated power-adjustable front sport seats and door-panel inserts are upholstered in Imola Red Nappa leather, and the cabin features a black dashboard with Brushed Aluminum Shadow trim accents. Interior amenities include cruise control, navigation, Harman Kardon audio, and automatic climate control.

The multi-function leather-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 85k miles.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six is said to have been modified with European-specification headers and catalytic converters. The spark plugs and valve cover gasket were replaced, the valves were adjusted, and an oil change was performed in July 2024. An August 2024 Blackstone Laboratories oil report is provided in the photo gallery.

Power is routed to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. A Dinan exhaust system and aftermarket short shifter have been added. The transmission and differential fluids were changed in July 2024.
The window sticker lists initial delivery to Bell BMW in Newton, New Jersey, as well as factory colors, equipment, and a total suggested retail price of $61,295.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

title: 2005 BMW M3 Coupe Competition Package
excerpt: This 2005 BMW M3 coupe was optioned with the Competition and Premium packages, and it has 73k miles following registration history in California, Florida, and Illinois. Finished in Interlagos Blue Metallic over grey Nappa leather upholstery, the car is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six linked with a six-speed SMG sequential transmission and a limited-slip differential. Features include 19″ VMR wheels, a power sunroof, xenon headlights, Park Distance Control, power-adjustable front sport seats, navigation, a Harman Kardon sound system, and automatic climate control. This E46 M3 is now offered by the seller on behalf of the owner, a retail dealer in Maryland, with a clean Illinois title.

The car is finished in Interlagos Blue Metallic (A30) and is equipped with Shadowline trim as well as xenon headlights, fog lights, a glass sunroof, rain-sensing windshield wipers, LED tail lights, Park Distance Control, a trunk lid spoiler, and quad exhaust outlets. The Carfax report notes accident entries in April 2006 and September 2006 as well as “minor damage” entries in October 2017 and May 2024. The front and right front corner of the car sustained damage in the aforementioned incidents. The front and rear bumper covers are said to have been refinished, and the rear quarter panel window trims were replaced in 2024. Close-up photographs of the exterior finish and trim are shown in the gallery below.

Aftermarket 19″ VMR wheels are mounted with Pirelli P Zero tires. The car was factory-equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and braking is provided by four-wheel ventilated discs. The ZCP Competition Package added an upgraded steering rack and larger cross-drilled brake rotors. The rear shocks were replaced and the brake calipers were refinished in 2024.

The power-adjustable front sport seats and door-panel inserts are upholstered in grey Nappa leather, and the cabin features a black dashboard with Brushed Aluminum Shadow trim accents. Interior amenities include cruise control, navigation, Harman Kardon audio, and automatic climate control. The driver’s seat and center console were reupholstered in 2024.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel features paddle shifters and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 73k miles.
The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque. The seller notes that the double-VANOS system was serviced in 2024.

Power is routed to the rear wheels through a six-speed SMG sequential transmission and a limited-slip differential. The transmission fluid and differential fluid were changed and the rear differential mount was replaced in 2024.
The Carfax report lists at least one open recall and the aforementioned 2006, 2017, and 2024 damages.

title: 30k-Mile 2001 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2001 BMW M3 convertible was acquired by the seller on BaT in February 2024, and it has 30k miles following registration history in New Jersey, North Carolina, and Georgia. It is finished in Jet Black over black Nappa leather upholstery and is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six linked with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. A Dinan muffler and short-throw shifter have been fitted, and additional equipment includes a black soft top, 18″ wheels, xenon headlights, power-adjustable front seats, Harman Kardon audio, and automatic climate control. Previously listed on BaT in December 2023, this E46 M3 is offered at no reserve with a window sticker, manufacturer’s literature, and a clean Georgia title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Jet Black (668) and features a black convertible soft top as well as xenon headlights, fog lights, tinted windows, black-finished kidney and side grilles, and quad exhaust outlets. The Carfax report lists “minor damage” in an April 2021 entry. The seller reports the rear license plate holder trim and badge were replaced under current ownership. Close-up photographs of the exterior finish and trim are shown in the gallery below.

The 18″ M double-spoke Style 67 wheels are mounted with 235/40 front and 265/40 rear Michelin tires that have 2014 and 2015 date codes. The car was factory-equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and braking is provided by four-wheel ventilated discs.

The power-adjustable front sport seats are upholstered in black Nappa leather, and High-Gloss black trim adorns the dash and door panels.  A Dinan short-throw shifter has been fitted, and the shift knob was replaced under current ownership. The cabin also has automatic climate control, cruise control, a BMW Business CD stereo, and a Harman Kardon sound system. The seller notes work under current ownership included replacing the headliner, installing a BlueBus Bluetooth module, and hardwiring a radar detector.

The multi-function leather-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 30k miles, approximately 500 of which were added under current ownership.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory-rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque. A rod bearing recall service was performed in 2002 per the seller, and the double-VANOS system is said to have been upgraded in 2021.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. A Dinan muffler has been added. A January 2004 entry on the Carfax report notes that the vehicle was “inspected after an accident or other incident” and undercarriage damage was reported.
The laminated window sticker lists initial delivery to Paul Miller BMW in Wayne, New Jersey, as well as factory colors, equipment, and a total suggested retail price of $56,420.
The Carfax report lists the aforementioned accident and damage entries.

title: 2003 BMW M3 Dinan S2 Coupe
excerpt: This 2003 BMW M3 coupe has 58k miles and is equipped with the Dinan S2 Package, which added revised suspension components, an ECU tune, an exhaust system, an air intake box, strut- and shock-tower braces, high-flow throttle bodies, and a limited-slip differential with a 3.91:1 gear ratio. The car is finished in Carbon Black Metallic over grey Nappa leather upholstery and is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six linked with a six-speed SMG sequential transmission. It was optioned with the Premium and Cold Weather Packages and is equipped with a CSL trunk-lid spoiler, 19″ M double-spoke wheels, a power sunroof, xenon headlights, Park Distance Control, heated power-adjustable front sport seats, navigation, Harman Kardon sound system, and automatic climate control. Purchased by the seller in 2018, this E46 M3 is offered at no reserve with a clean Carfax report and a clean Delaware title.

The car is finished in Carbon Black Metallic (416) and features Shadowline trim and a CSL trunk lid. Additional exterior details include xenon headlights, a glass sunroof, rain-sensing windshield wipers, LED tail lights, tinted windows, and Park Distance Control. A dent and scuff in the left rear quarter panel were repaired under current ownership, and paint protection film has been applied to the front bumper cover, hood, side mirrors, and fenders. Close-up photographs of the exterior finish and trim are shown in the gallery below.

The 19″ M double-spoke Style 67 wheels are mounted with Michelin Pilot Sport 4s tires. The car was factory-equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and the suspension has been modified with Dinan components. Braking is provided by four-wheel ventilated discs. The brake fluid was changed and polyurethane control arm bushings and rear trailing arm bushings were added in 2024. There are chips in the wheels.

The cabin features heated power-adjustable front sport seats upholstered in grey Nappa leather, and Titan Shadow trim accents the dash and door panels. Interior amenities include cruise control, navigation, Harman Kardon audio, Dinan-branded floor mats, and automatic climate control. The A, B, and C-Pillar have been replaced, per the seller, who notes missing pixels in the navigation display, a loose headliner, and door trim blemishes.

The multi-function leather-wrapped steering wheel features paddle shifters and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 58k miles, approximately 13k of which were added under current ownership.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six has been modified with Dinan S2 components including an ECU tune, an exhaust system, an intake air box, strut- and shock-tower braces, and high-flow throttle bodies. Work performed in 2024 is said to have included adjusting the valves and changing the oil.
A plaque in the engine bay lists the car’s Dinan S2 serial number.

Power is routed to the rear wheels through a six-speed SMG sequential transmission and a Dinan limited-slip differential with 3.91:1 gearing. The transmission fluid and differential fluid were changed in 2024. The seller notes the vehicle has a CSL SMG II Shift Parameter installed.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

title: 2005 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2005 BMW M3 coupe is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six mated to a six-speed SMG sequential transmission that was subsequently converted to manual operation following the seller’s purchase in 2020. Finished in Jet Black over Grey Nappa leather upholstery, the car has been modified with BC Racing coilover suspension, Ground Control adjustable sway bars, a Bluetooth-capable Dynavin head unit, and BavSound speakers. Equipment includes a limited-slip differential, 19″ M double-spoke wheels, a power sunroof, xenon headlights, Park Distance Control, heated power-adjustable front sport seats, and automatic climate control. Additional work performed under current ownership included reinforcing the subframe, servicing the double-VANOS system, adjusting the valves, and replacing the rod bearings, ignition coils, spark plugs, and fuel pump. This E46 M3 has 149k miles and is offered at no reserve with service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Florida title.

The car is finished in Jet Black (668) and features Shadowline trim as well as xenon headlights, fog lights, a glass sunroof, LED tail lights, Park Distance Control, a trunk lid spoiler, and quad exhaust outlets. Cracked paint is noted on the front bumper cover, and close-up photographs of the exterior finish and trim are shown in the gallery below.

The 19″ M double-spoke Style 67 wheels are mounted with Michelin Pilot Sport 4s tires that have 2020 and 2021 date codes. BC Racing coilover suspension, Ground Control adjustable sway bars, and stainless steel brake hoses have been installed, and the car was factory-equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC). Braking is provided by four-wheel ventilated discs. The brake pads and rotors were replaced in 2021. There are curb marks on the wheels.

The cabin features seating surfaces upholstered in Grey Nappa leather, and Brushed Aluminum Shadow trim accents the dash and door panels. A Bluetooth-capable Dynavin head unit and BavSound speakers have been added, and amenities include cruise control, an Alcantara shift boot, heated power-adjustable front seats, and automatic climate control.

The multi-function leather-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 149k miles, approximately 9k of which were added under current ownership.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory-rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque. Work performed under current ownership has included servicing the double-VANOS system, adjusting the valves, and replacing the rod bearings, ignition coils, spark plugs, fuel pump, and power steering pump pulley.

Power is routed to the rear wheels through a six-speed SMG transmission was been converted to manual operation in 2022, at which time the clutch was replaced. The car is equipped with a limited-slip differential, and a subframe reinforcement kit was installed in 2021.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

title: 30k-Mile 2006 BMW M3 Coupe Competition Package 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 coupe was purchased new by the seller and now has 30k miles following history in California. It is finished in Interlagos Blue Metallic over black Nappa leather and is powered by a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six linked with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. Features include the Competition and Premium Packages as well as 19″ M cross-spoke wheels, a power sunroof, xenon headlights, Park Distance Control, power-adjustable front sport seats, navigation, and a Harman Kardon sound system. Modifications include a clutch delay valve delete, a Bluetooth module, UUC Motorwerks aluminum pedal covers, and a JL Audio subwoofer and amplifier. This E46 M3 is now offered by the original owner with a window sticker, manufacturer’s literature, service records, spare parts, and a clean California title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Interlagos Blue Metallic (A30) and is fitted with Shadowline trim as well as a power-operated glass sunroof, xenon headlights, fog lights, rain-sensing windshield wipers, LED tail lights, Park Distance Control, a trunk lid spoiler, and quad exhaust outlets. The Carfax report notes an unreported accident entry that “likely occurred” between March 2005 and March 2006, which the seller attributes to when they hit a curb and damaged the front bumper cover and a fog light. They note that the front bumper cover was repainted in June 2012 to address the damage.

The 19″ M cross-spoke Style 163M wheels are mounted with Continental front and Michelin rear tires. The car was factory-equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and the ZCP Competition Package added an upgraded steering rack and larger cross-drilled brake rotors.

The power-adjustable front sport seats have lumbar support and are upholstered in black Nappa leather. Textured aluminum trim adorns the dash and door panels, and amenities include cruise control, navigation, Harman Kardon audio, automatic climate control, and driver-seat memory settings. A Bluetooth module, UUC Motorwerks aluminum pedal covers, and a JL Audio amplifier and subwoofer are installed. The left and right airbag assemblies were replaced in October 2016, per the Carfax report.

The multi-function Alcantara-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 30k miles.
The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque.
Power is routed to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. A clutch delay valve delete is installed.

The window sticker notes initial delivery to New Century BMW in Alhambra, California, and lists factory equipment, colors, options, and a total suggested retail price of $61,295. Manufacturer’s literature, service records, and spare parts are also included in the sale.
The Carfax report notes the aforementioned accident entry.

title: 23k-Mile 2002 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed

The multi-function leather-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 23k miles.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential.
The window sticker lists initial delivery to Wagner BMW in West Springfield, Massachusetts, factory colors and equipment, and a total suggested retail price of $51,945.

title: 2002 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 convertible is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six linked with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential, and it is finished in Phoenix Yellow Metallic over black Nappa leather upholstery. title: 2005 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2005 BMW M3 is a triple-black convertible with 105k miles that is powered by a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six. Following the seller’s 2021 acquisition, the factory six-speed SMG transmission was converted to manual operation, and further work has included replacing the thermostat, oil pan gasket, input shaft seal, and mass airflow sensor. The car rides on 19″ Style 67 wheels and is equipped with a limited-slip differential, a power-operated soft top, xenon headlights, rear parking sensors, heated and power-adjustable front sport seats, automatic climate control, and a Harman Kardon sound system connected to a Dynavin head unit with Apple CarPlay capability. This E46 M3 is now offered with manufacturer’s literature, service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Minnesota title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Carbon Black Metallic (416) and features a power-operated black convertible soft top as well as xenon headlights, fog lights, rain-sensing windshield wipers, LED tail lights, rear parking sensors, and quad exhaust outlets. Blemishes on the front and rear bumper covers are shown in close-up photos provided in the gallery.

title: 2004 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2004 BMW M3 convertible was initially delivered to Moses BMW in Saint Albans, West Virginia, and now has 57k miles. The car is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six linked with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential and is finished in Mystic Blue Metallic over black Nappa leather. Equipment includes the Cold Weather Package, a black soft top, 19″ M double-spoke wheels, xenon headlights, heated power-adjustable front sport seats, a Harman Kardon sound system, and automatic climate control. Acquired by the selling dealer in 2024, this E46 M3 is offered in Pennsylvania with a window sticker, manufacturer’s literature, service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Louisiana title.

The car is finished in Mystic Blue Metallic (A07) and is fitted with a black convertible soft top as well as xenon headlights, fog lights, rain-sensing windshield wipers, LED tail lights, and quad exhaust outlets. Close-up photographs of the exterior finish and trim are shown in the gallery below.

The 19″ M double-spoke Style 67 wheels are mounted with Michelin Pilot Sport tires. The car was factory-equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and braking is provided by four-wheel ventilated discs.

The heated power-adjustable front sport seats are upholstered in black Nappa leather. Interior amenities include cruise control, a BMW Business CD stereo, Harman Kardon audio, and automatic climate control.

The multi-function leather-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 57k miles.
The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory-rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential.
The window sticker lists initial delivery to Moses BMW in Saint Albans, West Virginia, as well as factory colors, equipment, and a total suggested retail price of $62,345.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

title: 2006 BMW M3 Coupe Competition Package 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 coupe was optioned with the Competition Package and initially delivered to BMW Performance Center in Greer, South Carolina, and it was passed into private ownership approximately 5k miles later. Now indicating 56k miles, the car is finished in Imola Red II over Cinnamon Nappa leather upholstery and is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six linked with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. Equipment includes the Premium Package and Cold Weather Packages as well as 19″ M cross-spoke wheels, a power sunroof, heated power-adjustable front sport seats, navigation, a Harman Kardon sound system, and automatic climate control. Acquired by the selling dealer in 2024, this E46 M3 is offered with a window sticker, manufacturer’s literature, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Colorado title.

Close-up photographs of the exterior finish and trim are shown in the gallery below.

The 19″ M cross-spoke Style 163M wheels are mounted with Michelin Super Sport tires. The car was factory-equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and braking is provided by four-wheel ventilated discs. The ZCP Competition Package added an upgraded steering rack and larger cross-drilled brake rotors.
The heated power-adjustable front sport seats and door-panel inserts are upholstered in Cinnamon Nappa leather, and the cabin features navigation, Harman Kardon audio, and automatic climate control.

The multi-function leather-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 56k miles.
The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory-rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential.
The window sticker lists initial delivery to BMW Performance Center in Greer, South Carolina as well as factory colors, equipment, and a total suggested retail price of $61,605.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

title: 46k-Mile 2002 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 coupe was purchased by the seller in 2003, and it now has 46k miles following registration history in Virginia. It is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six linked with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential and is finished in Jet Black over black Nappa leather upholstery. Features include the Premium Package as well as 18″ M double-spoke wheels, a power sunroof, xenon headlights, heated power-adjustable front sport seats, a Harman Kardon sound system, and automatic climate control. This E46 M3 is offered with an accident-free Carfax report and a clean Virginia title.

The car is finished in Jet Black (668) and features Shadowline trim as well as xenon headlights, fog lights, a glass sunroof, a trunk lid spoiler, and quad exhaust outlets. The seller recommends replacing the front roundel, and close-up photographs of the exterior finish and trim are shown in the gallery below.

The 18″ M double-spoke Style 67 wheels are mounted with Continental tires that the seller recommends replacing. The car was factory-equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and braking is provided by four-wheel ventilated discs.

The cabin features heated power-adjustable front sport seats upholstered in Black Nappa leather, and Brushed Aluminum Shadow trim accents the dash and door panels. Interior amenities include cruise control, Harman Kardon audio, and automatic climate control. The rearview mirror is damaged.

The multi-function leather-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 46k miles, approximately 33k of which were added under current ownership.
The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory-rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential.
The Carfax report lists at least one open recall.
The Virginia title carries a “replacement” notation.
