title: 2002 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 coupe has remained registered in California since new, and it has been repainted in Laguna Seca Blue over black Nappa leather upholstery. Powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six linked with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential, the car is equipped with 19″ M double-spoke wheels, a power sunroof, rear parking sensors, xenon headlights, power-adjustable front sport seats, a Harman Kardon sound system, and automatic climate control. It was purchased by the seller in 2011, and work performed since 2022 is said to have included replacing the rod bearings, the oil filter housing gasket, oil cooler seals, front crankshaft seal, oil pan gasket, power steering hoses, and battery. This E46 M3 has 197k miles and is offered with an accident-free Carfax report and a clean California title.

The car was finished from the factory In Titan Silver Metallic (354) and has been repainted Laguna Seca Blue. The car features Shadowline trim and xenon headlights, and additional exterior details include fog lights, rear parking sensors, a glass sunroof, a trunk lid spoiler, and quad exhaust outlets. The seller dealer notes that the rear bumper cover, trunk, rear window, and left rear quarter panel were replaced following an accident in 2022. There are blemishes on the roof molding, and close-up photographs of the exterior finish and trim are shown in the gallery below.

The 19″ M double-spoke Style 67 wheels are mounted with Hankook Ventus V12 tires. The car was factory-equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and braking is provided by four-wheel ventilated discs.

The power-adjustable front sport seats and door-panel inserts are upholstered in black Nappa leather, and the cabin features a black dashboard with Brushed Aluminum Shadow trim accents. Interior amenities include cruise control, a BMW Business CD stereo, Harman Kardon audio, and automatic climate control. There are scratches on the seals, blemishes on the door panels and pillars, and a crack in the center console.

The multi-function leather-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 197k miles.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory-rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque. The rod bearing recall service was performed in May 2022, per the selling dealer, who notes that the double-VANOS system has been upgraded. Active Autowerks headers have been installed, and work performed in May 2022 reportedly included replacing the oil filter housing gasket, oil cooler seals, front crankshaft seal, oil pan gasket, power steering hoses, water temperature sensor, and battery.
Power is routed to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. The differential bushings and shifter bushings were replaced in May 2022.
The Carfax report lists at least one open recall.
The selling dealer states that the car cannot pass a California emissions inspection, therefore it cannot be sold to an in-state private party buyer.
Head over to our friends at Car and Driver to check out their December 2001 First Drive for the E46 BMW M3 coupe.

title: 2006 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 convertible has 122k miles following registration history in California and Arizona. The car is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six linked with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential and is finished in Silver Grey Metallic over black Nappa leather. Equipment includes a black soft top, 19″ M double-spoke wheels, xenon headlights, Park Distance Control, heated power-adjustable front sport seats, an aftermarket infotainment screen with navigation, a Harman Kardon sound system, and automatic climate control. This E46 M3 is now offered by the selling dealer at no reserve with the owner’s manual, an emissions certificate, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Arizona title.

The car is finished in Silver Grey Metallic and features a black convertible soft top as well as xenon headlights, fog lights, Park Distance Control, rain-sensing windshield wipers, LED tail lights, and quad exhaust outlets. One of the fenders is said to have been refinished.

The 19″ M double-spoke Style 67 wheels shows signs of curb rash and are mounted with Michelin Pilot Super Sport and Nitto Motivo tires. The car was factory equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and braking is provided by four-wheel ventilated discs. The rear shock absorbers were replaced in June 2023.

The heated power-adjustable front sport seats are trimmed in black Nappa leather, and Brushed Aluminum Shadow trim adorns the dash and door panels. Interior amenities include front seat power lumbar support, driver-seat position memory, cruise control, an aftermarket infotainment screen with navigation, Harman Kardon audio, and automatic climate control. Window regulators were replaced in February 2022. The leather on the front seats shows signs of wear.

The multi-function leather-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 122k miles.
The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque. The hood struts were replaced in February 2022.
Power is routed to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. The rear differential fluid was replaced in June 2023.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other damage.

title: 2006 BMW M3 Coupe Competition Package
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 coupe is finished in Interlagos Blue Metallic over black leather and cloth upholstery, and its 3.2-liter inline-six has been fitted with Schrick camshafts, a carbon-fiber airbox, and a CSL DME and exhaust system. Additional modifications include 19″ Style 163M wheels, Öhlins Road and Track coilovers, and AP Racing brakes in addition to Vorsteiner bodywork, 3.91 differential gearing, and CSL tuning for the six-speed SMG sequential transmission. Optioned with the Competition package, the car was factory-equipped with a sunroof, xenon headlights, Park Distance Control, a Harman Kardon sound system, and automatic climate control. The vehicle has been registered in California, New Jersey, and Florida, and it was purchased by its current owner in 2023. The engine mounts, power-steering tank and hoses, and SMG actuator-shaft seal were replaced in August of that year along with the flex joint, center-support mount, and rear CV joint. This E46 M3 has 58k miles and is now offered on dealer consignment with service records, a Carfax report, and a Florida title.

The car is finished in Interlagos Blue Metallic (A30) with Shadowline trim, and a Vorsteiner CSL-style front bumper cover and rear diffuser with carbon-fiber elements have been fitted. Xenon headlights, fog lights, and a powered glass sunroof are accompanied by rain-sensing windshield wipers, LED tail lights, rear Park Distance Control sensors, a trunk-lid spoiler, and quad exhaust outlets. An April 2010 entry on the Carfax report notes minor damage, with no additional details provided. The consigning dealer states that the left-rear quarter panel has been repainted, and the left mirror glass was replaced in 2023.

Silver-finished 19″ M cross-spoke Style 163M wheels are mounted with 235/35 front and 265/30 rear Michelin Pilot Sport 4 S tires that have 2017 production-date codes. The car was factory-equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and Öhlins Road and Track coilovers have been fitted along with an AP Racing big-brake kit. The power-steering tank and hoses were replaced in August 2023.

The front sport seats are upholstered in black leather with M Texture cloth inserts, and the door panels and rear bench are trimmed to match. Aluminum trim accents the cabin, which is further appointed with Harman Kardon audio, an on-board computer, navigation, and automatic climate control.

The suede-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 58k miles, approximately 50 of which were driven under current ownership.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six received updates to the double-VANOS system, per the consigning dealer. Tuning Tech FS in Crofton, Maryland, installed a dyno-tuned CSL DME and fuel rail, and additional underhood modifications include Schrick 288/280 camshafts with 12.5mm valve lift along with a CSL-style carbon-fiber airbox.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed SMG sequential transmission and a limited-slip differential. The consigning dealer states that European-specification transmission-control software has been loaded, and July 2020 work included rebuilding the differential with a BMW Motorsport 3.91:1 ring-and-pinion set as well as installing a rear-subframe reinforcement kit and a CSL exhaust system. In August 2023, the flex joint, center-support mount, and rear CV joint were replaced along with the SMG actuator-shaft seal.
The Carfax report notes the aforementioned 2010 damage, and manufacturer safety recalls are noted in 2009 and 2020 entries.
Head over to our friends at Car and Driver to check out their December 2001 First Drive for the E46 BMW M3 coupe.

title: 2002 BMW M3 Convertible
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 convertible was initially sold in Hawaii and later spent time in Texas and New Mexico before it was relocated to Florida. The car is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic over gray leather and is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six linked with a six-speed SMG sequential transmission and a limited-slip differential. Equipment includes a black soft top, 18″ M double-spoke wheels, xenon headlights, Park Distance Control, power-adjustable front sport seats, a Harman Kardon sound system, and automatic climate control. The clutch assembly and flywheel were replaced in September 2022, the SMG module was replaced in September 2023, and the propshaft, driveshaft center support bearing as well as the flex disc joint were reportedly replaced in May 2024. This E46 M3 is now offered by the selling dealer with the owner’s manual, service records, a TrueFrame report, and a clean Florida title.

The car is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic (354) and is fitted with a black convertible soft top as well as xenon headlights, fog lights, Park Distance Control, and quad exhaust outlets. The convertible top hydraulic pump was replaced in August 2020. The Carfax report lists accident damage in a September 2009 entry, and the results of an October 2014 TrueFrame report are provided in the gallery.

The 18″ M double-spoke Style 67 wheels are mounted with Continental ExtremeContact tires. The car was factory equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and braking is provided by four-wheel ventilated discs. The tie rod boots were replaced in September 2023.

The cabin was refreshed in June 2024 with seating surfaces retrimmed in gray leather and various interior trim pieces painted black. Amenities include power-adjustable front sport seats, driver-seat memory settings, a Harman Kardon sound system, a BMW Business CD stereo, automatic climate control, and cruise control. The exterior temperature sensor does not work.

The multi-function leather-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer shows 110k miles. The instrument cluster was repaired in February 2022.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque. The starter and throttle body actuator were replaced in June 2021, and the battery was replaced in February 2024.

Power is routed to the rear wheels via a six-speed SMG sequential transmission and a limited-slip differential. The clutch assembly, flywheel, and the engine splash shield were replaced in September 2022, the gear actuator was rebuilt in February 2023, the SMG module and relay were replaced in September 2023, and the rear cross-joint gimbal shaft, propshaft, and the driveshaft center support bearing as well as the flex disc joint were reportedly replaced in May 2024.
The Carfax report shows the aforementioned damage and notes an October 2014 damage inspection.

title: 2005 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2005 BMW M3 convertible was purchased by the seller in July 2010, and it has 68k miles. Finished in Jet Black over black Nappa leather, the car is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six linked with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. Equipment includes the Premium Package and the Cold Weather Package as well as a black soft top, 19″ M double-spoke wheels, xenon headlights, heated power-adjustable front sport seats, navigation, a Harman Kardon sound system, and automatic climate control. This E46 M3 is now offered with the owner’s manual, service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Massachusetts title.

The car is finished in Jet Black (668) and is equipped with a black convertible soft top as well as xenon headlights, fog lights, parking sensors, rain-sensing windshield wipers, LED tail lights, and quad exhaust outlets.

The 19″ M double-spoke Style 67 wheels are mounted with Hankook Ventus V12 Evo2 tires, which need to be replaced. The car was factory equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and braking is provided by four-wheel ventilated discs. The brake fluid was changed in August 2023, at which time power steering lines and the power steering fluid reservoir were replaced.

The cabin features heated power-adjustable front sport seats upholstered in black Nappa leather. Interior amenities include cruise control, navigation, Harman Kardon audio, and automatic climate control. The air conditioning system was recharged in August 2023. Photos detailing wear on the interior surfaces are included in the gallery.

The multi-function leather-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque. Work in August 2023 included cleaning the fuel system, changing the oil, and replacing the valve cover gasket, fuel filter, radiator fan clutch, air filter, ignition coils, and spark plugs. The seller notes that the engine mounts need to be replaced. The results from a March 2024 inspection report are included in the gallery.
Power is routed to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. The clutch needs to be replaced.
The Carfax report is free from accidents or other reported damage.

title: 2006 BMW M3 Coupe Competition Package
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 coupe was ordered with the Competition Package and is modified with a CSL-style trunk lid, Eventuri carbon-fiber intake, MAP sensor conversion kit, sway bars, and ECU and TCU tunes. The car is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic over black Nappa leather and is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six linked with a six-speed SMG sequential transmission and a limited-slip differential. Other features comprise a PureTech Sweden rear chassis brace, 19″ Style 163M wheels, CPI headers, and a Rogue Engineering exhaust system. The current owner purchased the car in 2018 and has since added approximately 16k of the under 83k indicated miles. This E46 M3 was listed on BaT in June 2024 and is now offered again on dealer consignment with a clean Carfax report and a clean Arizona title.

The car is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic and features matte Shadowline trim as well as a CSL-style trunk lid, a glass sunroof, xenon headlights, carbon-fiber front splitters, rain-sensing windshield wipers, LED tail lights, and quad exhaust outlets.

The 19″ M cross-spoke Style 163M alloy wheels are mounted with Michelin Pilot Sport Cup 2 tires. The car was factory equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and suspension modifications include adjustable front end links, 30.88mm front and 22.5mm rear sway bars, ECS Tuning wheel spacers, and Turner Motorsport greaseable control arm monoball bushings and sealed monoball rear trailing arm bushings. Braking is provided by four-wheel ventilated discs, and the ZCP Competition Package added an upgraded steering rack and larger cross-drilled brake rotors. The front lower control arms are said to have been replaced.

The power-adjustable front sport seats are upholstered in black Nappa leather complemented by BMW Individual carbon-fiber trim on the dashboard. A PureTech Sweden rear chassis brace is mounted in the trunk area, and interior amenities include cruise control, a Harman Kardon sound system, automatic climate control, an aftermarket infotainment screen, and a center armrest delete kit. The Carfax report notes that the left and right airbags were replaced in January 2019.

The microsuede-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and a yellow centering stripe and is modified with aftermarket shift paddles. Instrumentation consists of a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates under 83k miles, approximately 16k of which were added under current ownership.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six sends power to the rear wheels through a six-speed SMG sequential transmission and a limited-slip differential. Engine and transmission modifications include the following:
A metal belly pan is also installed.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

title: 47k-Mile 2005 BMW M3 Coupe Competition Package 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2005 BMW M3 coupe is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six linked with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential, and it was optioned with the Competition, Cold Weather, and Premium packages. The car is finished in blue over black leather and has been modified with a carbon-fiber intake, aftermarket engine management software, Supersprint headers, a CSL-specification front sway bar, Porsche 996-sourced brake calipers, and Ohlins Racing coilovers. Additional features include 19″ Style 163M wheels, a carbon-fiber roof panel, a CSL-style trunk lid and rear diffuser, xenon headlights, an AutoSolutions short shifter, an Alcantara-wrapped M Sport steering wheel, and heated and power-adjustable Cobra Nogaro front bucket seats. Acquired by the seller in 2014, this E46 M3 has 47k miles and is offered with the window sticker, an owner’s manual, service records, spare parts, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Massachusetts title in the seller’s name.

The car left the factory finished in Interlagos Blue Metallic (A30) and is said to have been repainted in the factory shade under previous ownership. The car has been fitted with a CSL-style trunk lid and rear diffuser, and a Karbonius carbon-fiber roof panel was installed in place of the factory sunroof in 2022 according to the seller. Other exterior details include Shadowline trim, xenon headlights, headlight washers, fog lights, rain-sensing windshield wipers, LED tail lights, and quad exhaust outlets. The seller notes that the car sustained damage to the right rear under current ownership and reports that the right quarter panel was repaired and the right taillight was replaced as a result. The windshield and window weatherstripping are said to have been replaced in 2022.

This is a relist after the vehicle was previously sold on BaT in May 2024 and the winning bidder failed to follow through with their commitment to purchase. This was not due to any fault with the vehicle. The winner’s participation on BaT has been restricted and their buyer’s fee was not refunded.

The 19″ M cross-spoke Style 163M wheels were added in 2023 and are wrapped in 235/35 front and 265/30 rear Michelin Pilot Sport 4S tires that are said to have been mounted in 2021. The car was factory equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and the ZCP Competition Package added an upgraded steering rack. Modifications are said to include the following components:

Cobra Nogaro front bucket seats trimmed in black upholstery have been installed and are heated and power-adjustable according to the seller. Milled-Effect Aluminum trim accents the interior, and other details include automatic climate control, Harman Kardon audio, and a BMW Business CD stereo that was installed in place of the factory-equipped navigation system. The seller notes that a European-specification parcel shelf and an AutoSolutions short shifter are installed. The front passenger airbag was replaced in 2021 and the headliner was replaced in 2022.

The Alcantara-wrapped M Sport steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 47k miles, approximately 13k of which were added under current ownership.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six breathes through a Karbonius carbon-fiber intake and is said to be equipped with aftermarket engine management software. A SPAL electric fan, Supersprint V1 headers, and Supersprint catalytic converters are said to be additional modifications. The seller notes that the double-VANOS system has been upgraded with a rebuilt solenoid coil pack and a replacement oil pump disc and exhaust upper chain guide. An Antigravity lithium-ion battery was installed in 2023.

Power is routed to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. A subframe reinforcement kit was installed in 2018. The clutch delay valve is said to have been removed.
The window sticker lists initial delivery to Ralph Schomp BMW of Littleton, Colorado, along with factory equipment, colors, options, and a total suggested retail price of $60,695.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

title: Single-Family-Owned 2001 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2001 BMW M3 coupe was purchased new by the seller’s relative from Santa Monica BMW in California, and it now has 100k miles following registration history in that state. The car is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six linked with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential and is finished in Carbon Black Metallic over black Nappa leather. It was optioned with the Cold Weather and Luxury packages, and additional equipment includes 18″ M double-spoke wheels, a power sunroof, xenon headlights, heated power-adjustable front sport seats, a Harman Kardon sound system, and automatic climate control. Acquired by the seller in 2014, this E46 M3 is offered with a window sticker, manufacturer’s literature, service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean California title.

The car is finished in Carbon Black Metallic (416) and is fitted with Shadowline trim as well as xenon headlights, fog lights, a glass sunroof, a trunk lid spoiler, and quad exhaust outlets. The left exhaust outlet and the window and windshield trim are damaged, the paint finish is blemished on the hood, roof, and trunk, and there is a scrape on the rear diffuser. The driver’s door has been refinished, per the seller, who notes a loose left rear body panel. Close-up photographs of the exterior finish and trim are shown in the gallery below.

The 18″ M double-spoke Style 67 wheels are mounted with Michelin Pilot Super Sport tires. The car was factory-equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and braking is provided by four-wheel ventilated discs. There are cracks in the rear tires and curb marks on the wheels.

The cabin features heated power-adjustable front sport seats upholstered in black Nappa leather, and High-Gloss Black trim accents the dash and door panels. Interior amenities include cruise control, Harman Kardon audio, automatic climate control, a BMW Business CD stereo, and a trunk-mounted CD changer. The pillar upholstery is loose and there is wear on the driver’s seat bolster.

The multi-function leather-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 100k miles, approximately 3k of which were added under current ownership.
The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory-rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque. The seller notes that the rod bearing recall service was performed in February 2005.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. The undertray is damaged.
The window sticker lists initial delivery to Santa Monica BMW in California, as well as factory colors, equipment, and a total suggested retail price of $52,995.
The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.
The California title carries a duplicate notation.

title: 48k-Mile 2001 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2001 BMW M3 coupe was first registered in California and spent time in Oregon before the seller’s acquisition on BaT in June 2019, and it now has 48k miles. It is finished in Imola Red II over black Nappa leather and is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six linked with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. The car has been modified with Koni shocks, Eibach lowering springs, a front strut tower bar, and an aftermarket head unit. Additional equipment includes the Cold Weather and Luxury packages as well as 18″ wheels, a power sunroof, xenon headlights, heated power-adjustable front sport seats, and automatic climate control. This E46 M3 is now offered with spare parts, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Colorado title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Imola Red II (405) and is fitted with Shadowline trim as well as xenon headlights, “angel eye” lights, a glass sunroof, tinted windows, a trunk lid spoiler, and quad exhaust outlets. Signs of paintwork are noted on the right quarter panel. Close-up photos of the paintwork and trim are presented in the gallery.

The 18″ M double-spoke Style 67 wheels are mounted with 225/45 front and 255/40 rear Continental ExtremeContact DWS06 tires. title: LS7-Powered 2002 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
transmission: Tremec T56 Magnum Six-Speed Manual Transmission
listing_details: Tremec T56 Magnum Six-Speed Manual Transmission
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 coupe was acquired by the seller in 2019 and has since been modified with a 7.0L LS7 V8 fitted with a wet sump conversion, a Tremec T56 Magnum six-speed manual transmission, a custom exhaust system, and an aluminum driveshaft and radiator. The suspension features H&R springs, Koni shocks, UUC sway bars, and Ground Control front adjustable camber plates, while the brakes were upgraded with Porsche 996 calipers, Euro CSL rotors, and stainless steel lines. The car is finished in Steel Grey Metallic over Cinnamon Nappa leather, and additional equipment includes the Premium and Cold Weather packages along with 19″ M cross-spoke wheels, a power sunroof, a Euro front bumper, and an Alpine touchscreen head unit. This E46 M3 has 112k miles and is now offered with a window sticker, build records and photos, the owner’s manual, and a clean Virginia title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Steel Grey Metallic (400) and is equipped with Shadowline trim and a Euro front bumper. The seller states the bumpers, side skirts, and lower headlight trim pieces have been refinished. Additional equipment includes xenon headlights, a glass sunroof, a trunk lid spoiler, and quad exhaust outlets. The rear Park Distance Control sensors are said to be unreliable. Paint meter readings taken around the body are provided at the end of the gallery.

The 19″ M cross-spoke Style 163M wheels are mounted with Falken Azenis RT660 tires that measure 245/35 up front and 275/30 out back. The car was factory equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and braking is provided by Porsche 996 calipers over Euro CSL rotors with stainless steel lines at each corner. H&R sport springs and Koni shocks have been added, along with the following components:

The power-adjustable front sport seats are upholstered in Cinnamon Nappa leather and were refurbished under current ownership. The pillar covers were also replaced and the center armrest was reupholstered in black with M tri-color stitching, which extends to the leather shift boot and parking brake boot. WeatherTech liners are fitted in the footwells, and additional sound deadening has reportedly been added below the carpets. The Alpine touchscreen head unit is wired to an Alpine four-channel amplifier, a JBL 8″ powered subwoofer under the driver’s seat, and Bavarian Sound Works speakers. The heated seats, cruise control, and traction control are inoperative.

The multi-function steering wheel was re-trimmed under current ownership and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. Speedhut oil pressure and oil temperature gauges have been added ahead of the shifter. The digital odometer indicates 112k miles, approximately 3k of which were added under current ownership.

The 7.0L LS7 V8 crate engine was installed in June 2021 and features a wet sump conversion that utilizes a Holley oil pan, a Melling high-pressure oil pump, and a PowerBond Race Performance harmonic damper. Cooling is through a Koyorad aluminum radiator with a SPAL electric fan and a Mishimoto adjustable fan controller. The exhaust system incorporates Vorshlag long tube headers and 3″ stainless steel pipes with Borla ProXS mufflers and a Magnaflow X-pipe, catalytic converters, and resonators. Additional engine components include the following parts:

Power is routed to the rear wheels via a Tremec T56 Magnum six-speed manual transmission, a Vorshlag aluminum driveshaft, and a limited-slip differential, which was rebuilt with Racing Diffs components. A Tilton twin disc clutch, flywheel, and throw out bearing were also added. A Turner Motorsports front subframe reinforcement kit and Practical Performance rear subframe kit were installed in 2020.
A dyno graph from 2022 is provided above.
The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage.

title: 3.5L Stroker-Powered 2002 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed Track Car
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 coupe is powered by an S54 inline-six that was rebuilt by VAC Motorsports with a 3.5-liter stroker kit featuring a billet crankshaft, Carillo pistons and connecting rods, an ATI Super Damper front crank hub, and upgraded oil and VANOS systems. The sequential transmission was converted to manual operation, and a DKM twin-disc clutch and flywheel kit was installed along with a Diffsonline triple-clutch “Quick Ramp” differential. The interior has been stripped and OMP seats have been installed along with a Studio RSR bolt-in roll bar, and the car also has a reinforced rear subframe, triple-adjustable Motion Control Suspension coilovers, StopTech brakes, and a BimmerWorld 3″ race exhaust system, 18″ TA5R wheels, and carbon-fiber rear wing and trunk lid. Acquired by the selling dealer in 2023 and now with 212k miles, this E46 M3 is now offered at no reserve with a clean Carfax report and a clean Oregon title.

The 18×10″ BimmerWorld TA5R wheels are mounted with 275/35 Toyo Proxes R888r tires all around. The power steering pump has been replaced and the parking brake has been disabled. The selling dealer reports that the following components have been installed:

The interior was stripped, sound insulation material was removed, and OMP seats were installed along with Schroth harnesses, Hard Motorsports door cards, diamond-plate floor panels, and a Studio RSR bolt-in roll bar.

The S54 inline-six was rebuilt in June 2022 by VAC Motorsports with a 3.5-liter stroker kit featuring a billet crankshaft, Carillo pistons and rods, an ATI Super Damper front crank hub, and upgraded oil and VANOS systems. The head was ported and polished and Schrick 288/280 camshafts and coated rocker arms were installed along with VAC Motorsport race springs, a CSL-style intake system, and CPI headers. An Alpha N tune has been flashed, the starter and alternator were replaced, and an oil catch can and Zionsville Autosport radiator with an integrated shroud and fan were installed as well. The six-speed transmission has been converted to manual operation, and a DKM twin-disc clutch and flywheel kit was installed along with a Diffsonline triple-clutch “quick ramp” differential. The rear subframe mounts were reinforced, and a BimmerWorld 3″ race exhaust system and a VAC Motorsports fuel-starvation kit were also installed.

title: 49k-Mile 2006 BMW M3 Convertible
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 convertible has 49k miles, and it was purchased by the owner in May 2020. This E46 M3 is now offered by the seller on behalf of their spouse with the owner’s manual, service records, and a clean North Carolina title.

The car is finished in Silver Grey Metallic and is equipped with a black convertible soft top as well as xenon headlights, rear parking sensors, fog lights, rain-sensing windshield wipers, a rear lip spoiler, LED tail lights, and quad exhaust outlets. The 19″ M double-spoke Style 67 wheels are mounted with Continental ExtremeContact tires. The car was factory equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and braking is provided by four-wheel ventilated discs. Work in March 2024 included replacing the power steering belt pulley along with power steering lines and sway bar end links.

The power-adjustable front sport seats and door-panel inserts are upholstered in Grey Nappa leather, and the cabin features a black dashboard with Brushed Aluminum Shadow trim accents. title: 23k-Mile 2006 BMW M3 Coupe Competition Package 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 coupe was ordered new with the Competition Package, and it was registered in California until it was sold on BaT in August 2019. The six-speed SMG transmission was converted for manual operation before it was acquired by the selling dealer in 2021, and subsequent work consisted of reinforcing the rear subframe, upgrading the VANOS system, and replacing the rod bearings and assorted interior and exterior trim. Paint meter readings are viewable in the gallery below.

The 19″ M cross-spoke Style 163M wheels are mounted with 225/40 front and 255/35 rear Michelin Pilot Sport 4S tires that were reportedly purchased in March 2021. The ZCP Competition Package added an upgraded steering rack and larger cross-drilled brake rotors. The car was factory equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and braking is provided by four-wheel ventilated discs.

Interior amenities include automatic climate control, navigation, and a Harman Kardon sound system. The A-pillar panels and assorted interior trim pieces have been replaced.

The double-VANOS system was upgraded and the connecting rod bearings were replaced in 2023, and the power-steering pulley was replaced time. Work performed in September 2023 consisted of an oil change and replacing the air conditioning compressor, valve cover gasket, idler pulley, power steering pump pulley, belt tensioner, serpentine belt, and intake manifold gaskets.

Power is routed to the rear wheels via six-speed SMG transmission that was converted to manual operation under previous ownership. The car is also equipped with a limited-slip differential and Dinan rear exhaust components. The subframe was reinforced in 2023.

excerpt: This 2003 BMW M3 is an LCI coupe that was initially delivered to Roseville BMW in California and remained in that state with its original owner until the selling dealer’s acquisition in 2023. Indicating 26k miles, the car is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six linked with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential, and it is finished in Imola Red II over black Nappa leather upholstery. Equipment includes the Cold Weather Package, the Premium Package, 19″ M double-spoke wheels, xenon headlights, a sunroof, heated power-adjustable front seats, a BMW business CD stereo, and a Harman Kardon sound system. The car is finished in Imola Red II (405) and is equipped with Shadowline trim as well as xenon headlights, LED tail lights, a sunroof, fog lights, rain-sensing windshield wipers, a trunk lid spoiler, and quad exhaust outlets. title: 2006 BMW M3 Coupe Competition Package 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 coupe was ordered new with the Competition package, and it is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six mated to a six-speed SMG transmission that has been converted to manual operation. Finished in Interlagos Blue Metallic over black leather upholstery, the car has been modified with a CSL-style trunk lid and rear diffuser, Z4 M-sourced heated sport seats, Ohlins coilover suspension, Ground Control camber plates, a carbon-fiber intake manifold, catless downpipes, Supersprint mid-pipes, and a Turner Motorsports subframe reinforcement kit. Additional equipment includes a limited-slip differential with 4.10:1 gearing, 19″ M cross-spoke wheels, a power sunroof, xenon headlights, Park Distance Control, navigation, and a Harman Kardon sound system. Work completed since 2020 has included rebuilding the VANOS system and replacing the rod bearings and oil pan gasket. An August 2008 entry in the Carfax report lists an accident with no additional information, and photographs of paint-meter readings are presented in the gallery.

Silver 19″ M cross-spoke Style 163M wheels were refinished in 2024 and are wrapped in 225/40 front and 265/35 rear Michelin Pilot Sport 4S tires that have 2023 date codes. Braking is provided by four-wheel ventilated discs, and the ZCP Competition Package added an upgraded steering rack and larger cross-drilled brake rotors. The front brake pads and rotors were replaced in February 2024.

The cabin features Z4 M-sourced heated and power-adjustable front sport seats upholstered in black leather. Milled-Effect Aluminum trim accents the dashboard and door panels, and interior amenities include navigation, Harman Kardon audio, position memory for the driver, an Alcantara shift boot, and automatic climate control.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 148k miles.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six has been fitted with an aftermarket carbon-fiber intake manifold, catless headers, and Supersprint mid-pipes. The VANOS system was rebuilt in 2020, the spark plugs were replaced in 2021, the oil pan gasket was replaced in 2022, and the rod bearings were replaced in July 2023. The air temperature sensor and hood struts were replaced in February 2024.

Power is routed to the rear wheels through a six-speed SMG transmission that was converted to manual operation in January 2022, and the car is equipped with a limited-slip differential with 4.10:1 gearing and Poweflex bushings. A Turner Motorsports subframe reinforcement kit was installed in 2017.
The Carfax report shows the aforementioned August 2008 damage and lists registration history in Illinois, Wisconsin, California, and Washington.

title: 2001 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2001 BMW M3 coupe has remained registered in the state of Washington since it was reportedly acquired new by the seller’s uncle. The seller’s father acquired the car in 2020 and subsequent modifications have included installing an aftermarket muffler and resonator as well as 18″ Apex ARC-8 wheels, smoked turn signal lenses, black-finished kidney grilles, a UUC short shifter, and a Continental stereo. Power is provided by a 3.2-liter inline-six mated to a six-speed manual transmission, and the car is finished in Steel Gray Metallic over black Nappa leather and cloth upholstery. Additional equipment includes replacement xenon headlights, a sunroof, all-weather floor mats, and automatic climate control. This E46 M3 coupe has 177k miles and is now offered at no reserve in Oregon by the seller on behalf of the current owner with service records, a car cover, a Carfax report, and a clean Washington title in the owner’s name.

The car is finished in Steel Gray Metallic (400) and features black trim and kidney grilles, smoked turn signal lenses, fog lights, a glass sunroof, a trunk lid spoiler, and quad exhaust outlets. The Carfax report contains a July 2022 entry describing damage to the front of the car, which is said to have resulted from a low-speed collision. Following the incident, Center Collision of Tacoma, Washington, replaced the hood, front bumper cover, radiator supports, fan, and xenon headlights. The right-side mirror was replaced after it was damaged due to vandalism, which is noted in a February 2023 entry in the Carfax report. Blemishes are visible on the rear bumper cover and cracking trim pieces are noted at the rear windows.

Apex ARC-8 18″ wheels are finished in Anthracite and are mounted with 225/45 front Michelin and 265/35 rear Continental tires. The car was factory equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and braking is handled by four-wheel ventilated discs. The brake pads and rotors were replaced in 2023. Curb rash is visible on the front-right wheel, and that tire leaks air. The seller recommends replacing both front tires.

The manually-adjustable front sport seats, the rear bench, and the door-panel inserts are trimmed in black Nappa leather with Anthracite Impuls cloth inserts. Gloss black trim accents the cabin, which is further appointed with automatic climate control, cruise control, a Harman Kardon sound system, and a Continental stereo with an auxiliary input as well as all-weather floor mats in the footwells and trunk. A UUC short shifter has been installed along with a ZHP shift knob with an Alcantara boot. The driver’s seat bolster was reupholstered in 2020. The black headliner is wrinkled at the right-side A pillar and has become detached at the C pillars. Some of the speakers are inoperative and wear and discoloration are visible on the passenger’s seat upholstery.

The leather-wrapped multifunction steering wheel frames an M-branded 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 177k miles, approximately 35k of which were added under current ownership.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque. A Status Gruppe section two x-pipe and an aftermarket resonator and muffler have been installed. The connecting rod bearing recall service was performed in October 2004, the spark plugs were replaced in January 2020, and the alternator was replaced in February 2022.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. The axle shaft oil seal was replaced in January 2020.
The Carfax report shows the aforementioned 2022 and 2023 damage reports and lists registration history in the state of Washington since new.

title: 2001 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed

The car spent time in the southwest and southeast regions of the US and received subframe reinforcement and a replacement clutch assembly under prior ownership. It was acquired by the seller on BaT in February 2023, and subsequent work involved installing Fabspeed Motorsport catalytic converters as well as replacement oxygen sensors and spark plugs. This E46 M3 has 191k miles and is now offered with a Carfax report and a clean Colorado title in the seller’s name.

The car left the factory finished in Laguna Seca Blue (448) and features Shadowline trim as well as a glass sunroof, a decklid spoiler, xenon headlights, fog lights, and quad exhaust outlets. “Disabling damage” to the front of the car is indicated in a November 2004 Carfax report entry. Cracks in the body filler on the left-rear quarter panel were repaired in 2019, at which time the decklid, rear bumper cover, and rear quarter panels were refinished. The left-front turn signal is not working, and blemishes include cracked body filler on the left rear quarter panel and areas of peeling paint on the roof.

VMR 19″ V703 wheels are mounted over 15mm front and 5mm rear wheel spacers via Turner Motorsports wheel studs, and they are wrapped in 255/30 front and 275/30 rear Hankook Ventus V12 evo2 tires. Modifications involve a ZHP-specification steering gear, Turner Motorsports anti-roll bars, ECS Tuning coilovers, lower control arm travel limiters, urethane lower control arm bushings, Reddish rear subframe plates, and ECS Tuning CSL-style front brake caliper brackets and front brake rotors.

The power-adjustable front sport seats were re-trimmed in gray leather under prior ownership, while high-gloss black accents adorn the dash and door handles. The driver seat is heated, and the cabin is appointed with automatic climate control, an aftermarket short shifter, and an aftermarket touchscreen stereo linked with an amplifier and replacement speakers up front. A strut brace and custom trim panels have been fitted in the trunk. A replacement passenger-side airbag was installed in May 2015, and a past interior refresh included replacing the GM5 central locking module and center console in addition to reupholstering the headliner and pillars. The front passenger seat heater does not work.

The multifunction steering wheel wears an aftermarket leather wrap and frames a 185-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a variable redline, and supplementary gauges. The digital odometer indicates 191k miles, approximately just under 1,000 of which were added under current ownership. The airbag and taillight warning lights are illuminated, though the seller notes that the taillights and rear brake lights are functional.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six is spanned by a Mason Engineering strut tower brace and it received a double-VANOS system overhaul with Biesan Solutions components in 2014. Modifications are said to include revised engine tuning, Fabspeed Motorsport catalytic converters, and additional aftermarket exhaust components. The rod bearings were replaced under previous ownership, and work under current ownership involved installing replacement oxygen sensors in addition to a battery, spark plugs, and a cabin air filter. The oil was also changed.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. Past work completed from 2018 through February 2023 is said to have included installing a replacement clutch assembly and subframe reinforcement kit in addition to the transmission mount, differential mounts, and subframe bushings. A fluid leak from the engine bay is noted as well as corrosion near a jack point, and additional photos of the underside are presented in the gallery below.
The Carfax report notes the aforementioned damage and displays history in California, Texas, Arizona, Florida, Georgia, Tennessee, Alabama, and Colorado

The multifunction leather-wrapped steering has M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was rebuilt in 2021 by Center Auto Machine Shop with forged CP pistons, forged Carrillo connecting rods, ARP L19 head studs, Supertech valve springs and valves, and a Maximum PSI turbo kit with a front-mount intercooler, a Precision Turbo 6266 turbocharger, a Synapse blow-off valve, and a TiAL Sport MV-R 44mm wastegate. The VANOS system was overhauled by Dr. Vanos, and dual 19-row oil coolers, a CSF aluminum radiator, an oil catch can, and dual electric cooling fans were also installed. The engine runs on a Syvecs S7Plus stand-alone control unit, and the dual Walbro fuel pumps are connected via AN lines to a Radium Engineering fuel rail and Injector Dynamics ID1050X injectors. The seller states that the engine generates 526 horsepower at the wheels with 12psi of boost pressure.

Power is routed to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. A DKM twin-disk clutch and a Driveshaft Shop single-piece chromoly driveshaft have been installed along with a Drift HQ billet differential brace, UUC MotorWerks transmission mounts, and ECS Tuning polyurethane differential bushings. Tuning was performed by Bend Calibration.
The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage and lists registration history in Wisconsin, New York, Connecticut, and Montana.

title: 2003 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2003 BMW M3 convertible is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six linked with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential, and it is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic over Imola Red Nappa leather. Other details include a black soft top, 18″ M double-spoke wheels, heated power-adjustable front sport seats, a Harman Kardon sound system, and automatic climate control. The car was first registered in New York and spent time in Ohio before it was acquired by the seller in 2011. Service since 2020 has included replacement of the valve cover gasket, water pump, thermostat, and belt tensioners as well as the front tie rods. This E46 M3 has 101k miles and is offered at no reserve with the owner’s manual, service records, a 2023 Blackstone Laboratories oil analysis report, spare parts, a Carfax report, and a clean Louisiana title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic with a black convertible soft top and has been fitted with aftermarket LED “angel eyes,” clear side markers, and a carbon-fiber trunk lid, rear diffuser, front splitters, and side skirts. Other details include xenon headlights, fog lights, rain-sensing windshield wipers, and LED tail lights. Accidents are noted on the Carfax report in 2003 and 2015, the latter of which resulted in replacement of the front bump cover, left headlight, hood, and grille. The right window was replaced under current ownership. Close-up photos of the paint and soft top condition are provided in the gallery below.

The 18″ M double-spoke wheels are wrapped in 225/45 front and 255/40 rear Michelin Pilot Super Sport tires that the seller reports need to be replaced. Koni shocks are installed along with lowering springs, polyurethane front control arm bushings, and 15mm front and 12mm rear wheel spacers. Rear trailing arm bushing limiters have also been fitted according to the seller. The front tie rods were replaced in 2020.

The heated power-adjustable front sport seats and door-panel inserts are upholstered in Imola Red Nappa leather, and the cabin features a black dashboard with Brushed Aluminum Shadow trim accents. Interior amenities include driver seat memory settings, automatic climate control, cruise control, a wind deflector, and Harman Kardon audio. The passenger airbag was replaced in 2021, and the seller notes the driver’s airbag was also replaced at that time. The convertible top C-pillars have reportedly been repaired. Imperfections are visible on the center console and door panels, and the center-right air conditioning vent does not blow cold air according to the seller.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 101k miles, approximately 34k of which were added under current ownership.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque. The double-VANOS system was upgraded in 2016 and an ECS Tuning silicone intake elbow has been fitted. Work in 2020 included replacing the valve cover gasket, water pump, thermostat, and belt tensioners.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. The differential bushings and axle seals are said to have been replaced in 2022, at which time a crack in the mid-pipe flange was repaired.

An owner’s manual will accompany the car along with a 2023 Blackstone Laboratories oil analysis, a space-saver spare wheel and tire assembly, a car cover, spare and removed parts, and service records.
The Carfax report notes the aforementioned damage reports and lists history in New York, Ohio, and Louisiana.

title: 2006 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 coupe is finished in Jet Black over Cinnamon leather and powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six linked with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. Aftermarket 19″ wheels, Dinan engine management software, clear turn signal lenses, Koni adjustable dampers, H&R springs, and larger brake rotors were added under previous ownership, and additional equipment includes xenon headlights with LED accents as well as a sunroof, heated power-adjustable front seats, Harman Kardon Audio, and an AM/FM stereo. The car was acquired by the seller on BaT in November 2020, and subsequent work is said to have included replacing the fuel filter, PCV valve, battery, and front tires. This E46 M3 indicates 102k miles and is now offered in New Jersey with manufacturer’s literature, partial service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean New York title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Jet Black (668) and features xenon headlights with aftermarket LED “halo” accents as well as Shadowline trim, clear front turn signal lenses, fog lights, a power sunroof, a decklid spoiler, a carbon fiber rear diffuser, body-color front corner reflectors, and quad exhaust outlets. Aftermarket tinting has been added to the rear and side windows, the trunk M3 badge has been removed, and the key hole on the left door has been covered. Paint chips are noted on the front fascia, the front bumper cover has been touched up, and a scuff is present on the right quarter panel.

Aftermarket 19″ Morr VS8 forged wheels wear 245/35 front and 273/30 rear Continental ExtremeContact Sport tires. Braking and suspension modifications under previous ownership included the installation of Koni adjustable dampers, H&R springs, and larger front and rear brake rotors with Textar pads. The seller reports that the front tires were replaced in March 2022, and an alignment was performed in May 2022.

The cabin features heated power-adjustable front seats upholstered in Cinnamon Nappa leather along with matching door panel inserts, black carpeting, and brushed aluminum shadow trim on the dash, center console, and doors. Amenities include driver seat position memory settings, automatic climate control, cruise control, rain-sensing windshield wipers, Harman Kardon audio, WeatherTech floor mats, and a short shifter with a ZHP-style shift knob. An airbag recall is said to have been addressed in December 2020. The clutch pedal reportedly squeaks when depressed, and indents are visible on the passenger-side dashboard trim.

The multi-function leather-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 102k miles, approximately 6,700 of which were added under current ownership. Wear is visible on the left side of the steering wheel.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was modified with Dinan Stage 1 engine management software prior to the seller’s acquisition. The throttle position sensor, idle control valve, and VANOS bolts are said to have been replaced during previous ownership, and service in 2021 reportedly included replacing the fuel filter and PCV valve. The seller states that the battery was replaced in June 2023.

Power is routed to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. Service performed during under previous ownership included resealing the differential and replacing the driveshaft center support bearing and flex disc. The driveshaft is said to have been replaced in January 2022.
Manufacturer’s literature and a set of M3-embroidered floor mats are included in the sale.
The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage and lists history in Missouri, New Jersey,  Pennsylvania, Washington, and New York.

title: 2003 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2003 BMW M3 convertible is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six paired with a six-speed transmission that was converted to manual operation in 2023. Finished in Titanium Silver Metallic over tan leather upholstery, the car is equipped with a limited-slip differential, a black soft top, 19″ M double-spoke wheels, xenon headlights, rear Park Distance Control, heated power-adjustable front sport seats, a Harman Kardon sound system, a Dynavin head unit, a backup camera, and automatic climate control. The seller acquired the car in 2022, and work under current ownership included fluid changes in addition to reupholstering the front seats, refinishing the wheels, and replacing the driver’s door latch and lock cylinder, rear shocks and springs, steering rack boot, clutch and hydraulic cylinders, oil level sensor, front differential mount and bolt, rear axles, idler pulley, and drive belts and tensioners. This E46 M3 has 103k miles and is now offered at no reserve with the owner’s manual, partial service records, a Carfax report, and a clean Maryland title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic and is fitted with a black convertible soft top as well as xenon headlights with washers, fog lights, rain-sensing windshield wipers, LED tail lights, rear Park Distance Control, and quad exhaust outlets. A June 2003 entry of the Carfax report lists damage to the front and rear, while a March 2016 entry notes “minor damage.” Scrapes are visible on the front bumper cover, the underside of which is deformed.

The 19″ M double-spoke Style 67 wheels were refinished in October 2023, feature replacement center caps, and wear 225/40 front and 255/35 rear Continental ExtremeContact tires. The car was factory equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and braking is provided by red-finished calipers over four-wheel ventilated discs. A replacement power steering hose was fitted in May 2022, and work in September 2023 included replacing the steering rack boot along with the rear shocks and springs.

The heated power-adjustable front sport seats are upholstered in tan leather and are complemented by a color-coordinated lower dash, door panels, and carpets. Interior amenities include automatic climate control, cruise control, a back-up camera, driver-seat position memory settings, and a Dynavin head unit with Apple CarPlay. Blemishes are visible on the dashboard, door panels, steering wheel trim, and center console. The front seats were reupholstered in September 2023, at which time the driver’s door latch and lock cylinder were replaced.

The multi-function leather-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The rod bearings were reportedly replaced in 2004, an oil change was performed and the oil level sensor was replaced in September 2023, and work in October 2023 included replacing the idler pulley in addition to the drive belts and tensioners.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed transmission, which was converted to manual operation in 2023. The car is equipped with a limited-slip differential. Replacement clutch and hydraulic cylinders were installed in September 2023, and the front differential mount and bolt, differential fluid, and rear axles were replaced in October 2023.

title: 2001 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2001 BMW M3 is a Phoenix Yellow Metallic coupe powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six linked with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. Ground Control coilover suspension, Porsche-sourced brake calipers, Apex ARC-8 18″ wheels, a stainless-steel muffler, aftermarket lighting, a European-style front bumper cover, and an Eventuri intake have been installed along with black leather upholstery, a touchscreen infotainment system, a rearview camera, and a European-specification center console. The rear subframe mounts have been reinforced and the VANOS system was serviced in 2019, and the car now has 83k miles. Acquired by the seller in 2019, this E46 M3 is now offered with the owner’s manual, service records, a Carfax report, and a clean California title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Phoenix Yellow Metallic (445) with Shadowline trim. Aftermarket headlights and taillights have been installed along with a carbon-fiber lower rear valance, and the windows have been tinted. “Minor damage” is listed on the Carfax report in September 2019. The seller states that the the European-style front bumper cover and right-front fender were repainted to address paint chips, and the front tow hook cover is missing.

Apex ARC-8 18″ wheels are secured via a wheel stud conversion, and they are mounted with 245/40 front and 275/35 rear Continental ExtremeContact Sport tires. The adjustable Ground Control coilover springs are mounted on Koni shocks, and Porsche-specification front calipers have been installed along with CSL-specification rotors and a RallyRoad brake hose kit. The rear trailing arm bushings and lower control arms were replaced in December 2019.

The factory gray interior was replaced with black components, and the emergency brake lever was re-trimmed with Alcantara upholstery. A European-specification center console was installed along with a touchscreen infotainment system linked to a rearview camera and Bavsound speakers, and a ZHP-specification shift knob was installed in December 2019.

The steering wheel was retrimmed with perforated grips, a tri-color centering stripe, and tri-color stitching. The digital odometer indicates 83k miles, approximately 8k of which were added under current ownership.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque, and an Eventuri intake has been installed. The rod bearing recall service was performed in March 2007, and the VANOS system was overhauled in December 2019 with rebuilt solenoids, a rattle repair kit, and replacement guides and seals. The starter was replaced in March 2020, an oil change was performed in November 2022.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. The subframe mounts were reinforced in December 2019, at which time the driveshaft flex disc was replaced along with the differential mounts. A stainless-steel muffler has been installed.
The Carfax report shows the aforementioned damage report and lists history in Colorado and California.

title: 2001 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2001 BMW M3 coupe has remained registered in California since new, and it is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six linked with a six-speed manual transmission. Finished in Laguna Seca Blue over gray Nappa leather upholstery, the car was optioned with the Cold Weather and Luxury packages as well as heated power-adjustable front sport seats, xenon headlights, and automatic climate control. Modifications include an aftermarket limited-slip differential, 18″ BBS E88 wheels, Ohlins coilovers, Hotchkis sway bars, a CSL trunk lid, a CSL-style rear diffuser, a carbon-fiber front spoiler, and a Pioneer stereo head unit linked with ZAPCO audio components. Acquired by the seller in 2016, this E46 M3 has 153k miles and is now offered with a window sticker, manufacturer’s literature, two keys, service records, a Carfax report, and a clean California title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Laguna Seca Blue (448) and is equipped with Shadowline trim as well as xenon headlights, fog lights, rain-sensing wipers, and quad exhaust outlets. Exterior modifications include a CSL trunk lid and and a CSL-style diffuser with a carbon-fiber insert as well as a carbon-fiber front spoiler, body-color front corner reflectors, black kidneys grilles and fender vents, and rolled front fenders. The Carfax report lists damage to the front and left-rear portions of the car in December 2012, February 2014, August 2015, and December 2015 damage reports. The front bumper cover is said to have been repainted. A paint chip is visible on the left mirror cap, the window seal is raised at the rear of the right door, scratches are present in front of the sunroof, rub marks are shown on the inner portion of the front wheel arches, and the seller reports that the sunroof guide tracks need to be replaced and paint protection film has been applied to the rocker panels, hood, and mirrors.

The 18″ BBS E88 wheels feature polished lips and are mounted with 275/35 Nitto NT-01 tires that show 2017 production codes. Ohlins coilovers have been installed along with Hotchkis sway bars and braided stainless-steel brake lines. The seller reports that PFC 08 brake pads have been fitted.

The heated power-adjustable front sport seats are upholstered in gray Nappa leather, and high-gloss black metallic trim accents the dashboard, center console, and door panels. Interior appointments include automatic climate control, cruise control, a UUC short shifter, a ValentineOne radar detector, and a touchscreen Pioneer stereo head unit linked with a ZAPCO amplifier, Harmon Kardon speakers, and rear crossover speakers. The center console ashtray cover is missing, the center armrest and outer driver-side seat bolster are worn, a portion of the right-rear headliner is loose, the right door does not unlock remotely, the right mirror controls are inoperative, and blemishes are visible on the shifter insert.

The multi-function leather-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 153k miles, approximately 11k of which were added under current ownership.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque. A rod bearing recall service was performed in February 2005, and the double-VANOS system was upgraded in August 2023. The seller reports that replacement headers and catalytic converters have been installed, and the car most recently passed the California emissions test in August 2023.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission. The seller states that an OS Giken Superlock limited-slip differential with a 3.91:1 final drive ratio has been installed along with Powerflex subframe and differential bushings, and SCZA rear exhaust components. The rear subframe was reinforced in September 2016, according to the seller.
The window sticker lists colors, options, and a total suggested retail price of $52,720. Two keys, manufacturer’s literature, and service records are included in the sale.

The Carfax report shows the aforementioned damage reports along with history in California. Open manufacturer safety recalls are listed for the driver-side and front passenger air bags in January 2017 and January 2020, respectively.

title: 2005 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed

Features include the Cold Weather Package as well as a black soft top, 18″ M double-spoke wheels, xenon headlights with washers, fog lights, heated power-adjustable front sport seats, a Harman Kardon sound system, a wind deflector, and automatic climate control. This E46 M3 is now offered with a window sticker, factory literature, service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Massachusetts title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Phoenix Yellow Metallic and is equipped with a black convertible soft top as well as xenon headlights with washers, fog lights, and quad exhaust outlets. A scratch on the front bumper cover has been repaired, and a blemish is present on the trunk lid, per the seller.

The 18″ M double-spoke Style 67 wheels are mounted with staggered-width BFGoodrich tires. The car was factory equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and braking is provided by four-wheel ventilated discs.

The heated power-adjustable front sport seats are upholstered in black leather, and High-Gloss Black trim accents the cabin. M3-branded floor mats line the footwells, and interior amenities include automatic climate control, cruise control, driver-seat position memory settings, a CD stereo, a wind deflector, and Harman Kardon audio. A tear on the headliner is said to have been repaired.

The multi-function leather-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 50k miles.
The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque. The rod bearing recall service was performed at approximately 22k miles.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential.
The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage and lists history in New Jersey and Massachusetts.

title: 2002 BMW M3 Coupe
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 coupe is finished in Oxford Green II Metallic over Cinnamon Nappa leather, and it was optioned with the Premium and Cold Weather Packages, which together provided heated power-adjustable front seats and a power sunroof. The car is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six linked with a six-speed SMG sequential transmission and a limited-slip differential. Additional features include 18″ M double-spoke wheels, xenon headlights, Park Distance Control, a BMW Business CD stereo, a Harman Kardon sound system, rain-sensing wipers, a self-dimming mirror, and automatic climate control. The seller acquired the car in December 2020, and subsequent work is noted to have included replacing the rod bearings and reinforcing the subframe. This E46 M3 has 80k miles and is now offered with a clean Carfax report and a clean Alabama title.

The car is finished in Oxford Green II Metallic (430) and is equipped with Shadowline trim as well as xenon headlights, fog lights, rain-sensing wipers, a glass sunroof, Park Distance Control, a trunk lid spoiler, and quad exhaust outlets. The windows were reportedly tinted under previous ownership, and the windshield cowl, hood emblem, and side marker lights have been replaced using FCP Euro parts. A ceramic coating was applied to the bodywork following a paint correction in August 2023. Imperfections include scuffing beneath the front bumper cover, worn rear window weather seals, and rock chips.

The 18″ M double-spoke wheels show curb marks and are mounted with Continental ExtremeContact Sport DWS 06 tires. The car was factory equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and braking is provided by four-wheel ventilated discs.

The heated power-adjustable front sport seats are upholstered in Cinnamon Nappa leather, and Titan Shadow trim adorns the dash and door panels. Interior amenities include automatic climate control, cruise control, a self-dimming mirror, a BMW Business CD stereo, and Harman Kardon audio. The C-pillar upholstery has been re-adhered, and the ignition lock module is a replacement. Scratches are noted on the center console near the parking brake.

The multi-function leather-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 80k miles, approximately 3,700 of which were added under current ownership.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque. The seller reports that the rod bearings were replaced approximately 200 miles ago using a VAC Motorsports kit with 11mm bolts. Photographs depicting the work are shown in the gallery below.

Power is routed to the rear wheels via a six-speed SMG sequential transmission and a limited-slip differential. An AKG Motorsport subframe reinforcement kit was is noted to have been installed recently, and polyurethane subframe bushings and rear trailing arm bushings have been fitted.
The Carfax report shows no accidents or damage and lists registration history in Colorado, Michigan, and Alabama.

title: 2005 BMW M3 Coupe Competition Package 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2005 BMW M3 coupe remained registered in California through the current owner’s acquisition in 2012, and subsequent modifications included converting the six-speed SMG transmission for manual operation as well as installing coilover suspension, aftermarket exhaust components, and wheel studs. Powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six, the car is finished in Estoril Blue Metallic over gray Nappa leather and is equipped with the Competition and Premium packages as well as a limited-slip differential, 19″ M cross-spoke wheels, a power sunroof, xenon headlights, Park Distance Control, heated power-adjustable front sport seats, a Harman Kardon sound system, and automatic climate control. Additional exterior details include Shadowline trim, xenon headlights, fog lights, a glass sunroof, rain-sensing windshield wipers, tinted windows, LED tail lights, Park Distance Control, a trunk lid spoiler, and quad Meisterschaft-branded exhaust outlets. The 19″ M cross-spoke Style 163M wheels secured with aftermarket wheel studs are mounted with 275/30 Michelin Pilot Sport 4S tires at all four corners. The ZCP Competition Package added an upgraded steering rack and larger cross-drilled brake rotors, and the seller states that polyurethane suspension bushings, wheel studs, and Status Gruppe SRS coilovers have been installed. Rub marks are visible on the rear tire sidewalls, and sidewall damage is shown on the right-rear tire.

The heated power-adjustable front sport seats and the door-panel inserts are upholstered in gray Nappa leather, and milled-effect aluminum trim accents the dashboard, door panels, and center console. Interior amenities include automatic climate control, driver-seat position memory, a microsuede shifter boot, a BMW Business CD stereo, and Harman Kardon audio.

The Alacntara-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 114k miles, approximately 67k of which were added under current ownership.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque, and the seller reports that an Eisenmann center exhaust section has been installed along with a Meisterschaft titanium rear muffler. The seller notes that the Vanos system was replaced in 2013

The six-speed SMG transmission has been converted to manual operation, and it sends power to the rear wheels through a limited-slip differential. The seller notes that the clutch was replaced at the time of the conversion.
The Carfax report shows the aforementioned collision damage along with history in California.
