title: 2001 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2001 BMW M3 coupe is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic over black Nappa leather and is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six linked with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. Equipment includes the Cold Weather and Luxury packages as well as a power sunroof, xenon headlights, heated power-adjustable front sport seats, a Harman Kardon sound system, and automatic climate control. Modifications consist of a short-throw shifter, a KW V2 suspension kit, 18″ APEX alloy wheels, and aftermarket exhaust components. The car was purchased by the seller on BaT in July 2022 and subsequent service included replacing the oil level sender, transmission gear oil, and connecting rod bearings. This E46 M3 has 130k miles and is now offered with a set of stock lug bolts, a window sticker, manufacturer’s literature, an accident-free Carfax report, and a clean Texas title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic and features Shadowline trim as well as xenon headlights, fog lights, black kidney grilles and fender vents, a glass sunroof, a trunk lid spoiler, tinted windows, aftermarket taillights, and polished quad exhaust outlets. The front bumper is said to have been repainted under previous ownership. Blemishes in the paint on the hood and chips on the front bumper cover are shown in the photo gallery below.

The 18″ APEX wheels secured are mounted with 265/35 Falken Azenis tires. A wheel stud conversion and APEX rear wheel spacers were installed under previous ownership along with a KW V2 coilover suspension kit. A set of stock lug bolts is included in the sale. Curb marks are visible on the right-front and right-rear wheels.

The cabin is upholstered in black and features Nappa leather seating surfaces, high-gloss metallic black trim, power-adjustable and heated front seats, automatic climate control, cruise control, M3-branded floor mats, a BMW Business CD stereo, and Harman Kardon audio. A short-throw shifter has been installed along with a sueded hand brake lever boot and shifter boot. Scuffs on the center console in front of the shifter are noted along with loose material on the A-pillars and C-pillars.

The multi-function leather-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 130k miles, approximately 2k of which were added under current ownership.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque. The double-VANOS system is said to have been cleaned and resealed in 2017, and the oil level sender and connecting rod bearings were replaced in August 2022.

Power is routed to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. Aftermarket rear exhaust components have been fitted, and a subframe reinforcement kit was reportedly installed in January 2015. The transmission gear oil was changed in August 2022.
Manufacturer’s literature, a window sticker, and service records are included in the sale.

The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage and lists history in Washington, California, Colorado, and Texas. A January 2020 entry in the report lists an open manufacturer safety recall for the right-front airbag.
Head over to our friends at Car and Driver to check out their December 2001 First Drive for the E46 BMW M3 coupe.

title: 2005 BMW M3 Coupe Competition Package 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2005 BMW M3 coupe is finished in Interlagos Blue Metallic over black Nappa leather, and it was ordered new with the Competition, Premium, and Cold Weather packages. Powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six, the car is equipped with 19″ M cross-spoke wheels, a power sunroof, xenon headlights, Park Distance Control, power-adjustable front sport seats, a short shifter, navigation, a Harman Kardon sound system, and automatic climate control. The car’s six-speed SMG transmission was converted for manual operation in 2017, and work after the seller’s acquisition in 2021 included replacing the idle control valve connector and connecting rod bearings. This E46 M3 has 99k miles and is now offered in Arizona with manufacturer’s literature, service records, two keys, spare sensors, and a clean Montana title in the name of the seller’s LLC.

The car is finished in Interlagos Blue Metallic (A30) and is equipped with Shadowline trim as well as xenon headlights, fog lights, a glass sunroof, rain-sensing windshield wipers, LED tail lights, Park Distance Control, a trunk lid spoiler, a carbon-fiber rear diffuser, tinted rear windows, and quad exhaust outlets. The seller reports that the left quarter panel has been repainted. A paint correction was performed and ceramic coating was applied to the body in August 2023. The trunk latch is inoperative and there are paint chips on the front end.

The 19″ M cross-spoke Style 163M wheels are mounted with Michelin Pilot Super Sport tires. The car was factory equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and braking is provided by four-wheel ventilated discs. The ZCP Competition Package added an upgraded steering rack and larger cross-drilled brake rotors. The seller states that the front brake pads were replaced in August 2022. The seller notes that the anti-lock brake pressure sensor needs to be replaced.

The heated power-adjustable front sport seats are upholstered in black Nappa leather, and milled-effect aluminum trim accents the dashboard, center console, and door panels. Interior amenities include automatic climate control, driver-seat position memory, navigation, microsuede shifter and handbrake lever boots, aluminum pedal covers, a BMW Business CD stereo, and Harman Kardon audio. An AutoSolutions short shifter is said to have been installed. The adjustment for the front seat bolsters and lumbar support is inoperative, and pixel damage is visible on the infotainment screen.

The Alcantara-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 99k miles.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque. The double-VANOS system was rebuilt and upgraded with Beisan components in 2018, and the connecting rod bearings and bolts were replaced in November 2021. The idle control valve connector was replaced under current ownership and service in 2022 is said to have included cleaning the mass air-flow sensor and replacing engine mounts, and the oil was changed in preparation for the sale.

The six-speed SMG transmission was converted to manual operation in 2017, and power is sent to the rear wheels through a limited-slip differential. The rear subframe mounting areas have been reinforced, and the driveshaft flex disc was replaced. The seller states that the exhaust temperature sensors need to be replaced.
Manufacturer’s literature, two keys, partial service records, and a spare rear center console ashtray are included in the sale.
The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage and lists history in Nevada, California, Washington, Arizona, and Montana.

title: 2005 BMW M3 Coupe
excerpt: This 2005 BMW M3 coupe is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six linked with a six-speed SMG sequential transmission and a limited-slip differential and is finished in Silver Gray Metallic over black Nappa leather. Equipment includes the Premium Package as well as 19″ VMR wheels, a power sunroof, xenon headlights, Park Distance Control, power-adjustable front sport seats, a Harman Kardon sound system, and automatic climate control. The car spent time in Utah and New Jersey before it was acquired by the seller in 2018, and subsequent service is said to have included fluid changes, a valve adjustment, and replacing the valve cover gasket, VANOS oil pump disc and seals, spark plugs, and headliner upholstery. This E46 M3 has 65k miles and is now offered at no reserve with a window sticker, manufacturer’s literature, partial service records, and a clean Florida title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Silver Gray Metallic (A08) and features Shadowline trim as well as xenon headlights, fog lights, a glass sunroof, rain-sensing windshield wipers, LED tail lights, Park Distance Control, a trunk lid spoiler, and quad exhaust outlets. The lower-left edge of the front bumper cover is distorted, and the seller notes aging seals around the windshield and rear windows.

The 19″ VMR V703 wheels are mounted with Michelin Pilot Spot A/S 3+ tires measuring 225/40 up front and 255/35 out back. The car was factory equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and braking is provided by four-wheel ventilated discs. The front brake pads were replaced at approximately 6k miles, and the seller reports that replacement rear brake pads were installed at that time. The brake fluid is said to have been changed in August 2022. Sidewall damage is visible on the left-front tire, and rub marks are shown on the left-rear tire.

The power-adjustable front sport seats and door-panel inserts are upholstered in black Nappa leather, and Brushed Aluminum Shadow trim accents the interior. Additional appointments include automatic climate control, cruise control, driver-seat memory settings, and Harman Kardon audio. The seller states that the headliner and the upholstery on the A- and C-pillars were replaced in February 2023. Blemishes are visible on the left door latch, and wear is shown to the left of the hazard button on the center console.

The multi-function leather-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 65k miles, approximately 1,700 of which were added under current ownership.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque. The seller notes that the VANOS oil pump disc and O-rings were replaced in 2018. A valve adjustment was reportedly performed and the valve cover and spark plugs were replaced under current ownership. An oil change was completed in August 2022.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed SMG sequential transmission and a limited-slip differential. The fluids in the transmission and differential were are said to have been changed in August 2022.
Manufacturer’s literature, a window sticker, and partial service records are included in the sale.
The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage and lists history in Utah, New Jersey, and Florida.

title: Messing Metallic 2003 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2003 BMW M3 is a Canadian-market coupe that was ordered through BMW’s Individual program in Messing Metallic with Light Olive leather upholstery, wood interior trim, and high-gloss Shadowline exterior trim. The six-speed gearbox was converted to manual operation in 2017, and the 3.2-liter S54 inline-six has been modified with Dinan camshafts and ported throttle bodies as well as a Karbonius Composites CSL-style airbox, European-specification headers, and Evolve engine-management software. The car is also equipped with the Premium and Cold Weather packages as well as a power sunroof, xenon headlights, Park Distance Control, a Harman Kardon sound system, and a rear sunshade, and additional modifications include an aftermarket exhaust system, TC Kline Street suspension, Brembo front calipers, and 19″ Champion/Dinan wheels. This E46 M3 now has under 52k miles and is offered with service records and a clean Illinois title in the seller’s name.

The car is one of 14 North American-specification examples that were ordered through BMW’s Individual program with Messing Metallic paint, and it is also equipped with high-gloss Shadowline trim, xenon headlights, headlight washers, fog lights, a glass sunroof, rain-sensing windshield wipers, LED tail lights, Park Distance Control, a trunk lid spoiler, and quad exhaust outlets. The Carfax report lists damage occurring to the rear in May 2004, which the seller states was the result of a parking lot incident that left a dimple in the rear bumper cover. Paint protection film was removed from the front end approximately 100 miles ago according to the seller, who states that the front bumper cover, front fenders, and hood have been repainted and the paint has been ceramic coated.

The 19″ Champion/Dinan forged wheels are mounted with 245/35 front and 275/30 rear Pirelli Sport Contact 2 tires. TC Kline suspension has been installed and consists of Koni adjustable dampers, sway bars, and Ground Control caster/camber plates. A Brembo Club Race front brake kit was installed in 2017, and a Dinan/Brembo rear brake kit was fitted in 2007.

The heated and power-adjustable front sport seats and door-panel inserts are upholstered in Light Olive leather, while light wood trim accents the dashboard, center console, and doors. BMW Individual-logo sill trim was ordered when new, and the car is also equipped automatic climate control, cruise control, a rear sunshade, and Harman Kardon audio.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel wears a BMW Individual badge, and the 185-mph speedometer was installed and coded in March 2007. The digital odometer indicates 83,000 kilometers (~51,500 miles) approximately 5k of which were added under current ownership. The coolant light is illuminated.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six had its rod bearings replaced in September 2004. Dinan camshafts and throttle bodies have been installed along with a Karbonius Composites CSL-style airbox, European-specification headers, and Evolve engine-management software, and an aluminum Moroso coolant tank has also been fitted. The VANOS system was fitted with a Beisan System solenoid in 2018.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed gearbox that was converted to manual operation in 2017, at which time the clutch components and flywheel were replaced. A Meisterschaft mid-section and Dinan rear muffler have also been installed.
Service records and manufacturer’s literature are included in the sale.
The Carfax report shows the aforementioned 2004 damage as well as registration history in Ontario and Illinois through its most recent update in July 2020.

title: 2001 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2001 BMW M3 coupe is finished in Laguna Seca Blue over black Nappa leather upholstery and is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six linked with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. The car has been modified with an AFe air intake, revised ECU tuning, KW coilovers, and an aftermarket exhaust header and rear section. Additional equipment includes 19″ CSL-style wheels, a power sunroof, a carbon-fiber rear diffuser, xenon headlights, power-adjustable front sport seats, a Harman Kardon sound system, and automatic climate control. The seller acquired the car in 2012 and has since added approximately 40k of the 101k miles. This E46 M3 is offered in Colorado with the owner’s manuals, service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Texas title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Laguna Seca Blue (448) and is fitted with Shadowline trim as well as xenon headlights, fog lights, a glass sunroof, a trunk lid spoiler, matte black side and kidney grilles, LED taillights, tinted windows, and quad exhaust outlets that exit through the carbon-fiber rear diffuser. Halo headlight rings and clear corner lenses are installed. The seller reports the front bumper cover was refinished under current ownership, and imperfections on the hood and rocker panel are displayed in the gallery.

Silver CSL-style 19″ wheels are mounted with Continental ExtremeContact DW tires measuring 255/35 in front and 275/30 out back. Imperfections on the wheels are displayed in the gallery, and the left-rear tire has a leak. The car was factory-equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and braking is provided by four-wheel ventilated discs. Suspension modifications consist of KW ST X coilovers, and the front lower control arms were replaced in 2016.

The car was factory-equipped with Dove Grey cabin upholstery, and replacement seats and trim covered in black leather were installed under prior ownership. Appointments include power-adjustable front sport seats, brushed aluminum trim, automatic climate control, a ZHP-style shift knob, a BMW Business CD stereo, and Harman Kardon audio. The seats do not have heating elements, the left-rear speaker works intermittently, and the hazard and door lock buttons in the console are nonfunctional.

The multi-function leather-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 101k miles, approximately 40k of which were added under current ownership.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six has been modified with an AFe air intake with a heat shield along with revised ECU tuning, while a Dinan front strut tower bar spans the engine bay. The seller notes that the rod bearing recall service was performed in Dec 2004. A coolant service was performed in November 2022, and an oil leak is present.

Power is routed to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. A Rogue transmission mount and a Rogue Octane short shifter have been installed. A subframe reinforcement kit was reportedly installed in Jan 2013 and the clutch delay valve is said to have been removed. The exhaust system has been modified with Agency Power headers, high-flow catalytic converters, and a Rogue El Diablo rear section.
The manufacturer’s literature and a collection of service records are included in the sale.
The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage and lists history in California, Iowa, Nebraska, South Dakota, Texas, and Colorado.
Head over to our friends at Car and Driver to check out their December 2001 First Drive for the E46 BMW M3 coupe.

title: 2004 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2004 BMW M3 coupe was initially delivered to BMW of Towson in Maryland prior to being purchased by the seller in 2021 and is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six linked with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. Finished in Alpine White over black Nappa leather upholstery, the car is equipped with the Premium and Cold Weather packages as well as 19″ M double-spoke wheels, a power sunroof, xenon headlights with washers, heated power-adjustable front sport seats, a Harman Kardon sound system, an Alpine stereo, and automatic climate control. This E46 M3 is now offered in Florida with a window sticker, factory literature, spare keys, a car cover, spare parts, service records, an accident-free Carfax report, and a clean Rhode Island title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Alpine White and features Shadowline trim as well as xenon headlights with washers, fog lights, a glass sunroof, rain-sensing windshield wipers, LED tail lights, a trunk lid spoiler, and quad exhaust outlets. According to the seller, the front bumper cover has been refinished and touch-up paint has been applied to the rear bumper cover. Paint meter readings and close-up photos depicting the condition of the exterior are presented in the gallery below.

The 19″ M double-spoke Style 67 wheels are mounted with 225/40 front and 255/35 rear Michelin Pilot Sport 4s tires. The car was factory equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and braking is provided by four-wheel ventilated discs.

The heated power-adjustable front sport seats are upholstered in black Nappa leather, and the cabin features a black dashboard with Brushed Aluminum Shadow trim accents. Interior amenities include automatic climate control, cruise control, driver-seat position memory settings, an Alpine stereo, and Harman Kardon audio. The removed stereo is included in the sale.

The multi-function leather-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer shows just over 55k miles, approximately 2k of which were added under current ownership. A mileage inconsistency is listed in a March 2021 entry of the Carfax report, which notes that it may be a result of a “clerical error.”
The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. Additional photos of the underside are presented in the gallery below.
The window sticker lists initial delivery to BMW of Towson in Maryland, along with factory colors, equipment, options, and a total suggested retail price of $53,620.
Factory literature, three keys, a car cover, service records, the removed stereo, and spare parts are also included in the sale.
The Carfax report shows the aforementioned March 2021 mileage inconsistency and lists history in Maryland, Illinois, Maine, Massachusetts, Connecticut, and Rhode Island.
Interested to see what Car and Driver thought about the E46 BMW M3 coupe when it was new? Click here to check out their December 2001 First Drive.

title: Original-Owner 2006 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 convertible was purchased new by the seller at BMW of Mobile in Alabama and now has 62k miles. It is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic over gray Nappa leather upholstery and is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six linked with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. Features include a black soft top, 18″ M double-spoke Style 67 wheels, xenon headlights, fog lights, power-adjustable front sport seats, a Harman Kardon sound system, a Kenwood CD stereo, cruise control, and automatic climate control. This E46 M3 is now offered with factory literature, spare parts, two keys, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Mississippi title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic and is equipped with a black convertible soft top as well as fog lights, xenon headlights, rain-sensing windshield wipers, LED tail lights, and quad exhaust outlets. A crack is noted on the left fog light, scuffs are visible on the front bumper cover, and various imperfections are shown up close in the gallery below.

The 18″ M double-spoke Style 67 wheels are mounted with Goodyear Eagle F1 tires measuring 225/45 up front and 255/40 at the rear. The car was factory equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and braking is provided by four-wheel ventilated discs. Replacement TPMS sensors were installed in preparation for the sale, per the seller. Curb damage is located on the wheels.

The power-adjustable front sport seats are upholstered in gray Nappa leather and are complemented by a color-coordinated lower dash, door panels, and carpets. Interior amenities include automatic climate control, cruise control, driver-seat position memory settings, a Kenwood CD stereo, and Harman Kardon audio. The center console is scratched, and wear is visible on the center armrest as well as on the center console near the driver’s footwell. According to the seller, a leak is present in the air conditioning system.

The multi-function leather-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 62k miles, all of which were added under current ownership.
The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential.
The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage and lists history in Alabama and Mississippi.

title: 2006 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 convertible has remained registered in Washington from new and was acquired by the selling dealer from its first owner in July 2023. It is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six linked with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential and is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic over Black Nappa leather. Features include the Cold Weather Package, a black soft top, 19″ M double-spoke wheels, xenon headlights, heated power-adjustable front sport seats, navigation, a Harman Kardon sound system, and automatic climate control. This E46 M3 has 166k miles and is offered by the selling dealer at no reserve with a window sticker, an owner’s manual, service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Washington title.

The car is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic and features a black convertible soft top as well as xenon headlights, fog lights, rain-sensing windshield wipers, LED tail lights, and quad exhaust outlets. The front bumper is said to have been refinished under previous ownership, and the selling dealer notes the presence of dings and that the gas cap tether is broken. Photos showing rock chips on the front valance and scratches on the trunk lid are provided in the gallery below.

The 19″ M double-spoke Style 67 wheels show blemishes and are mounted with 225/40 front and 255/35 rear Michelin Pilot Sport A/S 3+ tires that were mounted in July 2021. The car was factory equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and stopping power is provided by ventilated disc brakes. The front-left wheel bearing and front-left lower control arm were replaced in 2019.

The heated power-adjustable front sport seats are upholstered in Black Nappa leather, and Titan Shadow trim accents the dash and door panels. M3-branded floor mats line the footwells, and amenities include driver’s seat memory settings, automatic climate control, cruise control, DVD-based navigation, and Harman Kardon audio. The driver’s airbag was replaced in 2018 and the passenger airbag was replaced in 2020. The shift knob is worn, the carpet in the trunk is stained, discoloration is visible on the left door panel, and the fore and aft adjustment on the driver’s seat is said to stick.

The multi-function steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 166k miles.
The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque. An oil change was performed in January 2023 and the thermostat and gasket were replaced in February 2023.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential.
The window sticker lists initial delivery to BMW of Bellevue in Washington as well as factory colors, equipment, and a total suggested retail price of $64,445.
The Carfax report notes no accidents or other damage and lists history in Washington.

title: 2006 BMW M3 Coupe Competition Package 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 coupe is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic over black Nappa leather and is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six mated to a six-speed transmission that has been converted to manual operation. Equipment includes the Competition, Premium, and Cold Weather Packages as well as 19″ cross-spoke wheels, a limited-slip differential, Koni shocks, Eibach springs, a power sunroof, xenon headlights, Park Distance Control, automatic climate control, and Harman Kardon audio. The current owner acquired the car in November 2021 and subsequent work has included the transmission conversion, a valve adjustment, and replacement spark plugs, ignition coils, and engine mounts as well as brake, steering, and suspension components. This E46 M3 has under 100k miles and is now offered at no reserve with the owner’s manual, service records, and a clean Virginia title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic (354) and features Shadowline trim as well as xenon headlights, fog lights, a glass sunroof, rain-sensing windshield wipers, LED tail lights, Park Distance Control, a trunk lid spoiler, and quad exhaust outlets. The Carfax report shows a rear-end collision in December 2015 resulting in “very minor damage,” and additional “minor damage” is noted in May 2021, which the seller attributes to correcting damaged paint.

Silver 19″ M Style 163 wheels with finish imperfections are wrapped in 225/40 front and 255/35 rear Michelin Pilot Sport 4 tires. The ZCP Competition Package added an upgraded steering rack and larger cross-drilled brake rotors, and Koni shocks and Eibach springs have been added along with Powerflex front control arm bushings. The front control arms, sway bar end links, and sway bar bushings were reportedly replaced in December 2021, and the brake pads and rotors were recently replaced.

The cabin is upholstered in black and features Nappa leather seating surfaces, milled-effect aluminum trim, power-adjustable and heated front seats, a Rogue Octane short shift kit, automatic climate control, cruise control, Harman Kardon audio, LED interior lighting, and an aftermarket Avin infotainment system.

The Alcantara-wrapped steering wheel fronts a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline, along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates just under 100k miles, approximately 6k of which were added under current ownership.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque. Recent service included performing a valve adjustment, repairing the VVT housing seal, and replacing the engine mounts, spark plugs, and ignition coils. A photograph of a Blackstone Labs oil report is shown in the gallery below.

The car left the factory equipped with a six-speed SMG transmission that was converted to manual operation in June 2023. A subframe reinforcement kit was reportedly installed in 2018, and the differential and subframe bushings were replaced in February 2020.
The Carfax report shows the aforementioned “minor damage” and “very minor damage” reports as well as registration history in Delaware, New Jersey, Maryland, and Virginia.

title: 2002 BMW M3 Coupe
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 coupe was initially sold by Moss BMW of Lafayette, Louisiana, prior to being purchased by the seller in 2022 and now shows 79k miles. It is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic over black leather and cloth upholstery and is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six linked with a six-speed SMG sequential transmission and a limited-slip differential. Features include 19″ aftermarket wheels, a power sunroof, xenon headlights, rear Park Distance Control, a rear spoiler, Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), a BMW Business CD stereo, cruise control, and automatic climate control. Service since 2022 reportedly consisted of changing the oil in addition to replacing the shocks, front lower control arm bushings, valve cover gaskets, tie rod ends, throttle position sensors, and lift pads. This E46 M3 is now offered with service records, a Carfax report, and a clean Florida title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic and features Shadowline trim as well as xenon headlights, fog lights, a glass sunroof, rear Park Distance Control, a trunk lid spoiler, and quad exhaust outlets. Damage to the rear is listed on an October 2021 entry of the Carfax report, which is said to have been a result of an impact with a motorcycle. Paint chips are shown up close in the gallery below.

Aftermarket 19″ wheels are mounted with staggered-width mismatched tires. The car was factory equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and braking is provided by four-wheel ventilated and slotted discs. According to the seller, the shocks, front lower control arm bushings, and tie rod ends were replaced in 2022.

The front sport seats are upholstered in black leather with cloth inserts that extend to the door panels, and the cabin features a black dashboard with Brushed Aluminum Shadow trim accents. M3-branded floor mats line the footwells, and interior amenities include automatic climate control, a BMW Business CD stereo, cruise control, and an onboard computer. Wear is visible on the left door panel.

The multi-function leather-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer shows just under 79k miles, fewer than are shown in an October 2022 entry in the Carfax report.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque. The seller notes that the rod bearing recall service was performed in 2003, and the double-VANOS system has been upgraded. A replacement valve cover gasket and lift pads were fitted in 2022, and service in 2023 included replacing the throttle position sensor, recharging the air conditioning system, and changing the oil.
Power is routed to the rear wheels via a six-speed SMG sequential transmission and a limited-slip differential. A subframe reinforcement kit was reportedly installed in 2008.
The Carfax report shows the aforementioned October 2021 damage and lists history in Louisiana, Texas, and Florida. An October 2022 entry of the report lists an odometer reading of 90,581.

title: 2003 BMW M3 Coupe
excerpt: This 2003 BMW M3 coupe has remained registered in California prior to the selling dealer’s acquisition in 2023 and is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six linked with a six-speed SMG sequential transmission and a limited-slip differential. Finished in black over black Nappa leather upholstery, the car is equipped with the Premium Package as well as 19″ M double-spoke wheels, rear parking sensors, a rear spoiler, heated power-adjustable front sport seats, navigation, a Harman Kardon sound system, and automatic climate control. This E46 M3 has 100k miles and is now offered in Illinois by the selling dealer with manufacturer’s literature, a clean Carfax report, and a clean California title.

title: 2004 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2004 BMW M3 coupe is finished in Alpine White over black Nappa leather and is powered by a 3.2L inline-six linked with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. Additional equipment includes 19″ M cross-spoke wheels, a power sunroof, xenon headlights, heated power-adjustable front sport seats, a Harman Kardon sound system, and automatic climate control. Acquired by the seller in 2023, this E46 M3 has 108k miles and is now offered with a window sticker, service records, two keys, the removed parts, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Maryland title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Alpine White (300) and is equipped with Shadowline trim as well as xenon headlights, fog lights, a glass sunroof, rain-sensing windshield wipers, body-color front corner reflectors, LED tail lights, a trunk lid spoiler, and quad Dinan-branded exhaust outlets. The 19″ M cross-spoke Style 163M wheels were installed in January 2022 and are mounted with Michelin Sport Cup 2 tires measuring 235/35 up front and 265/30 out back. A Turner Motorsports wheel stud kit has been installed, and additional suspension modifications include Bilstein PSS10 coilovers, H&R sway bars, and adjustable front camber plates. The power steering pump, power steering fluid reservoir, and front hubs were replaced in 2019, and a replacement steering coupling and EBC Yellowstuff brake pads were installed in 2021. The seller reports that the front control arm bushings have been replaced.

The heated power-adjustable front sport seats are upholstered in black Nappa leather, and Titan Shadow trim accents the dashboard and door panels. Interior amenities include automatic climate control, cruise control, and Harman Kardon audio. The center armrest has been removed and interior modifications include ZCP short shifter lever, alloy pedal covers, a microsuede shift boot and handbrake lever, and a replacement center console with cup holders. The A-pillar trim is loose, and the B- and C-pillar upholstery is beginning to separate.

The microsuede-wrapped multi-function leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 108k miles, approximately 1,800 of which were added under current ownership.

The 3.2L S54 inline-six features a CSL-style carbon-fiber intake and is said to have been modified with revised engine management software, Super Sprint stepped headers, and a Status Gruppe resonator. Service in 2019 included replacing the thermostat and coolant temperature sensor. The VANOS system was upgraded with a Beisan anti-rattle kit, upper chain guide, billet exhaust drive hub, and oil pump drive rotor in March 2022, and additional work at that time included a valve adjustment, installing ARP rod bolts, and replacing the connecting rod bearings, valve cover gasket, and engine mounts. The seller reports that the water pump, fan clutch, coolant expansion tank, and the serpentine belt tensioner and idler pulleys were replaced in September 2022.

Power is routed to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. The driveshaft flex disc was reportedly replaced in 2017, a replacement differential cover was installed in 2019, and a polyurethane shifter arm carrier bushing and replacement transmission mounts were installed in March 2022. The clutch delay valve is said to have been removed and clutch stop was reportedly adjusted.

The window sticker lists initial delivery to Sam Swope BMW in Louisville, Kentucky, along with colors, options, and a total suggested retail price of $55,720. Service records, two keys, and spare parts are included in the sale.
The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage and lists history in Kentucky, Ohio, Texas, and Maryland.

Now indicating 117k miles, this E46 M3 is offered with the manufacturer’s literature, service records, two keys, spare parts, a tool kit, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Texas title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Carbon Black Metallic (416) and is equipped with Shadowline trim as well as xenon headlights, fog lights, a glass sunroof, rain-sensing windshield wipers, LED tail lights, Park Distance Control, a trunk lid spoiler, and quad exhaust outlets. The hood is said to have been repainted, and the front bumper cover was refinished following the seller’s acquisition. The windshield cowl, quarter window weather seals and lower trim strips, headlight covers, upper headlight cover strips, front turn signals, and front bumper reflectors were replaced under current ownership. Delamination is visible on the left door mirror, a paint blemish is visible to the right of the M3 trunk badge, and the seller notes paint chips on the hood, front fenders, and mirror covers.

The 19″ M cross-spoke Style 163M wheels were repaired and refinished in 2018, are they are mounted with 225/40 front and 255/35 rear General G-max RS tires. The car was factory equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and braking is provided by four-wheel ventilated discs. The ZCP Competition Package added an upgraded steering rack and larger cross-drilled brake rotors. Bilstein B8 dampers and Eibach Pro-Line lowering springs were installed along with replacement front control arms, front hub assemblies, front shock bearings, shock mounts, shock tower reinforcement plates, spring pads, rear bump stops, and sway bar links and bushings.

The power-adjustable front sport seats are upholstered in black Nappa leather, and milled-effect aluminum trim accents the dash and door panels. Interior amenities include a power-operated rear sunshade, automatic climate control, M3-branded floor mats, a BMW Business CD stereo, Harman Kardon audio, and a glove compartment-mounted auxiliary input cable. The rearview mirror was repaired, and additional interior refurbishments included replacing the center console, center ashtray, sunglass cubby, center ashtray, cup holders, A and C-pillar trim, SMG shifter and surround plate.

The Alcantara upholstery on the steering wheel was replaced under current ownership along with the inner steering wheel trim. Instrumentation includes a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 117k miles, approximately ~10k of which were added under current ownership. The seller reports that a recall for the driver-side airbag was performed in 2019, and the passenger-side front airbag module was replaced in August 2021.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque. The connecting rod bearings were replaced at approximately 111k miles, and the engine mounts are aid to have been replaced at that time. A Beisan Systems VANOS oil pump disc, solenoid pack, sealing plate, and exhaust upper chain guide were installed following the seller’s acquisition, and additional work performed under current ownership included replacing the constant pressure valve, water pump, thermostat, cooling fan, fan clutch, fuel filter, power steering reservoir, power steering lines, belts, ignition coils, and spark plugs. Oil analysis reports from before and after the rod bearing replacement are viewable in the gallery below.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed SMG sequential transmission and a limited-slip differential. The seller reports that Euro transmission management software has been installed. The rear subframe was reinforced and the subframe bushings were replaced in 2016, and the differential pinion seal, driveshaft center bearing, and driveshaft flex disc were replaced under current ownership.

The 3.0L Toyota 2JZ-GTE was installed using TireDeathRacing adapter mounts and a Wiring Specialties wiring harness. It has been fitted with a single BorgWarner turbocharger, exhaust headers, a RadiumAuto fuel rail, and a front-mount intercooler. Originally an SMG model, the car was fitted with a BMW six-speed manual transmission using a PMC Motorsport Stage 1 adaptor and clutch kit as well as Condor Speed Shop transmission mounts. The BMW limited-slip differential remains in place, and a subframe reinforcement kit was reportedly installed in 2020. The selling dealer notes that the underside was dry-ice blasted in preparation for sale.

title: Supercharged 2003 BMW M3 Dinan S2 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2003 BMW M3 coupe is powered by a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six that is fitted with an RMS supercharger kit, and it is paired with an SMG six-speed transmission that has been converted to manual operation. Finished in Alpine White III over gray Nappa leather, the car is equipped with a limited-slip differential, a power-operated glass sunroof, xenon headlights, rear parking sensors, navigation, automatic climate control, and heated and power-adjustable front seats. Dinan elements consist of a muffler, radiator, 19″ wheels, red four-piston brake calipers, and front strut and rear shock tower braces. Additional modifications are said to include Macht Schnell headers, Bilstein PSS10 coilovers, and a LuK clutch and flywheel kit. The car was acquired by the selling dealer on BaT in November 2022, and work performed under current ownership reportedly consisted of replacing various exterior trim pieces, overhauling the double-VANOS system, reverting the car back to its factory ECU, and replacing the upper timing chain guide, valve cover gasket, spark plugs, and engine and transmission mounts. This modified E46 M3 shows 93k miles and is now offered in California with an accident-free Carfax report and a clean Arizona title.

The car is finished in Alpine White III (300) and features Shadowline exterior trim as well as xenon headlights, rain-sensing windshield wipers, LED taillights, rear parking sensors, and a rear lip spoiler. The front bumper cover, front tow hook, and mirror caps have been refinished, and the right fender has been touched up. Work under current ownership reportedly consisted of performing a paint correction, re-wiring the right headlight, and replacing the headlight gaskets, fog lights, side markers, and windshield cowl in addition to the quarter panel weatherstripping, badging, and fender and kidney grilles. A chip in the windshield is said to have been filled, and blemishes are visible on the rear bumper cover.

Seven-spoke 19″ Dinan wheels are mounted with Continental ExtremeContact Sport tires measuring 275/30 up front and 285/30 out back, and the condition of the wheels is shown up close in the gallery below. The car is equipped with Bilstein PSS10 coilovers, an H&R front sway bar, polyurethane front control arm bushings, Ground Control adjustable rear control arms, and Dinan front strut and rear shock tower braces. Braking is provided by red four-piston Dinan calipers over slotted rotors at all four corners, and the brake fluid was reportedly flushed in 2023.

The heated and power-adjustable front sport seats are upholstered in gray Nappa leather while brushed aluminum shadow trim adorns the dash and door panels. Additional interior amenities include driver seat position memory settings, automatic climate control, cruise control, navigation, and M3-branded front floor mats. The cover for the power-operated glass sunroof is misaligned.

The multifunction steering wheel is trimmed in microsuede and fronts a 185-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a variable redline, and gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 93k miles, approximately 650 of which have been added under current ownership.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six features individual throttle bodies and was fitted with an RMS supercharger kit during current ownership as well as a Dinan radiator. The selling dealer states that the rod bearing recall service was performed under previous ownership, the double-VANOS system was overhauled under current ownership, and the previously installed Turner Motorsport standalone ECU has been removed and replaced with a factory unit. The engine oil and coolant were changed in preparation for the sale according to the selling dealer, who notes that the following components were replaced in 2023:
A plaque in the engine bay lists the car’s Dinan S2 serial number.

The SMG six-speed transmission was converted to manual operation and is said to be paired with a LuK clutch and flywheel kit. A subframe reinforcement kit was reportedly installed in 2014, and the exhaust system features Macht Schnell long-tube headers as well as a Dinan muffler with quad outlets. Polyurethane rear subframe bushings have also been added, and the fluids for the transmission and limited-slip differential were reportedly changed in 2023.

The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage and lists history in California and Arizona. Open manufacturer safety recalls related to the passenger-side and driver-side front airbags are noted in July 2014 and May 2015, respectively.

excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 coupe was ordered new with the Competition and Premium packages, and it remained registered in California through the seller’s acquisition in August 2022. Equipment includes the Cold Weather Package as well as a black soft top, 19″ M double-spoke wheels, xenon headlights, fog lights, a rear spoiler, heated power-adjustable front sport seats, a Harman Kardon sound system, a BMW Business CD stereo, cruise control, and automatic climate control. Service since 2021 included changing the oil in addition to replacing the flex disc, valve cover, and fuel pump. This E46 M3 is now offered at no reserve with a window sticker, factory literature, service records, a Blackstone Laboratories oil report, spare parts, two keys, a Carfax report, and a clean Maryland title.

The car is finished in Carbon Black Metallic and is equipped with a black convertible soft top as well as xenon headlights, fog lights, rain-sensing windshield wipers, a rear spoiler, LED tail lights, and quad exhaust outlets. Damage to the front and left-front portions of the body is noted in an October 2015 entry of the Carfax report, which also lists damage to the rear in January 2019. The seller notes the front and rear bumper covers have been repainted.

The 19″ M double-spoke Style 67 wheels are mounted with BFGoodrich g-Force Comp-2 A/S tires measuring 225/40 up front and 255/35 at the rear. The car was factory equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and braking is provided by four-wheel ventilated discs. Curb damage is visible on three wheels.

The heated power-adjustable front sport seats are upholstered in Cinnamon Nappa leather that extends to the door panel inserts, and Brushed Aluminum Shadow trim accents the dash, center console, and door panels. M3-branded floor mats line the footwells, and interior amenities include automatic climate control, cruise control, a BMW Business CD stereo, and Harman Kardon audio. Scratches are present on the center stack, and the seller notes difficulty adjusting the digital clock on the instrument cluster.

The multi-function leather-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 155k miles.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque. The flex disc, valve cover, and fuel pump were replaced in 2021, and an oil change was performed in August 2022. A Blackstone Laboratories oil report is presented in the gallery below.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential.
The window sticker lists initial delivery to Vob Auto Sales of Rockville, Maryland, along with factory colors, equipment, options, and a total suggested retail price of $61,295.
The Carfax report shows the aforementioned 2015 and 2019 damage and lists history in Maryland.

title: 2001 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2001 BMW M3 coupe is finished in Laguna Seca Blue and powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six linked with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. Equipment includes a sunroof, a trunk lid spoiler, xenon headlights, automatic climate control, and heated and power-adjustable front seats. Following registration history in Wisconsin and Illinois, the car was acquired by its current owner in 2021 and relocated to Pennsylvania. Subsequent work included reupholstering the interior with Cinnamon leather and installing KW coilovers, 19″ Style 163M wheels, LCI taillights, a Supersprint muffler, Active Autowerks headers, and an XTRONS stereo in addition to rebuilding the VANOS system and engine top end and replacing the connecting-rod bearings, engine mounts, brake rotors and lines, and throttle body actuator and sensor. This E46 M3 has 133k miles and is now offered by the seller on behalf of its owner with manufacturer’s literature, service records, three keys, removed parts, and Connecticut registration in the owner’s name.

The car is finished in Laguna Seca Blue and is fitted with Shadowline trim as well as a glass sunroof, a trunk lid spoiler, xenon headlights, fog lights, replacement side grilles and markers, LCI taillights, and quad exhaust outlets. The seller states that the front bumper cover and rear quarter panels have been repainted, as has the area between the trunk lid and rear bumper cover following rust repairs. Irregular paint in the repaired area is depicted in the gallery below, and rust is noted around the hood and trunk latches.

Silver-finished 19″ Style 163M wheels are mounted with 225/40 front and 255/35 rear Continental ExtremeContact Sport tires. The car was factory equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and KW coilovers were installed in January 2022. The four-wheel-disc braking system received stainless-steel lines and replacement pads and cross-drilled rotors in May 2021.

The heated and power-adjustable front sport seats along with the rear bench and the door and side panels were reupholstered under current ownership with Cinnamon leather. Additional appointments include automatic climate control, driver seat-position memory, gloss-black trim, a suede-wrapped headliner and pillars, and an aftermarket XTRONS touchscreen stereo with Bluetooth, Android Auto, and Apple CarPlay. The removed BMW Business CD stereo is included in the sale.

The multifunction suede-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and a centering stripe and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline as well as gauges for fuel level and coolant temperature. The digital odometer indicates 133k miles, approximately 300 of which were added under current ownership.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six’s top-end was rebuilt by Kassel Performance in May 2021 with work that included resurfacing the cylinder head, machining the valve seats, and replacing the head gasket, valve cover gasket, valve stem seals, and throttle position sensors. Connecting-rod bearing recall service is said to have been carried out under prior ownership at 40k miles, and the bearings were replaced again during the 2021 work which also included rebuilding the double-VANOS system and installing a Beisan upper timing chain tensioner, Z4M cam sprocket bolts, VANOSFix seals, and E39 M5 hub springs followed by dynamometer-tuning the ECU. The 2021 measurements of engine compression and output can be viewed in the gallery.

Power is routed to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. Active Autowerks exhaust headers and a Supersprint muffler have been installed, and the removed muffler will accompany the car.

The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage and lists history in Wisconsin, Illinois, Pennsylvania, and Connecticut. The car does not have a title, as it is registered in a state that does not issues titles for a vehicle of its age. It is being sold on its registration.

Subsequent work reportedly involved replacing the trunk and hood shocks in August 2022 and performing an alignment and replacing the crankcase vent valve in September 2022. This E46 M3 has 151k miles and is now offered at no reserve with service records and a clean Georgia title.

The car is finished in Topaz Blue Metallic (364) with a dark blue convertible soft top and features black kidney grilles, emblems, and side vents as well as xenon headlights, yellow fog light lenses, clear turn signal lenses, rain-sensing windshield wipers, LED tail lights, and quad exhaust outlets. The Carfax report shows a collision with an animal in December 2010 that resulted in “minor damage” to the front and left-front sides of the vehicle. The left side mirror glass shows blemishes, the right side mirror’s clear coat is peeling, and a scratch is present on the right rocker panel.

The 18″ M double-spoke Style 67 wheels are mounted with 225/45 front and 255/40 rear Michelin Pilot Super Sport tires. The cabin houses power-adjustable front sport seats trimmed in gray Nappa leather upholstery, and Titan Shadow trim accents the dash and door speakers. The door panels and rear armrests are accented with burl wood trim, and additional interior amenities include automatic climate control, cruise control, blue under-dash lights, a radar jammer, an aftermarket touchscreen stereo with Bluetooth capability, and Harman Kardon audio. In May 2020 the shift lever, bushings, and selector shaft seal were replaced, and in October 2020 the central locking system module was replaced. The driver’s seat received replacement upholstery under previous ownership and the selling dealer notes that the texture does not match the other seats. The door handle trim exhibits cracks, and blemishes are present on the left side of the rear bench.

The multi-function leather-wrapped M Sports steering wheel frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 151k miles, approximately 200 of which were added by the selling dealer.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque and has been fitted with an AFE air intake. Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. The transmission and differential fluids were replaced in June 2020.
