title: 2004 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2004 BMW M3 coupe is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six linked with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential and is finished in Silver Grey Metallic over black Nappa leather. Equipment includes the Premium Package as well as 18″ M double-spoke wheels, an aftermarket cat-back exhaust system, a power sunroof, xenon headlights, heated power-adjustable front sport seats, a BMW Business CD stereo, a Harman Kardon sound system, and automatic climate control. The car was first registered in North Carolina and has remained in the state through the seller’s acquisition in 2007, who has since added approximately 32k of the 72k miles. This E46 M3 is now offered with service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean North Carolina title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Silver Grey Metallic (A08) and is fitted with Shadowline trim as well as xenon headlights, fog lights, a glass sunroof, rain-sensing windshield wipers, tinted side-marker lenses, LED tail lights, a trunk lid spoiler, and quad exhaust outlets. Photos of paint meter readings as well as various blemishes and touched-up spots around the exterior can be seen in the photos provided below.

The 18″ M double-spoke Style 67 wheels are mounted with 225/45 front and 255/40 rear Michelin Pilot Sport 4 S tires showing date codes from 2022. The car was factory equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and braking is provided by four-wheel ventilated discs.

The cabin features heated power-adjustable front sport seats upholstered in black Nappa leather and Brushed Aluminum Shadow trim accents the dash and door panels. Interior amenities include driver-seat position memory, M-branded pedals, carpeted and rubberized floor mats, automatic climate control, cruise control, a BMW Business CD stereo, and Harman Kardon audio. Scratches are present in the center console near the handbrake lever.

The multi-function leather-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 72k miles, approximately 32k of which were added under current ownership.
The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque. An oil change was performed in preparation for the sale.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. A Milltek Sport cat-back exhaust system has been fitted.
The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage and lists registration history in North Carolina.
Head over to our friends at Car & Driver to check out their December 2001 First Drive for the E46 BMW M3 coupe.

title: Supercharged 2001 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2001 BMW M3 coupe was purchased new by actor, comedian, and CarCast host Adam Carolla and later acquired by co-host Matt D’Andria in 2017. The car was ordered without a sunroof and left the factory finished in Carbon Black Metallic over black leather and M Cloth upholstery. The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six has been modified with a Vortech V2-Ti supercharger from Race Marque Systems (RMS) as well as forged pistons, an ECS Tuning baffled oil catch can, and a Ron Davis radiator. Additional modifications include a CSL-style front bumper, a MagnaFlow exhaust system, 19″ HRE wheels, Brembo disc brakes, KW Variant 3 coilovers, Turner Motorsport suspension components, a custom stereo system, and an ACT clutch and flywheel assembly for the six-speed manual transmission. The seller acquired the car on BaT in September 2020, and subsequent work has included installing a carbon-fiber front splitter and rear diffuser as well as replacing the water pump, alternator, and accessory belts. This modified E46 M3 coupe has 38k miles and is now offered with manufacturer’s literature, a window sticker, and a clean Arizona title in the name of the seller’s LLC.

The car left the factory finished in Carbon Black Metallic (416) and features xenon headlights, fender vents, and a decklid spoiler. The Carfax report lists damage occurring in January 2019, which is said to have been the result of a ding on the hood that was later repaired. The seller notes that the CSL-style front bumper was damaged, repaired, and repainted in 2021. Additional work performed under current ownership has included rolling the front fenders as well as installing a carbon-fiber front splitter and rear diffuser. There is a scratch on the right-front corner of the hood, a ding on the left quarter panel, wear on the spoiler, and broken gasket material around the rear quarter windows.

Polished 19″ HRE 540 Series wheels are mounted with 245/35 front and 285/30 rear Michelin Pilot Super Sport tires. The car rides on KW Variant 3 adjustable coilovers, and a Turner Motorsport rear chassis subframe reinforcement kit along with adjustable front camber-caster plates and rear camber arms were installed under previous ownership. Braking is handled by Brembo four-piston calipers over cross-drilled and vented rotors measuring 355x32mm up front and 345x28mm out back. The seller reports that the front tires have cosmetic damage.

The cabin features power-adjustable front seats and a rear bench upholstered in black leather with M Cloth centers that extend to the door and side panels. Carbon-fiber trim accents the dashboard, center console, parking brake handle, and door grab handles. Equipment includes automatic climate control, cruise control, and a Dynavin touchscreen head unit connected to Bavsound speakers and an Alpine subwoofer. Additional sound-deadening material was added to the trunk and doors under previous ownership, and the interior lights are said to have been replaced with LEDs. A replacement parking brake boot was installed in 2021, according to the seller.

The multifunction steering wheel is leather-wrapped and fronts a 185-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a variable redline, and gauges for coolant temperature, oil pressure, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 38k miles, approximately 12k of which have been added under current ownership.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was modified by Race Marque Systems of Van Nuys, California, under previous ownership with a Vortech supercharger, an air-to-water intercooler, an upgraded oil pump, replacement rod bearings, and low-compression forged pistons. The Vortech V2 supercharger was subsequently replaced with a V2-Ti unit, and an ECS Tuning baffled oil catch can system and custom-made Ron Davis radiator were added. Work under current ownership is said to have included replacing the water pump, alternator, battery, accessory belts, and oil level sensor and dipstick o-rings along with the intercooler inlet hose and supercharger oil drain hose. An oil change was carried out in January 2023.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. Modifications to the transmission include fitment of an ACT heavy-duty clutch kit and an XACT lightweight flywheel. The exhaust system features Magnaflow manifolds, catalytic converters, and stainless-steel rear sections.

The window sticker shows initial delivery to Pacific BMW in Glendale, California, and lists factory colors, equipment, and a total suggested retail price of $50,095. Manufacturer’s literature is also included in the sale.

The Carfax report shows the aforementioned damage in January 2019 and lists history in California and Arizona. Manufacturer safety recalls were issued in July 2014 and January 2017 for the passenger front airbag and driver front airbag, respectively.

title: 2003 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2003 BMW M3 convertible is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six mated to a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential, and it is finished in Silver Gray Metallic over black leather upholstery. The car has been modified with Evolve Automotive engine management software, a MagnaFlow exhaust system, a short-throw shifter, a carbon-fiber front lip, Bilstein B12 dampers, Eibach lowering springs, 19″ HRE wheels, and aftermarket brake components. Factory equipment includes the Premium and Cold Weather packages as well as a body-color hardtop, a black soft top, “angel eye” headlights, automatic climate control, heated and power-adjustable front sport seats, a Harman Kardon sound system, and a CD stereo. The car spent time in Virginia, Maryland, and Michigan before it was acquired by the seller reportedly in June 2022, and subsequent service is said to have included installing ACL rod bearings and overhauling the VANOS system with Beisan Systems components as well as replacing the valve cover gasket, timing chain guide, fan clutch, steering coupler, clutch components, and engine and transmission mounts. This E46 M3 has 151k miles and is now offered at no reserve with a maintenance log, parts invoices, removed M double-spoke wheels, a Carfax report, and a clean Ohio title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Silbergrau Metallic (A08) and features a body-color removable hardtop in addition to a black soft top. Additional exterior details include an aftermarket carbon-fiber front lip, “angel eye” xenon headlights, fog lights, LED taillights, rain-sensing windshield wipers, and quadruple exhaust outlets. The Carfax report shows a damage report in February 2012 along with damage to the rear occurring in August 2016, and the seller believes that the left-front fender was repainted under previous ownership. Blemishes noted by the seller include dents and scratches on the hardtop, rock chips on the front bumper cover and fenders, scratches on the rear bumper cover, and chipping on the passenger-side mirror, close-up photos of which can be viewed in the gallery below.

Staggered-width 19″ HRE wheels are mounted with 255/35 front and 285/30 rear Continental ExtremeContact Sport tires. The car was fitted with Bilstein B12 dampers, Eibach Pro-Kit lowering springs, StopTech cross-drilled front brake rotors, and Hawk Performance HPS 5.0 brake pads in 2022, at which time the steering coupler was replaced and the power steering fluid and brake fluid were flushed.

The heated and power-adjustable front sport seats and the rear bench seat are upholstered in black Nappa leather. Appointments include automatic climate control, cruise control, Harman Kardon audio, and a factory CD stereo as well as a short-throw shifter and WeatherTech front floor mats. The passenger airbag was replaced in January 2022. Photos show corrosion and bubbling near the door sill plates.

The leather-wrapped multifunction steering wheel fronts a 185-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a variable redline, and gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 151k miles, approximately 1k of which were added by the seller.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was reportedly modified with Evolve Automotive engine management software. Service carried out in 2022 is said to have included installing ACL rod bearings and overhauling the double-VANOS system with Beisan Systems components and a replacement exhaust camshaft hub and chain guide. Additional work performed under current ownership reportedly included adjusting the valves and replacing the valve cover gasket, oil pump disc, fan clutch, spark plug tube seals, and engine mounts.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. The car is reportedly equipped with a MagnaFlow exhaust system. The seller states that the transmission and differential fluids were flushed and that the flywheel, clutch disc, secondary clutch cylinder, and transmission mounts were replaced in 2022. A heat shield was tightened in preparation for the sale.
The removed set of 18″ M double-spoke wheels mounted with Michelin tires will accompany the car.
The Carfax report shows the aforementioned February 2012 and August 2016 damage reports, and it lists history in Virginia, North Carolina, Maryland, Michigan, and Ohio.

title: 2003 BMW M3 Coupe
location: Village Of Los Ranchos, New Mexico 87107
excerpt: This 2003 BMW M3 coupe was acquired by the seller in 2012 and was reportedly modified for track use with TC Kline coilover suspension, aftermarket brake and exhaust components, and revised engine management software. The car is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six mated to a six-speed SMG sequential transmission and a limited-slip differential and is finished in Steel Gray Metallic over Imola Red Nappa leather upholstery. Additional equipment includes 18″ Apex wheels, xenon headlights, fog lights, rain-sensing windshield wipers, Park Distance Control, automatic climate control, and a BMW Business stereo with a CD player. This E46 M3 is now offered with a set of stock wheels with tires, a GT3-style carbon fiber hood, a clean Carfax report, and a clean New Mexico title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Steel Gray Metallic (400) and features Shadowline trim as well as xenon headlights, fog lights, rain-sensing windshield wipers, Park Distance Control, a CSL-style carbon-fiber front lip spoiler, a decklid spoiler, tinted windows, and quad exhaust outlets. Damage is shown on the front spoiler, a dent is noted behind the right door, the windshield is cracked, delamination is visible on the side mirrors, and additional paint imperfections and chips around the car are viewable in the gallery below.

Matte-black 18″ Apex wheels are wrapped in 275/35 Michelin Pilot Super Sport tires. The car is equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and the seller reports that Competition Package brake pads and cross-drilled rotors have been installed. A TC Kline double adjustable coilover suspension kit with adjustable camber plates and Koni shock absorbers was installed along with a Turner Motorsport rear sway bar.

The cabin features front sport seats upholstered in Imola Red Nappa leather along with matching rear seats and door panel inserts. Interior amenities include automatic climate control, cruise control, M3-branded floor mats, and a BMW Business CD stereo. Wear and blemishes are visible on the front seats, the A-pillar upholstery is peeling, and bubbling is shown in the passenger-side dash accent trim. Additional photos of the interior condition are available in the gallery below.

The multi-function steering wheel features tri-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a variable redline, and auxiliary gauges. A trio of Prosport gauges for oil temperature, oil pressure, and coolant temperature is mounted below the climate controls. The digital odometer indicates 109k miles, approximately 25k of which were added under current ownership.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six is equipped with a K&N cold-air intake and was reportedly modified with revised engine management software and exhaust headers under current ownership. The seller notes that service for a rod bearing recall was performed in March 2015.

Power is routed to the rear wheels via a six-speed SMG sequential transmission and a limited-slip differential. The seller notes that work in 2015 included replacing the clutch and refurbishing the SMG system, and a subframe reinforcement kit was reportedly installed in November 2016. Other equipment installed under current ownership include Turner Motorsports front and rear sway bars, a Status Gruppe center exhaust section, and a Borla rear muffler.
A GT3-style carbon-fiber hood and a set of Style 67 wheels mounted with Nitto NT05 tires are included in the sale.
The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage reported and lists registration history in New York, Maryland, Illinois, Wisconsin, South Carolina, Colorado, and New Mexico.

title: 2002 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 convertible is finished in Carbon Black Metallic over black Nappa leather, and it is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six paired with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. Equipment includes a black soft top, 19″ Style 163M wheels, a lowered suspension, yellow-finished front brake calipers, an aftermarket intake, aftermarket exhaust components, xenon headlights, power-adjustable front seats, an aftermarket infotainment screen, a hifi sound system, and automatic climate control. The car sold on BaT in April 2022, and it was later acquired by the seller. Work under current ownership has reportedly included reinstalling the catalytic converters, replacing components of the soft-top mechanism and the clutch. This E46 M3 has 72k miles and is now offered with a clean Utah title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Carbon Black Metallic (416) and features a black convertible soft top as well as xenon headlights, fog lights, rain-sensing windshield wipers, LED tail lights, and quad exhaust outlets. The Carfax report shows “minor damage” occurring to the nose in March 2021, with no further details recorded. The seller notes that the convertible top sensors and fastening clamps were replaced under current ownership.

The 19″ M cross-spoke Style 163M wheels are mounted with Michelin Pilot Sport 4S tires. The car was factory equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and braking is handled by yellow-finished calipers up front and cross-drilled rotors all around. The suspension has been modified for a lower ride height in comparison with factory settings.

The cabin is upholstered in black and features Nappa leather seating surfaces, Titan Shadow trim, power-adjustable front seats, automatic climate control, cruise control, an aftermarket infotainment screen, and a hifi audio system. The air conditioning system was recharged under current ownership and  the seller notes  that the glovebox is locked.

The leather- and Alcantara-wrapped steering wheel features an M-color centering stripe and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline, along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 72k miles.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six features an aftermarket intake, a Supersprint exhaust system, and Fabspeed mufflers. Work under current ownership has included reinstalling the catalytic converters and re-flashing the ECU to its factory settings. The rod bearing recall service is said to have been performed within the last two years, and the double-VANOS system has been upgraded.

Power is routed to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential, and the clutch was replaced under current ownership. A subframe reinforcement kit was reportedly installed in 2021.
The Carfax report shows the aforementioned “minor damage” as well as registration history in Florida and Utah. The report also shows an open airbag recall from January 2020.

title: 2002 BMW M3 Convertible
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 convertible is finished in Oxford Green II Metallic over gray leather, and it is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six linked with a six-speed SMG sequential transmission and a limited-slip differential. Equipment includes a black soft top, 18″ M double-spoke wheels, xenon headlights, Park Distance Control, heated power-adjustable front sport seats, a Kenwood head unit, a Harman Kardon sound system, and automatic climate control. This E46 M3 spent time with one registered owner in Connecticut prior to its recent acquisition by the selling dealer, and it now has 62k miles and is offered in New Jersey with a window sticker and a clean Connecticut title.

The car is finished in Oxford Green II Metallic (430) and is fitted with a black convertible soft top as well as xenon headlights, fog lights, Park Distance Control, rain-sensing wipers, and quad exhaust outlets. The Carfax report lists damage to the right-front corner in January 2003, and the selling dealer notes that the left-rear quarter panel and right-front fender have been refinished.

The 18″ M double-spoke Style 67 wheels are mounted with Continental ExtremeContact DWS 06 tires. The car was factory equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and braking is provided by four-wheel ventilated discs.

The cabin features heated power-adjustable front sport seats upholstered in gray leather, and Titan Shadow trim accents the dash and door panels. Interior amenities include automatic climate control, cruise control, a Kenwood head unit, a back-up camera, and Harman Kardon audio.

The multi-function leather-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 62k miles.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque. The timing guide and tensioner were replaced in December 2022, and an oil change was performed in January 2023.
Power is routed to the rear wheels via a six-speed SMG sequential transmission and a limited-slip differential. Additional photographs of the underside are shown in the gallery below.

The window sticker shows initial delivery to Continental BMW of Darien, Connecticut, and lists factory colors, equipment, options, and a total price of $60,395. Manufacturer’s literature and a tool kit are also included in the sale.
The Carfax report shows the aforementioned damage and lists registration history in Connecticut.

title: 2002 BMW M3 Coupe
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 coupe is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six linked with a replacement six-speed SMG sequential transmission and a limited-slip differential. It is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic over Imola Red Nappa leather, and equipment includes a Dinan exhaust system without catalytic converters as well as aftermarket 18″ wheels, Bilstein coilovers, a power sunroof, xenon headlights, Park Distance Control, power-adjustable front sport seats, an aftermarket navigation screen, Bavsound speakers, and automatic climate control. The car was acquired in December 2020 by the seller, who has subsequently added approximately 14k of the 147k indicated miles. This E46 M3 is now offered with the owner’s manual, service records detailing recent work, a damage-free Carfax report, and a clean Texas title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic (354) and is fitted with Shadowline trim as well as xenon headlights, a glass sunroof, tinted windows, Park Distance Control, a trunk lid spoiler, smoked taillight lenses, and quad exhaust outlets. A ding is noted in the right side of the hood, and the front valance is chipped beneath the left headlamp. The fog lamps have been removed along with their housings. Scrapes, rock chips, and other imperfections are shown up close in the gallery below.
Gray 18″ aftermarket wheels are mounted with Nitto NT555G2 tires. Bilstein PSS9 coilovers have been added.

The power-adjustable front sport seats and door-panel inserts are upholstered in Imola Red Nappa leather. Interior amenities include automatic climate control, cruise control, an aftermarket head unit, and Bavsound speakers. The headliner sags.

The multi-function leather-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 147k miles, approximately 14k of which were added under current ownership.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque. The seller notes that a rod bearing recall service was performed, and the double-VANOS system has reportedly been upgraded. The fan clutch was replaced in August 2022, and the upper radiator hose was changed in July of that year. Other work in 2022 included replacing an oxygen sensor and the throttle-position sensor in April as well as the throttle actuator in January. Fluids services were performed, the valves were adjusted, and the spark plugs were replaced in October 2021.

Power is routed to the rear wheels via a replacement six-speed SMG sequential transmission, and an invoice related to the replacement work can be seen in the gallery below. The clutch and flywheel were replaced in December 2020. The car is also equipped with a limited-slip differential, and a subframe reinforcement kit was reportedly installed under prior ownership. A Dinan exhaust system has been installed, and the catalytic converters have been removed.
The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage, an open airbag recall, and registration history in Oklahoma, Georgia and Texas.

title: 2002 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 convertible is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six linked with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential and is finished in Alpine White III over Cinnamon Nappa leather upholstery. Equipment includes the Premium Package as well as a black soft top, 19″ M Style 67 wheels, xenon headlights, fog lights, heated power-adjustable front sport seats, driver-seat position memory settings, an aftermarket infotainment unit, a Harman Kardon sound system, cruise control, and automatic climate control. The seller acquired the car in 2022 and has since added approximately 5k of the 90k miles. This E46 M3 is now offered with a tool kit, an accident-free Carfax report, and a clean Arizona title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Alpine White III (300) and is equipped with a black convertible soft top as well as fog lights, xenon headlights, front fender vents, headlight washers, and quad exhaust outlets. Replacement indicator bulbs were reportedly fitted under current ownership.

The 19″ M double-spoke Style 67 wheels are mounted with Hankook Ventus V12 tires measuring 225/40 up front and 255/35 at the rear. The car was factory equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and braking is provided by four-wheel ventilated discs.

The heated power-adjustable front sport seats are upholstered in Cinnamon Nappa leather, and white vinyl-wrapped trim adorns the dash, shifter surround, and door panels. M3-branded floor mats line the footwells, and interior amenities include automatic climate control, Harman Kardon audio, power windows and locks, driver-seat position memory settings, and an aftermarket infotainment unit with navigation and Bluetooth connectivity.

The multi-function leather-wrapped steering wheel features M-color stitching and frames a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 90k miles.
The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque. An oil change was performed in preparation for the sale.
Power is routed to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential.

The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage and lists history in Tennessee, Georgia, Florida, Illinois, and Arizona. A manufacturer safety recall related to the right-front airbag was issued in January 2020.

title: 2001 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2001 BMW M3 coupe is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six linked with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential, and it is finished in blue over gray leather. It is equipped with a power sunroof, Shadowline trim, xenon headlights, fog lights, automatic climate control, an aftermarket touchscreen stereo, and front sport seats, while modifications reportedly include aftermarket exhaust components, 19″ VMR wheels, and ECS Tuning coilovers in addition to aftermarket suspension components. The car spent time in several states before it was acquired by the seller in 2014, and work carried out under current ownership is said to have included replacing the rod bearings, reinforcing the subframe, changing the subframe and differential bushings, and fitting a replacement clutch assembly. This E46 M3 has 190k miles and is now offered with removed parts, a Carfax report, and a clean Alabama title in the seller’s name.

The car left the factory finished in Laguna Seca Blue (448), and it is fitted with Shadowline trim as well as a glass sunroof, a decklid spoiler, xenon headlights, fog lights, tinted glass, and quadruple exhaust outlets. A November 2004 entry on the Carfax report lists “disabling damage” occurring to the front of the car. Cracks in the body filler on the left-rear quarter panel were repaired in 2019, at which time the decklid, rear bumper cover, and rear quarter panels were refinished. The seller notes that cracked body filler is visible on the left-rear quarter panel, and additional blemishes reported by the seller include a cracked windshield, stone chips on the front fascia, and areas of worn finish on the hood and roof.

VMR 19″ V703 wheels are reportedly mounted over 15mm front and 5mm rear wheel spacers via Turner Motorsports wheel studs, and they are wrapped in 255/30 front and 275/30 rear Hankook Ventus V12 evo2 tires. The seller states that the car is equipped with a ZHP-specification steering gear, Turner Motorsports anti-roll bars, ECS Tuning coilovers, lower control arm travel limiters, urethane lower control arm bushings, Reddish rear subframe plates, and ECS Tuning CSL-style front brake caliper brackets and front brake rotors. Maintenance performed under current ownership is said to have included replacing the left-front lower control arm in 2014, changing the rear shock mounts in 2015, and replacing power steering lines and overhauling the front brake calipers in 2016 as well as replacing the steering rack circa 2019.

The cabin features seating surfaces upholstered in gray leather, while High-Gloss Black trim accents the color-coordinated dashboard and door panels. Appointments include automatic climate control, front sport seats, and an aftermarket touchscreen stereo that is reportedly linked to an amplifier and replacement front speakers. The seller states that the car is equipped with an aftermarket short shifter, and the shifter and parking brake lever feature microsuede boots with M-style stitching. A strut brace has been installed to the trunk along with custom trim panels. Per the Carfax report, a replacement passenger-side airbag was installed in May 2015. Work performed under current ownership is said to have included reupholstering the headliner, pillars, and front seats as well as refreshing the trunk and replacing the center console and the GM5 central locking module.

The multi-function leather-wrapped steering wheel features an M badge as well as tri-color stitching, and it frames a 185-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a variable redline, and gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 190k miles, approximately 57k of which have been added by the seller. The seller notes that the airbag and taillight warning lights are illuminated.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque. The seller states that the valves were adjusted and the double-VANOS system was overhauled with Biesan Solutions components in 2014, and the rod bearings were reportedly replaced in 2020. Additional maintenance under current ownership is said to have included replacing the timing chain tensioner, water pump, oil pump, engine mounts, and coil packs. A Mason Engineering strut tower brace spans the engine bay, and aftermarket exhaust components were reportedly installed in 2020. The car is not currently equipped with catalytic converters.

Power is delivered to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. Per the seller, the clutch assembly was replaced in 2018 and the subframe was reinforced in 2020. Additional maintenance carried out under current ownership reportedly included changing the subframe bushings, transmission mounts, and differential mounts. The seller notes a fluid leak from the engine bay as well as corrosion near a jack point, and additional photos of the underside are presented in the gallery below.
The removed factory exhaust components are included in the sale along with tools and various additional spare and removed parts.
Photos illustrating the subframe reinforcement and rod bearing replacement are presented near the end of the photo gallery below.
The Carfax report shows the aforementioned disabling damage to the front of the car in 2004 along with history in California, Arizona, Texas, Florida, Georgia, Tennessee, and Alabama.
Head over to our friends at Car & Driver to check out their December 2001 First Drive for the E46 BMW M3 coupe.

title: 2003 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2003 BMW M3 coupe remained registered in California and Nevada prior to the seller’s acquisition on BaT in August 2022 and now has 117k miles. The car is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic over gray Nappa leather and is powered by a 3.2-liter S54 inline-six linked with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. Modifications include a UUC Motorwerks/CORSA Performance exhaust system, Koni dampers, and a European-style center console and front bumper cover. Additional equipment includes 18″ M double-spoke wheels, a Harman Kardon sound system, aluminum pedal covers, a BMW Business CD stereo, and manually adjustable front seats. Service under current ownership is said to have consisted of reupholstering the driver’s seat, flushing the brake and power steering fluids, and replacing the A-pillar and cowl trim components, drive belts, and idler pulleys. This E46 M3 is now offered with partial service records, an accident-free Carfax report, and a clean Colorado title in the seller’s name.

The car was ordered without a sunroof and is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic. Features include Shadowline trim, fog lights, rain-sensing windshield wipers, LED tail lights, a trunk lid spoiler, quad exhaust outlets, and a European-style front bumper cover, which was reportedly fitted under current ownership. The left-rear window is inoperative, a dent is noted on the right door, scratches are shown up close in the gallery below, and the seller notes the windshield cowl trim has been replaced.

The 18″ M double-spoke Style 67 wheels are mounted with Continental ExtremeContact DWS 06 tires measuring 225/45 up front and 255/40 out back. Koni dampers have been fitted, and the car was factory equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC). Multiple wheels have curb marks, and the brake and power steering fluids were flushed under current ownership.

The cabin is upholstered in gray and features Nappa leather seating surfaces along with brushed aluminum shadow trim. M3-branded floor mats line the footwells, and additional appointments include aluminum pedal covers, a European-style center console, manually adjusted bolstered front seats, automatic climate control, cruise control, a BMW Business CD stereo, and Harman Kardon audio. Exterior wear is present and includes paint chipping.
Apex Racing 18″ alloy wheels are mounted with 280/65 Hankook racing slicks. The brakes and suspension have been modified and feature the following components:

The interior is equipped with Sparco fixed-back race seats and a black-finished roll cage. The rear seat, stereo, and air conditioning components have been removed and features include Safecraft harnesses, a CAE shifter, carbon-fiber trim, aluminum pedal covers, and Hard Motorsports door panels.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six had the rod bearings replaced with a Turner Motorsport kit in October 2019. title: Supercharged 2001 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed

Additional suspension work at that time included the installation of KW Variant 2 coilover kit as well as replacing the left-front lower control arm and the rear shock mounts.

excerpt: This 2002 BMW M3 coupe was acquired by the seller approximately four years ago, and it was subsequently overhauled and modified. Additional modifications include a color-changing vinyl wrap, a Rogue Engineering Stage 2 clutch kit, Supersprint headers, a Rogue Engineering Diablo exhaust system, MCS two-way adjustable coilover suspension, StopTech big-brake kits front and rear, a carbon-fiber sunroof plug and interior door panels, a yellow roll bar, Sabelt Titan fixed-back bucket seats, Schroth harnesses, CD stereo with navigation, and 18” Bimmerworld TE:AL wheels. The 18” Bimmerworld TE:AL wheels are secured on Rogue Engineering studs and mounted with Bridgestone Potenza RE-71R tires. Braking is through yellow-finished StopTech monoblock calipers equipped with PFC 11 pads, and slotted rotors are fitted at all four corners. The front control arm bushings and rear trailing arm bushings have reportedly been replaced, and suspension modifications include MCS two-way adjustable coilovers, Vorshlag front camber plates, Rogue Engineering strut tower braces, adjustable rear control arms, and a subframe reinforcement kit. Two spare wheels and tires will accompany the vehicle.

The seller states that the sound deadening was removed before fitting twin Sabelt Titan fixed-back bucket seats with Schroth multi-point harnesses. Additional equipment includes carbon-fiber door panels, fabric door pulls, a powder-coated yellow roll bar, a Rogue Engineering short-shift kit, and an aftermarket touchscreen CD stereo with navigation. The rear seats have been removed and are not included in the sale.

The OMP steering wheel with yellow stitching sits ahead of a 185-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a variable redline, and gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates approximately 141k miles, around 2k of which have been added during current ownership. The mileage tamper dot is illuminated, and total mileage is unknown.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was rebuilt during current ownership. Additional work included fitting the double-VANOS system with Beisan Systems components, installing an ECIS intake, an aluminum radiator, Supersprint headers, a Rogue Engineering Diablo exhaust system, and Moroso aluminum coolant tank, and replacing the water pump, fuel filter, oil cooler, and connecting rod bearings.

Power is sent to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual transmission with a Rogue Engineering Stage 2 performance clutch kit and a Diffsonline limited-slip differential with a 3.85:1 gear ratio and replacement bearings. Additional underbody images are provided in the gallery below.

The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage, lists an open recall for the passenger-side front airbag in 2020, and displays history in Texas, North Carolina, South Carolina, New York, and New Jersey through the most recent entry in December 2020.

Equipment includes a black soft top, 19″ Style 67 wheels, xenon headlights, Park Distance Control, K&N cold-air intake, Eisenmann exhaust, heated front seats, and a Harman Kardon sound system. Work under current ownership is said to have included the replacement of the tires, rear shocks, and brake pads and rotors. This E46 M3 has 61k miles and is now offered by the seller on behalf of their spouse with the owner’s manual, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Illinois title.

The car is finished in Imola Red II (405) and features a power-operated black convertible soft top as well as black trim, xenon headlights, smoked turn signal lenses, yellow fog lights, LED taillights, rear parking sensors, and quad exhaust outlets. The seller notes previous paintwork on the passenger door along with paint blemishes on the front bumper, hood, and passenger door. Photos of paint meter readings can be viewed in the gallery.

The 19″ M double-spoke Style 67 wheels show curb marks and are wrapped in 225/40 front and 255/35 rear General G-Max AS-05 tires reportedly mounted in August 2021. The seller notes that the rear shocks and the brake pads, rotors, and sensors were replaced in July 2022.

Brushed aluminum trim accents the cabin, which is upholstered in black and features power-adjustable heated front sport seats covered in Nappa leather. Amenities include automatic climate control, a ZHP weighted shift knob, a BMW Business CD stereo, and Harman Kardon audio. The headliner has separated from the top on the passenger side, and the seller notes peeling around the cup holders and indentations in the rear seats. The passenger airbag was replaced under a manufacturer’s safety recall in May 2022.

The multi-function leather-wrapped steering wheel fronts a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 61k miles, approximately 2k of which were added under current ownership.
The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six has been fitted with a K&N cold-air intake and Eisenmann exhaust system. An oil change was performed in May 2022.
The factory-fitted SMG transmission underwent a six-speed manual conversion under previous ownership.
The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage and lists registration history in Ohio, Wisconsin, Florida, and Illinois.

The cabin features power-adjustable and heated front seats trimmed in black Nappa leather, while Titan Shadow trim accents the interior surfaces. Amenities include automatic climate control, cruise control, an illuminated shift knob, an Alcantara handbrake lever, a Harman Kardon sound system, and an aftermarket head unit with navigation and a rear-view camera. The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque. Work performed in December 2021 included a valve adjustment, installation of a Beisan VANOS repair kit and ACL rod bearings, and replacement of the engine mounts, spark plugs, and ignition coils.

The factory-equipped SMG transmission was converted to a six-speed manual unit in December 2021 by VT Motorworks of Pleasanton, California. Additional work performed at the time of the transmission conversion included installation of a cruise control-enabled clutch switch as well as a replacement clutch and flywheel.

title: 2003 BMW M3 Convertible

Equipment includes a black soft top, 19″ M double-spoke wheels, xenon headlights, Park Distance Control, a Harman Kardon sound system, a BMW Business CD stereo, and automatic climate control. The car has spent its life in Florida, and it now has 76k miles. This E46 M3 is offered with the owner’s manual, a Carfax report, and a clean Florida title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic (354) and features a black convertible soft top as well as xenon headlights, fog lights, rain-sensing windshield wipers, LED tail lights, Park Distance Control, and quad exhaust outlets. The Carfax report lists an accident in April 2012 with damage resulting to the front of the car, and imperfections include scratches beneath the car and a ding in the left door.
The 19″ M double-spoke Style 67 wheels are wrapped in a mixture of Bridgestone and Yokohama tires. The car was factory equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC).

The cabin is upholstered in black and features Nappa leather seating surfaces, brushed aluminum shadow trim, power-adjustable front seats, automatic climate control, cruise control, a BMW Business CD stereo, and Harman Kardon audio. The seller reports that the stereo power button does not work, and the glovebox can only be opened using a key.

The multi-function leather-wrapped steering wheel fronts a 185-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a variable redline, and gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 76k miles, approximately 35k of which were added under current ownership.
The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque. Recent service includes an oil change.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed SMG sequential transmission and a limited-slip differential. Additional underside photographs are shown in the gallery below.
The Carfax report shows the aforementioned accident from April 2012 as well as registration history in Florida.

title: 40k-Mile 2006 BMW M3 Coupe Competition Package
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 coupe is finished in Silver Grey Metallic over M Texture Alcantara and black leather, and it is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six paired with a six-speed SMG sequential transmission and a limited-slip differential. Equipment includes the Competition Package as well as 19″ M cross-spoke wheels, xenon headlights, Park Distance Control, automatic climate control, and a BMW Business CD stereo. The current owner acquired the car in November 2018 and has since added approximately 4k of the car’s 40k indicated miles. This E46 M3 is now offered with a window sticker, the owner’s manual, service records, a damage-free Carfax report, and a clean Texas title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Silver Grey Metallic (A08) and was built without a sunroof. Features include Shadowline trim, xenon headlights, fog lights, LED tail lights, a trunk lid spoiler, and quad exhaust outlets. Photographs of paint-meter readings are shown in the gallery below.

The 19″ M Style 163 wheels are wrapped in Michelin Pilot Super Sport tires. The car was factory equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and the ZCP Competition Package added an upgraded steering rack and larger cross-drilled brake rotors.

The seats have black leather bolsters and M Texture Alcantara inserts, and the cabin features matching door panels and milled-effect aluminum trim. Equipment includes automatic climate control, cruise control, a BMW Business CD stereo, Park Distance Control, an auto-dimming rear-view mirror, and rain-sensing wipers.

The Alcantara-wrapped steering wheel fronts a 185-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a variable redline, and gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 40k miles, approximately 4k of which were added under current ownership.
The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque. An oil change was performed in November 2020.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed SMG sequential transmission and a limited-slip differential. Additional photographs of the underside can be seen in the gallery below.
The window sticker lists initial delivery to Rallye BMW in Port Washington, New York, as well as factory options and a total suggested retail price of $58,170.
The Carfax report shows no accidents or damage, an open airbag recall from January 2020, and registration history in New York and Texas.

title: 21k-Mile 2005 BMW M3 Convertible 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2005 BMW M3 convertible is finished in Alpine White III over Imola Red Nappa leather, and it is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six paired with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. Equipment includes the Cold Weather Package as well as a black soft top, 19″ M double-spoke wheels, xenon headlights, Park Distance Control, heated seats, a Harman Kardon sound system, and automatic climate control. The car has spent its life in Missouri and New York, and it now has 21k miles. This E46 M3 convertible is now offered by the selling dealer with the removed chrome-finished grilles, a clean Carfax report, and a clean New York title.

The car is finished in Alpine White III (300) and features a black convertible soft top as well as xenon headlights, fog lights, rain-sensing windshield wipers, LED tail lights, Park Distance Control, and quad exhaust outlets. Black-finished kidney grilles with M-color accents have been added, and the removed grille inserts are included in the sale. The selling dealer notes imperfections including rock chips, a ding in the left-rear wheel arch, and scratches underneath the front bumper cover, which has been drilled for a license-plate bracket.
The 19″ M Style 67 wheels with curb marks are wrapped in Yokohama Avid Envigor tires measuring 225/40 up front and 255/35 out back. The car was factory equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC).

The seats and door panels are trimmed in Imola Red Nappa leather, and the cabin features a black dashboard and brushed aluminum shadow trim. Equipment includes power-adjustable and heated front seats, automatic climate control, cruise control, an auto-dimming mirror, and Harman Kardon audio. An imperfection is shown near the outer edge of the right door panel, and the selling dealer notes wear on the driver’s seat upper bolster as well as a fold in the driver’s floor mat.

The multi-function leather-wrapped steering wheel fronts a 185-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a variable redline, along with gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 21k miles.
The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque. An oil change was performed in December 2021.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. Additional photographs of the underside are shown in the gallery below.
The Carfax report shows no accidents or damage and lists registration history in Missouri and New York.

title: 2006 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 coupe has spent its life in Washington and Virginia, and it was sold on BaT in March 2020 prior to its acquisition by the seller. The car is finished in Carbon Black Metallic over Cinnamon Nappa leather and is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six paired with a six-speed transmission that has been converted to manual operation. Equipment includes the Premium Package as well as 18″ M double-spoke wheels, a power sunroof, Park Distance Control, automatic climate control, and a BMW Business CD stereo. Service since 2020 has reportedly included replacing the battery and tires. This E46 M3 shows 57k miles and is now offered with the owner’s manual, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Virginia title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Carbon Black Metallic (416) and features Shadowline trim as well as fog lights, a glass sunroof, rain-sensing windshield wipers, LED tail lights, Park Distance Control, a trunk lid spoiler, and quad-exhaust outlets. Paint chips are noted along with signs of wear on the driver’s door handle.
The 18″ M double-spoke Style 67 wheels are wrapped in Michelin Pilot Sport A/S 3+ tires that were reportedly installed in 2020. The car was factory equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC).

The cabin is upholstered in Cinnamon and features Nappa leather seating surfaces, a black dashboard and carpets, and brushed aluminum trim. Equipment includes power-adjustable front seats, automatic climate control, cruise control, rubber floor mats, and a BMW Business CD stereo. The sale includes a set of carpeted floor mats that are shown in the gallery below.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel fronts a 185-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a variable redline, and gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer shows 57k miles, approximately 200 of which were added under current ownership. A non-SMG gauge cluster faceplate is said to have been installed under previous ownership.
The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque. The battery is said to have been replaced in September 2021.

The factory SMG transmission was converted to a six-speed manual gearbox by AMS AutoGroup in Lakewood, Washington under previous ownership. Additional photographs of the underside are shown in the gallery below.
The Carfax report shows no accidents or damage and lists registration history in Washington and Virginia.

title: 2001 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2001 BMW M3 coupe is said to have been sold new in Japan, and it has spent its life in Arizona since it was brought to the US in March 2001. The car is finished in Laguna Seca Blue over gray Nappa leather and is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six paired with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. Equipment includes the Premium Package as well as 18″ M double-spoke wheels, a power sunroof, xenon headlights, heated seats, a Harman Kardon sound system, and automatic climate control. The current owner acquired the car in June 2021 and has since added approximately 600 of the car’s 145k indicated miles. This E46 M3 is now offered at no reserve with the owner’s manual, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Arizona title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Laguna Seca Blue (448) and features Shadowline trim as well as xenon headlights, fog lights, a glass sunroof, tinted windows, a trunk lid spoiler, and quad-exhaust outlets. The seller reports that the nose was repainted in October 2021, reportedly to correct stone chips.

The 18″ M double-spoke Style 67 wheels are wrapped in mixed Michelin rubber, with 225/45 Pilot Super Sport tires up front and 255/40 Pilot Sport 4S tires out back. The suspension has been modified with Ohlins springs and dampers, Dinan strut bars, and adjustable ECS Tuning rear control arms.

The cabin is upholstered in grey and features Nappa leather seating surfaces, high-gloss black trim, and a black upper dashboard. Equipment includes power-adjustable and heated front seats, automatic climate control, cruise control, an auto-dimming rear-view mirror, a BMW Business CD stereo, and Harman Kardon audio.

The multi-function leather-wrapped steering wheel fronts a 185-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a variable redline, and gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 145k miles, approximately 600 of which were added under current ownership.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six has been modified with a Dinan cold-air intake and Stage 3 tune. The seller notes that the rod bearing recall service was performed in November 2021, and the double-VANOS system is said to have been upgraded.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. A subframe reinforcement kit was reportedly installed in December 2021.
The Carfax report shows no accidents or damage and lists registration history in Arizona following the car’s import from Japan in March 2001.

title: 44k-Mile 2001 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2001 BMW M3 coupe is finished in Phoenix Yellow Metallic over black Nappa leather and is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six mated to a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. Equipment includes 18″ Style 67 wheels, xenon headlights with aftermarket halos, a power sunroof, heated front seats, automatic climate control, and a Harman Kardon audio system. The car was first registered in Connecticut and spent time in Illinois and Indiana prior to the seller’s acquisition in 2013. This E46 M3 has 44k miles and is now offered with a clean Carfax report and a clean Indiana title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Phoenix Yellow Metallic with body-color painted front corner reflectors and black kidney grille surrounds, fender vent trims, and rear badging. Features include xenon headlights with aftermarket halos, tinted windows, fog lights, Shadowline trim, a glass sunroof, LED taillights, a trunk lid spoiler, and quad-exhaust outlets. Paint meter readings are provided in the gallery below.

This is a re-list after the vehicle previously sold on BaT in November 2021 and the winning bidder failed to follow through with their commitment to purchase. This was not due to any fault with the vehicle. The winner has been banned from future participation on BaT and their buyer’s fee was not refunded.

Silver 18″ Style 67 wheels are wrapped in Hankook V12 Evo tires measuring 225/45 up front and 255/40 out back. Braking is handled by four-wheel discs with drilled and slotted rotors at each corner. The car is equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC).

The cabin features seating surfaces upholstered in black Nappa leather with high gloss black trim on the doors, dashboard, and center console. Amenities include heated and power-adjustable front seats, automatic climate control, cruise control, and a Harman Kardon audio system.

The M-branded multi-function steering wheel fronts a 185-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a variable redline, and gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 44k miles, approximately 5k of which were added by the seller.
The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six was factory rated at 333 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque when new. The seller states that the ignition coils were replaced in 2016.
Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential.
The Carfax report shows no accidents or damage and lists registration history in Connecticut, Illinois, and Indiana. The lien noted on the report was released in 2015.

title: 2004 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2004 BMW M3 coupe is finished in Mystic Blue Metallic over black Nappa leather and is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six mated to a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. Equipment includes 18″ cross-spoke wheels, Ohlins coilovers, CSL-spec brake rotors, a power sunroof, xenon headlights, rear Park Distance Control, heated seats, navigation, a Harman Kardon sound system, and automatic climate control. The car has been registered in Illinois and Massachusetts, and it was acquired in October 2018 by the current owner, who has since added approximately 10k of the car’s 66k indicated miles. This E46 M3 is now offered by the seller on behalf of the owner in New Hampshire with a clean Carfax report and a clean Massachusetts title.

The car is finished in Mystic Blue Metallic (A07) and features Shadowline trim as well as black grille surrounds, xenon headlights, fog lights, a glass sunroof, rain-sensing windshield wipers, LED tail lights, rear parking sensors, a trunk lid spoiler, and four exhaust outlets.

The car was factory equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and the suspension has been modified with Ohlins Road & Track coil-over springs. Stopping power is from gold calipers over CSL-spec rotors at all four corners, and stainless-steel brake lines have been installed.

The cabin is upholstered in black and features Nappa leather seating surfaces as well as black cube trim, power-adjustable and heated front seats, automatic climate control, cruise control, navigation, and Harman Kardon audio.

The Carfax report shows no accidents or damage and lists history in Illinois and Massachusetts.

title: 33k-Mile 2005 BMW M3 Coupe Competition Package 6-Speed
interior_color: Anthracite M Texture Alcantara & Black Leather Upholstery
listing_details: Anthracite M Texture Alcantara & Black Leather Upholstery
excerpt: This 2005 BMW M3 coupe is finished in Silver Grey Metallic over M Texture Alcantara and black leather upholstery, and it is powered by a 3.2-liter inline-six paired with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. Factory equipment includes the Competition Package, xenon headlights, automatic climate control, and a factory Hi-Fi sound system with a CD player, while modifications are said to include a carbon-fiber front lip spoiler, Eibach springs, underdrive pulleys, a K&N cold-air intake, CSL-specification exhaust headers, and aftermarket engine-management software. The car was first registered in Wyoming and was moved to Utah when it was acquired in 2010 by the seller, who has added approximately 27k of its 33k indicated miles. Service since 2018 has included a valve adjustment and replacement of the tires, spark plugs, valve-cover gasket, clutch components, and an ignition coil. This E46 M3 is now offered with a window sticker, manufacturer’s literature, service records, spare parts, an accident-free Carfax report, and a clean Utah title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in Silver Grey Metallic (A08) and was built without a sunroof. Features include a carbon-fiber front lip spoiler, xenon headlights, body-color front corner markers, Shadowline trim, fog lights, rain-sensing windshield wipers, tinted windows, LED taillights, a trunk-lid spoiler, “CS” rear badging, and quad exhaust outlets. Paint-meter readings can be viewed in the photo gallery below.

Factory 19″ M cross-spoke wheels are wrapped in 235/35 front and 265/30 rear Michelin Pilot Sport 4S tires that were mounted in May 2021. The car is equipped with Dynamic Stability Control (DSC), and the Competition Package added an upgraded steering rack and larger cross-drilled brake rotors when compared with the standard M3. Eibach Pro-Kit springs were installed in 2007.

The cabin features seating surfaces trimmed in M Texture Alcantara with black leather accents. Equipment includes manually adjustable front sport seats, a shorter center console without a front armrest, LED interior lighting, aluminum pedals, an Alcantara shifter boot, automatic climate control, and a Hi-Fi sound system with a BMW Business CD stereo.

The Alcantara-wrapped sport steering wheel features a yellow centering stripe and fronts a 185-mph speedometer, a tachometer with a variable redline, and gauges for coolant temperature, oil temperature, and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates approximately 33k miles, nearly 27k of which were added by the seller.

The 3.2-liter S54 inline-six is said to have been fitted with underdrive pulleys, a K&N cold-air intake, aftermarket engine-management software, and CSL-specification exhaust headers with welded post-catalyst oxygen-sensor bungs. Work since 2018 reportedly has included a valve adjustment, oil changes, and replacement of the valve-cover gasket, spark plugs, and the cylinder-four ignition coil.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transmission and an M Variable Lock differential. The clutch delay valve has been removed, the factory clutch and flywheel were reinstalled in 2018, and the left rear axle seal was replaced in 2021.

The car is supplied with manufacturer’s literature, service records from current and prior ownership, aftermarket parts literature, a tool kit, a car cover, and removed spare parts as shown in the gallery.
The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage and lists history in Wyoming and Utah. The lien noted on the report was paid off in 2017.

title: 2003 BMW M3 Coupe 6-Speed

title: 2006 BMW M3 Coupe Competition Package 6-Speed
excerpt: This 2006 BMW M3 coupe was first delivered to BMW of Dallas, Texas, and it was acquired in September 2010 by the seller, who has since added approximately 31k of the car’s 70k indicated miles. The car is finished in Interlagos Blue Metallic (A30) and features Shadowline trim as well as xenon headlights, fog lights, a glass sunroof, rain-sensing windshield wipers, LED tail lights, rear parking sensors, a trunk lid spoiler, and quad-exhaust outlets.
